Great One', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well Worth it!', 'author': 'meltoncub', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for a lightweight jacket in a black color to go with more of my clothes (and not show dirt like some colors!). I\'ve had a Columbia jacket before, so I knew that it would probably hold up well. I was not disappointed - it\'s a fine jacket!It is that though - a jacket. I\'d say that the best times to use it would be in the late fall to early spring. It is fine for winter and will keep you warm, unless there\'s a lot of cold sharp wind. Where I live, the average "winter" temperature is probably in the 30s. The jacket was lacking on a few occasions and I found myself wishing for my heavier coat. However, for basic outdoor use, town trips and general everyday wear, I think it works just fine. It keeps me warm indoors and comfortable outdoors - although I think it is better suited for cool days rather than cold ones. For an idea of how warm you\'ll be - think "heavy sweatshirt."Some reviews stated that it had issues with static. I\'m no fan of static, so that bothered me a little. It does have some, but it stays in the jacket. When you take the jacket off, off goes the static (for the most part). But really, what could be expected? It is fleece. Fleece just does that sometimes.As to the fit - it probably runs a little small. I wear a medium in tees and a M to L in most other shirts. I ordered a large in the jacket, and it fits fine with some extra room to boot, but not enough that it\'s sloppy looking.Overall, it\'s very nice, and I\'m quite happy with it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really Nice', 'author': 'Fleming Island Reviewer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I took a gamble on buying this top, and I am glad I did! It is very well made, and is not heavy weight material allowing for layering if you want to be warmer. Works perfectly for a Florida ‚Äúwinter‚Äù!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Pockets are a little small', 'author': "Laney's Mom", 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have a system of jacket layers that depends on how cold it is outside. This jacket is the lightest, first layer, replacing a Helly Hansen jacket that lasted almost 20 years! In terms of weight, it's a perfect light layer and it's very comfortable.I docked it one star, though, because of the pockets. To be fair, I carry a lot of stuff in my pockets: keys (with pepper spray), mini wallet, phone, poop bags, and treat bag. But it all fit in the HH jacket without a problem.The HH jacket was a medium (this is a large) and fit much more snugly. The pockets in the HH jacket, however, could hold so much more, even with less expandable space. The difference is the HH jacket pocket began at the side seam (running down from under the armpit), so the pocket depth was effectively from the side seam to the zipper. In this Columbia jacket, there's a princess seam (curved seam that makes the jacket more fitted at the waist, running about halfway between the side seam and the zipper), which is where the pocket starts. It cuts the depth down by almost half. While everything technically fits in the pockets, I need to zip them to keep stuff from falling out, which I rarely did with the HH jacket.2 other minor quibbles, not worth docking stars: I'd love a breast pocket, where I'd keep my mini wallet and poop bags. I'd also love a hanging loop - a little loop of fabric next to the label at the neckline used to hang the jacket on a hook. LL Bean jackets have both of these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Lars', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this jacket so much. I keep rebuying over the years. So comfy for work. I‚Äôm constantly on the move at work and yet I don‚Äôt get over heated in this but instead remain super cozy and comfy during the day. I would wear this everyday if I could lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women's Lightweight Water-Resistant Hooded Puffer Coat (Available in Plus Size)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠êThe Amazon Essentials Women's Lightweight Water-Resistant Hooded Puffer Coat is an absolute gem in my winter wardrobe! This packable and travel-friendly jacket has proven to be a versatile and reliable companion in various weather conditions.The water-resistant feature adds a practical touch, keeping me dry and comfortable during unexpected rain or snow. The lightweight design is perfect for layering, providing warmth without the bulk, and the inclusion of a hood adds an extra layer of protection against the elements.One of the standout features is its packability. This coat effortlessly folds into a compact size, making it incredibly convenient for travel. Whether I'm headed for a weekend getaway or packing for a longer trip, this puffer coat is a space-saving essential that doesn't compromise on functionality.The fit is flattering, and the overall quality of the jacket is impressive, especially considering its affordable price point. The variety of available colors is a nice touch, allowing for personal style preferences.In summary, the Amazon Essentials Lightweight Water-Resistant Hooded Puffer Coat is a winner in terms of style, functionality, and portability. It's a must-have for anyone seeking a reliable and travel-friendly winter coat. Five stars without a doubt! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice winter coat', 'author': 'Ellis Joens', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this coat! This has become my everyday coat to throw on during the Chicago winters. It would be a little too light during the worst of the winter, when temperatures stay well below freezing, but on a day where it's 40 or 50 degrees Fahrenheit, a bit of a breeze perhaps, this coat is more than capable of keeping you warm. And it does it without being too large or bulky--in fact, the coat itself is one of the more lightweight winter coats I've ever had, easy to pack up or travel with or just stuff behind your seat in a restaurant or movie theater. But the material that fills it definitely keeps you warmer than the light weight might indicate. It's a good fit and flattering too, and some nice choices of colors to pick from. I'm very satisfied with this purchase, and would recommend this coat to anyone looking for one!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars found a bag this can stuff into...', 'author': 'sunnydaysahead', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'downgrading below review to 4 stars. why?:1. i have worn one coat only a few times, and the zipper is totally messed up. i actually noticed this soon after purchasing but was like \'i\'ll deal with it, after a few tries i can get it to work.\' but .... now it\'s not working at all. i dont think the other two colors i bought have this problem but i haven\'t worn them much yet. i suppose they had to put in a lightweight zipper but i wish it worked bc now i have to throw away a pretty new coat.2. this coat i\'m wearing, the green one, has already ripped. the fabric is thin. perhaps this comes with the territory of being ultralight? but my other ultralight jackets by 32 degrees i wear all the time have not ripped.3. i wrote below how you need to buy a separate bag to pack this in, and i did buy it. unfortunalty i forget to bring it, though i will try attaching it to my other amazon coat (I have this coat in 3 colors). but upon thinking about it, it is really annoying that they just didn\'t design the coat\'s bag correctly in the first place, making it much bigger. no one should have to buy a separate bag. i was at the museum of natural history the other day and was so annoyed i could NOT pack the coat into amazon\'s attached bag (i forgot to bring the separate bag i bought, and yes i should have replaced amazon\'s bag with mine. but the fact that i am tasked with having to buy a separate bag and replacing amazon\'s bag with my new one is annoying. i do not have this problem with other brands. i wouldn\'t buy this again unless they fix the other issues.coat is great, wish it came in prettier colors. i wear a L in sweatpants, dresses, and usually in coats in general i size up to an XL. first i got this in a L and thought it was a bit snug...i looked a bit like a stuffed sausage. then i got it in an XL and it really made me look bigger/bulkier. went back to a L and am satisfied. yes i look a bit like a stuffed sausage but id prefer that than to looking larger. even with the L, i can wear a fleece underneath and still zip it up.cons--i am almost 5\'8. i wish this were about 2-3" longer - it doesnt cover the part of my thighs that i\'m not happy with, i have to wear a long t shirt.-the sack it comes with - this coat does not stuff into it. i just got a 32 degree brand jacket and that easily stuffs into the bag it comes with, in several seconds flat. this? no way. fo this coat, i had to buy "Granite Gear AirBags Stuff Sack Set - 2 7L" - i just guessed on the 7 liter size and wham, was lucky, this coat stuffed right into that. wish this came with a bigger stuff sack so i didn\'t have to buy expensive stuff sacks on my own.-i\'m not a fan of the colors. i wish it came in tan, a pink, and a prettier shade of blue. i was kind of shocked they don\'t have a basic tan color. i can see how people get addicted to these - i am keeping the black, the green, and the red, but i\'m not in love with the red, i wish it were more of a cherry red.-i wish this were just a tad more shapely, with a more defined waist and a bit of a flair, but that\'s just me, i\'m super feminine. this isn\'t bad, it\'s certainly better than how uniqlo looked on me. i have curves.pros-really is lightweight, and in mid 30 degree weather in NYC, i wore a fleece under this, and was warm enough!this has got me obsessed with the idea of travling light. also when you wear it you can feel the lightweightness of it it\'s like a freeing feeling. i have a bigger, much heavier down coat and this isn\'t QUITE as warm as that, so i will save that one, but this definitely makes me feel light and free while still keeping me warm.-pockets are nice, i put my hands in them and they stay warm-portability. again, i was annoyed i had to buy a separate stuff sack for this, but i can see how, when i travel from nyc to florida, it will be really, really nice to be able to stuff this in a little bag rather than schlep it around.so i am keeping these, but i also am going to try the 32 degree brand bc they have longer coats, and one in tan. i\'ll probably end up keeping ALL of them. just in love.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight but warm', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This coat is good for when you\'re running errands or out and don\'t need fancy outerwear. It\'s lightweight but fairly warm. I would caution against ordering any of the lighter colors. I ordered several, including the coral pink, but you can see the shadow of the stuffing through the fabric because it is thin. I went with the navy blue and don\'t have that problem with the fabric. I\'m 5\'6" 185 lbs and ordered the XL. It was roomy enough to wear thick sweaters underneath, but not too loose.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Difficult Zippers', 'author': 'Julie', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The coat is light weight, comfortable, and pretty warm. I really like it. But, every zipper is difficult. It does not zip up easily, and the pocket Ipoers stick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice', 'author': 'Todd F. Bigelow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the Stone color, perfect off white, creamy color. I purchased this to wear for a spring trip abroad and I think it will be perfect. title: Women's Lightweight Long-Sleeve Water-Resistant Packable Puffer Jacket (Available in Plus Size)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'Alena Cooper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket has such a nice cut to it- very flattering and gives some shape making it look and feel like a much more expensive jacket. All around a solid well made and pretty jacket that it is well worth the price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A Winter Essential: Amazon Essentials Women's Lightweight Long-Sleeve Puffer Jacket Review", 'author': 'Jon Prince', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Amazon Essentials Women's Lightweight Long-Sleeve Water-Resistant Puffer Jacket has quickly become my go-to winter companion. If you're searching for an affordable yet high-quality puffer jacket that offers warmth, style, and protection from the elements, look no further.Pros:Impressive Warmth: Despite its lightweight design, this puffer jacket offers remarkable warmth. The synthetic insulation effectively traps heat, keeping you cozy in cold temperatures without the bulk.Water-Resistant: The water-resistant outer shell provides protection against light rain and snow. It's an excellent choice for wet and chilly days when you need to stay dry.Flattering Fit: The jacket features a tailored fit that flatters the body's contours without feeling restrictive. It maintains a feminine silhouette while offering room for layering.Comfortable Design: The long sleeves and high collar provide additional warmth and comfort. The jacket zips up easily, and the zipper functions smoothly.Packs Well: This jacket is lightweight and compressible, making it easy to pack for travel. It doesn't take up much space in your luggage.Variety of Colors: Amazon Essentials offers a variety of colors, allowing you to choose a shade that suits your style and matches your winter wardrobe.Affordable Price: The jacket offers excellent value for its quality and features. It provides the warmth and protection of higher-priced alternatives without breaking the bank.Cons:Limited Thickness: While it offers adequate warmth for most winter conditions, it may not be sufficient for extremely cold climates without additional layering.No Hood: This jacket does not have a hood, which might be a drawback for those looking for extra head protection in rainy or snowy weather. However, you can pair it with a separate hooded layer.In summary, the Amazon Essentials Women's Lightweight Long-Sleeve Water-Resistant Puffer Jacket is a budget-friendly gem that excels in providing warmth, comfort, and style. Whether you're heading out for a casual winter stroll or need a versatile jacket for everyday wear, it delivers on all fronts. Its water-resistant feature is a bonus for unpredictable weather, and the variety of available colors ensures you can find the perfect match for your wardrobe. While it may not be the thickest jacket for extreme cold, it offers fantastic value for its price point and is an excellent choice for milder winter climates. I highly recommend it as a reliable and stylish winter essential.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect lightweight jacket', 'author': 'Jennifer Barlow', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Ordered the pink one for my daughter and she loves it. It is so cute, lightweight, and great quality. Ordered a size up and it fits perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy & Compact!', 'author': 'RD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As someone who's always on the lookout for practical yet stylish outdoor gear, stumbling upon the Amazon Essentials Women's Lightweight Puffer Jacket felt like hitting the jackpot. With its promise of being water-resistant and packable, it seemed tailor-made for my spontaneous adventures and the unpredictable weather in my city.The true gem of this jacket, is its packability. It folds down into its own pocket, transforming into a compact pouch that fits in my tote or backpack with ease. This feature has made it my go-to choice for travel and day trips, knowing I can stow it away without it taking up precious space.Despite its lightweight design, this jacket provides a surprising amount of warmth. The long sleeves and zippered pockets are thoughtful touches, adding to its functionality and warmth.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My absolute favorite jacket', 'author': 'Diana M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My daughter bought this exact same jacket, in the black color. She was raving about how happy she was with it, as well as the price. I like bright colors so I bought my own "pink" one. It\'s light as a feather, rain resistant, sturdy, and absolutely adorable. I get compliments wherever I go. If it\'s a little chilly outside, I just wear a light hoody underneath my jacket and the combination keeps me very warm because of the type of material that the jacket is made from. It\'s a perfect windbreaker and very well made. I have had this jacket for a long time and washed it multiple times, and it still has held up. No seam splitting, no pocket tearing, no issues at all. It\'s a high quality jacket that I would recommend to anyone. Both my daughter and I really like this product. Note: to keep it water resistant, I wash it in a regular washer cycle, but I don\'t put it in the dryer. I just put it on a hanger and hang it on my shower curtain. It actually dries with just a few hours. Amazing. 5 Stars from me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute & decent price', 'author': 'Dabaddestüíï', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hi!So I looked at reviews prior to buying a LOT of ppl said it runs 2 sizes too smallI am typically a M in women (when there is stretch) then I saw another review saying the woman was my exact height and weight (totally forgot weight is distributed differently ) so I went up 3SIZES !Honestly I could‚Äôve went with a L OR XLI GOT A XXL IT FITS GOOD(A bit big , but nothing too noticeable) arm length is perfect & it comes a little bit under the top of my bottom close to the middle but not quite .I am 5‚Äô7-5‚Äô8195lbs-200lbs34B44 hipsSo tall and thicker at the bottom small on top .. updateOrdered a L & it fit PERFECT LITERALLY WITH ROOM FOR A LIGHTWEIGHT SWEATER UNDER . & it is warm .So def size up by ONE', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I Love this Jacket', 'author': 'Ms Rose', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Buy your normal size...it Fits perfect. True to size. I feared that these might run a bit small for me, so at first I bought a man's, Navy 2X, (also bought the hubby one) I normally size down one size to fit in a man size. It was too small in the waist and the arms were 6 inches too long. I came back to the womens department still fearing it would be too snug, so I jumped up a size to a 4X Camel cheetah and to my surprise it was huge on me, but pretty. Finally I bought the only color in my actual size, the 3X blue cheetah and it fits wonderfully with room to breathe and wear a sweater if I wished. The fabric feels soft and silky. The jacket is very lightweight and the print is far prettier in person than imagined. You can hardly tell the print until you're in the sunshine. I recommend you purchase your usual size. These seem to be designed to give you room for movement and layers.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this jacket!', 'author': 'sachem92', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this jacket! I was finally visiting a cold climate and decided to splurge -- this jacket is warm, looks cute, has pockets, drops a little over the waistband, comfyband has neck protection -- and it really does squash down into a small bag. 5 stars all around!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just right weight and warmth.', 'author': 'Debra A. Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this lightweight jacket! It's just right for those in between days we have been getting in the north! It keeps you warm even at 34 degrees and is still comfortable on 50 degree days too, when the wind is blowing and still chilly. It is a snug fit, not loose at all. I am 4ft 10in. and weigh about 102 lbs. and I ordered the XS. It fits fine, but if I wanted to wear layers or a very heavy sweater under it, I should've ordered a small instead, just so you know. The Emerald color is beautiful, that's just an added bonus! All in all, I would highly recommend this little gem of a jacket!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comparable to Uniqlo', 'author': 'Razzle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I actually was looking through Uniqlo's website initially but along the way there was SO many navigation issues that I gave up. Plus, comes with the same kind of travel bag too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women's Lightweight Water-Resistant Sherpa-Lined Hooded Puffer
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'kjp', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is lightweight and warm. It fits well and is attractive. The pockets are roomy and when fully zipped protects my neck from the cold.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice fall jacket', 'author': 'MomM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have to say I‚Äôve never purchased an Amazon item of clothing. I am pleasantly surprised in the quality of this jacket. It‚Äôs lightweight but warm for cool weather. The lining on the body and hood is butter soft. The sleeves are a bit long, but the cuffs hold them up so they stay at wrist level. The back is a tad bit longer to cover and not go up if you bend over. Nice purchase at reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great cozy and warm jacket!', 'author': 'Frank N.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this jacket so much I bought it twice. The first one I bought in my usual size and was surprised because it felt slightly too big, so I bought it again - without returning the first one - in a size down. That one fit better, but I love them both so much I am not returning the big one! I'm just going to use the bigger one for working in the yard or mucking about around the house or when it is super cold and I want to layer a bunch underneath. The one that fits a little more tailored I'll wear out when I want to look a little more put together or when it is warmer and I don't need to layer as much underneath. This jacket feels very well made, it's super comfortable and warm. It's not as loud as other puffer jackets, which I really like a lot. The zippers are quality. The sherpa-style warm lining has not come off on my clothes. Also I am able to slip it off and on over my Columbia and other brands of zippered fleece jackets with no problems. It goes on and off smoothly without any tugging or issues. I love the pockets and I especially love the sleeves and the cuff part at the wrist. The hood is great and doesn't come down over my face. I washed them both in cold and dried on low in the dryer and there were no issues. They are soft and warm and really just great jackets. I bought the ones that says they are navy with pink flowers, but to me is looks more like black or maybe a very dark navy with fall or autumn leaves or something... whatever it is, it's super cute! :) It's nice to have a jacket that isn't boring basic black like all my other ones but also isn't a bright bold color. I've tried white jackets in the past but they always start looking dingy or dirty after awhile. So this one with the cute botanical pattern is lovely and a refreshing change. I'm very happy with my purchase and might try to buy some more as gifts for friends and family.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm and pretty', 'author': 'Angela H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Bought XX-Large and it fits me well. (5'2, 190 lbs) This coat just looks nice on you. The fit is flattering. I ordered the navy blue and the color is nice but my favorite thing is how big the pockets are. A lot of coats have small pockets and your gloves always fall out, but this one has nice big pockets to keep your hands toasty and stuff won't fall out of them. The hood is perfect too. Zipper seems sturdy. One thing though, is that I washed it once and I did notice a couple of snags so next time I will turn it inside out when I wash it. But i love it and it was a great sale price!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute, cozy and warm', 'author': 'Melissa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The title of my review sums up this jacket. I love the look and color of the jacket and the furry inside makes the jacket very warm. I was able to wear very lightweight clothing underneath and still be plenty warm, even in single digit temperatures. I like that the sleeves don‚Äôt have the fuzzy lining - it is a more slick fabric which makes it so much easier to put on and take off the jacket while wearing long sleeve shirts. I also appreciated the cuff at the end of the sleeve which helped keep the warmth in the sleeves. The jacket definitely doesn‚Äôt pack down like a less bulky down jacket, but it is light enough that I just wound it through the bungee cords on my backpack to carry it if I wasn‚Äôt wearing it. Sizing seems to be spot on. XL is what I normally wear and the XL fit perfectly. I ordered the XXL to try on too and it definitely looked baggy and less cute/fitted. If you want to wear bulky clothes like sweaters underneath, you may need to go up a size so the sleeves can accommodate that, but I found the jacket to be so warm that I never wanted more than a lightweight shirt underneath.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket for cold and Rainy weather', 'author': 'Koigirl1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just moved from Florida so please understand I think 40 degree weather is freezing :) That being said , this is a great jacket. Roomy, lightweight, but the fleece/sherpa lining is so toasty and the pockets, as other reviewers have noticed, are huge and deep. You can put your phone and a small wallet in one and still have room to spare . The hood is roomy as well, but stays out of your eyes when its up. Also, in rainy cold weather this is pretty darn waterproof, and when it gets wet it dries inside in a jiffy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warmer that expected!', 'author': 'karadione', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this coat in an XL (same as my women's shirt size, I wear a L in unisex sizing). I love it! Not bulky. Much warmer than expected. Current temp is 20¬∞F and it's perfect. Hidden cuffs around wrists. Super soft lining though hood & body, slick lining inside sleeves. Would definitely buy again!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Returned due to size', 'author': 'vics49548', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This is a nice coat. Lightweight and seems warm enough. However it runs a size small so I returned it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Winter Coat', 'author': 'Karen Kaye', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I cannot say enough great things about this coat. It kept me warm even on the coldest days during recess duty. It would be 10 degrees out with wind and I would be toasty warm. I have had heavier and bulkier coats that didn‚Äôt keep me as warm as this coat. I like that it isn‚Äôt bulky and that the lining is soft. The hood is great and doesn‚Äôt fall down. I bought the coat to wear during the fall but I have kept wearing it all winter. I think I will get another one in a different color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The lined pockets are a game-changer!', 'author': 'Christina Rado', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I live in the mid south where you never know what the temperature is going to be. This was a solid purchase for a really good price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars WORKS FOR SCOTLAND!!!', 'author': 'Jessica S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I took a trip to Scotland back in October and wanted to find a jacket that would keep me warm/dry but wouldn't be as bulky as a coat. I especially love the plaid lining inside (maybe because it made me feel like a true Scot?).A lightweight jacket that keeps you decently warm/dry while making you look chic? I say yes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The lining pilled after 2 weeks of use', 'author': 'Reebs', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'It‚Äôs a pretty coat and the weight of the outer fabric is nice. Minimal sheen on the navy color. Not noisy or swishy when I walk. The pockets have a snap closure and it lacks an inner slip pocket. I wore this daily on a 2 week trip in mild winter temps. Had to fold the cuffs because I‚Äôm petite. the plaid lining showed at the fold, which was cute.Unfortunately, the cotton lining pills really easily and looks bad. I wore this jacket 13 days and the pills make it look a lot more worn than it should. Pity because it‚Äôs a nice looking coat otherwise.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great every day jacket', 'author': 'A. Mitchell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's just what I hoped it would be. I saw a girl in church wearing a jacket with a similar hood and I really liked the way it looked. I was hoping it wasn't a Burberry as I'd never be able to afford that. After a quick Amazon search, I found this one. With all the great reviews, I had to try it. For my height & weight (5'8, 220), I ordered XXL. It fits well and is even roomy. I probably could've gotten by with an XL. I ordered the beige thinking it's a good color for the spring and that it would also work in the fall. The length is fabulous (and I'm tall). I'm not a fan of these pully cords by the waist, but you don't actually have to use that feature. The pockets are really comfortable and they're placed well. I did have to cuff the sleeves but that's ok. I was surprised that this jacket has some weight to it. Bottom line - I think it's fantastic. I already started looking at the different colors and I plan to try one in XL. If you're even thinking about it, I'd tell you to buy it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very flattering and not too long!', 'author': 'Ariel Inocencio', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a short person it‚Äôs SO hard to find a coat that fits and isn‚Äôt way too long. I‚Äôm planning on wearing this on my trip to Scotland so we‚Äôll see how it holds up to rain and wind!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

And it does keep you warm. I do love it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Interesting Fit', 'author': 'Morgan S', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I bought this specific coat after seeing the exact same stock image for other brands that were $15-25 more expensive. I live in Texas, so this would only be worn at most a month out of the year.It came in a vacuumed sealed bag with no tag, which I thought was odd. I laid it flat to see if the coat‚Äôs filling would evenly distribute, and was surprised to see how warm and full the jacket got when I tried it on a few hours later.Pro‚Äôs: Feels thick and warm, filler distributed evenly throughout, deep pockets, able to cinch the waist if needed.Con‚Äôs: Measurements are off; I have a short torso and short extremities, and I am always an XS or S (5‚Äô1 118lbs). The sleeve lengths didn‚Äôt even touch my wrists, so that was disappointing as it is useless in the fact that I needed this for winter weather. For a cropped jacket, it is cute, but because I received it with no tag attached, and once I tried it on I saw many loose threads, the zippers were all chipped (I got the black jacket, and it has black zippers showing some wear of the silver zipper that was painted) I know there‚Äôs a reason why so many brands have the same stock image.Bottom line it‚Äôs cute, feels warm, but this coat has so many different brands at different price points, and because the stock image is the same on all the brands, I believe I got one that was made incorrectly and was either worn or the zippers used were not new, and the company just wanted to make sure they sold all of their inventory. Just spend the extra $20 and get a coat where you get what you see in the photo and the measurements are correct.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm & comfy!', 'author': 'Cheri B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looks great, warm, stylish & comfortable. it does run large, but that is in style - I typically wear a small (5\'6", 125 lbs) If they had an extra small I would have ordered that size. It was nice but don‚Äôt need it. Light weight and good fit sleeves just a tad long', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Timeless wardrobe addition', 'author': 'Jason Thomas :)', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Wrangler Authentics Women's Stretch Denim Jacket is a must-have staple that effortlessly combines classic style with modern comfort. As a lover of timeless fashion pieces, I have found this denim jacket to be an essential addition to my wardrobe.One of the standout features of this jacket is its impeccable fit and flattering silhouette. The stretch denim fabric offers just the right amount of give, allowing for comfortable movement without sacrificing style. The jacket is tailored to accentuate the feminine figure, with a slightly tapered waist and well-placed seams that enhance the overall fit. It hugs the body in all the right places, creating a sleek and polished look.The quality of the Wrangler Authentics Women's Stretch Denim Jacket is exceptional. The denim material is durable, with a substantial weight that provides both structure and longevity. The stitching is precise and reinforces the jacket's construction, ensuring that it stands the test of time even with regular wear. The metal buttons and rivets are securely attached and add a touch of rugged charm to the overall design.This denim jacket offers versatile styling options. Its timeless design makes it suitable for various occasions and outfits. Whether paired with a casual T-shirt and jeans or layered over a summer dress, it effortlessly adds a touch of classic cool to any ensemble. The medium wash of the denim is versatile and complements a range of colors, allowing for easy coordination with other wardrobe pieces.The functionality of the jacket is another notable aspect. It features two chest pockets and two side pockets, providing ample storage space for small essentials like keys, lip balm, or a smartphone. The button-up front closure allows for adjustable wear, whether you prefer a relaxed or more tailored look. The cuffs can be rolled up for a more laid-back vibe, adding versatility to the styling possibilities.One consideration to note is that the sizing may run slightly smaller compared to other brands. It is recommended to consult the sizing chart provided by the manufacturer to ensure an accurate fit. If in doubt, it may be advisable to size up for a more comfortable and relaxed fit, especially if you plan on layering the jacket over thicker clothing.In conclusion, the Wrangler Authentics Women's Stretch Denim Jacket is a timeless and versatile piece that seamlessly combines style and comfort. Its impeccable fit, quality craftsmanship, and durable fabric make it a reliable choice for everyday wear. Whether you're going for a casual or slightly dressed-up look, this denim jacket effortlessly elevates any outfit. With its classic design and enduring appeal, it's a wardrobe staple that will never go out of style. If you're seeking a high-quality denim jacket that offers both fashion and function, the Wrangler Authentics Women's Stretch Denim Jacket is a fantastic choice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The PERFECT Jean Jacket!', 'author': 'Stephanie De Los Santos', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jean jacket is everything you imagine a jean jacket should be when you decide to re-enter the jean jacket era of your lifetime for the 2nd time. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô2‚Äù 180 lbs of ‚Äúthicc‚Äù and I have a size 36 DDD bra size. This jacket is soft and formable, and not at all stiff, as I imagined a jean jacket to be. It‚Äôs light enough to wear comfortably through the day, but solid enough to keep you warm on a slightly chilly day or in an air conditioned venue. Wrangler really got it right. So if you‚Äôre thinking about re-entering your jean jacket era, or entering it for the first time, just buy this one, it‚Äôs a 10/10!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Color is not true white.', 'author': 'SD', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a really nice jacket. Glad I ordered it a medium. I am usually a small. The only thing I am not crazy about it is not really white. It is an off white and I wanted to wear it with summer clothes. I had another one I got from Ann Taylor that was true white but it has pretty much worn out so I ordered this one as a replacement. Hope it works out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

More saturated blue, a touch more sheen. See photo with patch applied. Suspect from the packaging this was newer run. Already getting compliments. Very happy.* * *Bought jacket in navy/large (my usual size). Material is heavier than a cheap rain jacket, which is good because I intended to sew a patch. Not shiny-satin. Knit collar a little short... could have been a bit higher, but that's just my preference for a more modern, authentic bomber jacket look. Other colors would have been nice too, especially cranberry or burgundy (a bit lighter and redder than dark wine color). title: Womens Zip Up Hoodies Fleece Jackets Sweatshirts Fall Outfits Sweaters With Pockets Winter Y2k Clothes
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Overall nice sweatshirt', 'author': 'Ali', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I received this very nice hooded sweatshirt today and am quite pleased with it. It's a thick sweatshirt, not bulky, and will be very warm for winter with a quilted vest. On its own when not so cold. I love how you can zip it up right to your chin and it doesn't get in the way like some outerwear pieces do. Rubbing and irritating...the hood is roomy and looks great. This sweatshirt is true to size and not oversized on me. I would have to size up for that but they don't come in XXL. It is comfy though and quite slimming! Love the camo beige color and would love another one in the gray. Overall nice sweatshirt plus I got a great sale.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit for a small-framed person!', 'author': 'Julie H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve been looking for a quality zip-up hoodie that is as thick as the sweatshirts of the past (not the thin, wimpy ones I often see nowadays) and roomy enough to layer, but still flattering! For someone my size (5‚Äô3‚Äù & 115 lbs.) the popular ‚Äúoversized‚Äù hoodies look frumpy and very unflattering. But because of someone else‚Äôs review (thank you!) I tried THIS hoodie in a size small and turns out it fits perfect! The body length goes to mid-butt like I like (I hate the short, boxy look of some tops these days), the sleeve length is not too short or too long, and the width has more of a straight cut rather than a wide/roomy cut - so it‚Äôs flattering on a woman‚Äôs figure. The hood actually covers your head with a little to spare so there‚Äôs no tugging on the back seam. And the fabric is high-quality, dense, and just the right thickness for a legit sweatshirt. It kept me warm while at the coast in November with just one layer underneath. The pockets are deep enough to keep your smart phone in with no fear of falling out. It has those thumb cut-outs which I kinda like and no draw-string for the hood which I‚Äôm fine with because the zipper goes all the way up to your chin. When you have it zipped down partially it gives the jacket a classy lapel look. Overall I LOVE this hoodie. So glad I found it after searching for a looong time!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality fabric‚Ä¶Zipper not so much', 'author': 'Nicole O.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The fabric is very thick and great quality, super soft and warm. The thumb holes where all too small even though I have relatively smaller hands.Other than that the cut is too cute and really flattered my body looking from the front.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE this hoodie!', 'author': 'Turtlegirl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m so in love with this hoodie that I have it in three colors and I\'ll probably buy more!It\'s a great weight. This gives it a high quality more expensive look.I\'d say true to size, and not the oversized look that is everywhere. I\'m 5\'2" about 123 lbs and the small is great. Its maybe slightly big, and I would definitely try an xsmall if it was available, but it\'s not overly big or sloppy so even if xs was available, I might still keep the small. title: Women's Metropolis Insulated Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best puffer coat I have ever owned!! Worth the price', 'author': 'Amanda L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this puffer coat! I love the color, the fit and the length. I thought about it for a while before purchasing because it is pricey. I have been so happy with it and would say it is worth the price. It is very resilient. Nice flannel inside too. Pockets are a good size and zip!! The hood is removable and I love that feature. The collar of the coat goes to my chin so it covers the whole neck area. No scarf needed! The main reason I bought this puffer is because it is fitted at the waist. It is very flattering even though it is a very puffy coat. The fitted waist keeps you from looking like a marshmallow! I typically wear a small in coats and I ordered a medium in this coat because it was the only size available when i ordered it! I am glad I did. It runs small in my opinion. This coat is the warmest puffer coat I have ever owned as well. I would definently go skiing in it. It is resilient too. I have worn it almost daily since Christmas and it still looks brand new. It has a nice weight and feel. There are so many great aspects of this coat I would recommend it if you are on the fence about whether it is worth the price. Go for it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful coat, but size up!', 'author': 'Chrystaljustynne', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It runs tight in the chest area but works with thin tops. I‚Äôm not sure what people are referring to when they say it runs small. It‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt. I should have ordered my usual size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very fitted', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a lovely jacket. Whether worn as a shirt or layered as an outer garment, the Beaully Shacket effortlessly transitions from casual daywear to a more polished look for cooler evenings.The attention to detail is evident in the construction of the shacket. Whether I'm running errands, meeting friends, or simply lounging at home, this shacket effortlessly combines fashion and comfort.In conclusion, the Beaully Women's Flannel Plaid Shacket is a must-have for anyone seeking the perfect blend of comfort and style. However, I ordered a medium for myself and a small for my daughter of the exact same color, style, and price. The small did not have side pockets but the medium did have side pockets. The medium also had a care tag and an extra button inside, and the small did not. The quality control on both was rather poor. For example, none of the button holes are properly sewn and will likely fray at some point. The medium also had a small tiny hole under the armpit after one wash on delicate. The medium care tag says it can be washed on gentle and dried in the dryer. With the added thickness of the pockets, I don‚Äôt think it would dry very well completely line drying. Despite all its flaws, I decided to keep the medium with the pockets because the colors/ pattern were awesome. I still love the look enough to repair it. If you decide to purchase this item, keep in mind that you may or may not receive side pockets as I‚Äôve read other reviews where the small actually had side pockets (whereas in my case it was the medium with side pockets). Also keep in mind that you may have to do a little bit of sewing on your own or take it to professional to fix button holes, etc.. If you do dry the shacket in the dryer, even on extra low, the arms did shrink approximately one to 2 inches. I normally wear a small, and Amazon recommended a medium. Amazon was right because I wouldn‚Äôt have been happy with the small assuming it shrinks like my medium did since I want it baggy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful shirt', 'author': 'Brenda K', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This shirt is really great. title: Women's Arctic Parka
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'Lisa A Reins', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful and well fitting!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Will be great for game days!', 'author': 'Golden Golden', 'rating': 5, 'content': "After reading a zillion reviews on how warm this coat is, I bought it for the NFL season (when it's normal again!) We have season tickets so I've had plenty of time to try all sorts of different coats. I have a bunch of puffers including some that are VERY heavy and this thing is in a league of its own. 2 minutes of trying it on in the house and I was dying, and I'm cold all year round. It's physically about twice as heavy as my next heaviest one, and I've done fine with that other one in below freezing temps, so this thing is gonna be unbelievable! It's fairly flattering for its weight too. title: Women's Winter Hoodies Pullover Sherpa Fleece Warm Heavyweight Sweatshirt
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very warm hoodie', 'author': 'Cyriacus Okwaraji', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased this and I am extremely pleased with my purchase. The material is soft and cozy, providing me with much-needed warmth during chilly days. I had washed the hoodie and the color has not faded. Overall, I highly recommend this hoodie for its comfort, quality, and style', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very warm hoodie. My go to in the cold months', 'author': 'A. Jones', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I really do like this hoodie. It's my go-to hoodie for the cold Midwest winter. I first found this hoodie last winter so I've had time to wear, wash/dry and wear again many times. I can say with surety there is no shrinkage, no pilling, and the color has stayed the same. The fleece is still soft and keeps my warm. The elastic around the bottom and wrists have not stretched out. I regularly wear it around the house and don't have to hike my heat up as high to stay warm. And yes, I do get cold easily. I wear them under my lighter coats when I go out to run errands but don't want to wear the heavy bulky coat; and I stay very warm. I actually can't wear this hoodie under my heavier coat because I will be too warm.It will arrive shrink wrapped because it's so bulky, so expect it to be very wrinkled. I found that washing then drying it removed most of the wrinkles. There may be a few stubborn ones left over but after the second wash/dry all the wrinkles were totally gone. And I don't have to use the high heat setting in the dryer. Higher heat may dry in a little faster timeframe, but low heat works just fine.The only con I have is that the outer shell shows stains easily. Since I wear it around the house, I often cook while wearing them. I suspect it's oil splatters that get on it. Or it could be oil from lotion. I honestly am not sure what the spots are. BUT, I use Shout on the spots before washing and they come out spotless again. And there is no color variation from using the stain remover.Besides that minor con, this hoodie is perfect for me - so much so I ended up buying it in three more colors!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Best Hoodie Ever!', 'author': 'Rebecca', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It\'s made of 80% cotton, 15% poly & 5% spandex. The sherpa lining, which includes the sleeves, feels like fur, so soft & warm. No stray breezes made it through on the 2 subfreezing mornings I wore it. I love it so much that I bought another one, even though it wasn\'t on sale any more. The only thing is that I think it runs a little small. I\'m 5\'1", 36B,150 lbs and I usually wear a medium top. I wanted it big & cozy so I ordered 2 sizes up. It\'s certainly cozy but not as big as expected, which worked out great because now I can wear it out and not look frumpy...lucky. I washed it on cold & tumble dried it on medium and it came out perfect. Buy it, size up, you won\'t be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great hoodie, but‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Alana K', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice warm hoodie for cold fall days. The lining is soft and cozy. I ordered a medium and it fits well, but I think if I ordered another I‚Äôd get the large for the real oversized look. My only real complaint and why I give it four stars instead of five is it was shipped to me in a vacuum sealed bag. I‚Äôm not sure why that was necessary, stuff never used to be except recently. There was way more than enough room in the box it came in to just be folded in a regular bag. If you‚Äôre going to do that, at least downsize on the box! But as it was the hoodie came out with vacuum-sealed wrinkles, and it just looks bad. I am hoping once I wash it that will help, but some of them might be more or less permanent. It‚Äôs really a shame when it‚Äôs really nice otherwise. I‚Äôm keeping it because it is comfortable and does its job, but I shouldn‚Äôt get something brand new and have it looking like it was balled in the bottom of a laundry basket for years because of poor packaging choices.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected, but...', 'author': 'Arnett', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This looks well-made overall. Seams on this are finished. The cotton is good quality. Fleece is fluffy enough to show it's not that cheapy type. It's warm. My plan was to wash and run it through the dryer right away to shrink to size, since it's cotton. But can't do, per tag. Isn't flattering in any way at all. Smaller size wouldn't get rid of the 'boxy' look of it. But good for utilitarian wear (walking the dog). The zipper really doesn't look like, nor work like, it will last, which is a shame. I see that it's washable, but not for a 'tumble dry' through the dryer. Which I think means it'll have to be laid out to dry like a sweater. Not particularly convenient to do. Tag also says 'not dry cleanable'. It was shipped in a vacuum bag, so had major wrinkles. The wrinkles did mostly disappear after hanging up on coat hanger, aided by using a damp washcloth lightly on the worst of the wrinkles. Mine (blue version) did NOT have that usual imported clothes chemical smell to it. Summary: Hoodie has more pluses than minuses.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Perfect Hoodie', 'author': 'jillym', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful pink color. Sherpa inside is warm and not bulky., fits well. A perfect hoodie', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best jacket ever for cold people like me!', 'author': 'Angela', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is simply put, amazing. So much so both my mom & my aunt bought one after seeing mine. I am cold natured, and I really HATE being cold. Living in the south however a "heavy coat" can look very overkill and I also work indoors inside freezers so I need a good amount of move ability to get the job done. This coat lets me move freely and provides an excellent layer of warmth. My mom & aunt also bought the pants from this company and my aunt wears this set on her daily early am walk in the Mid-Atlantic area and she is raving on how it keeps her warm.I have washed it many times since I work in it and I havent had any issues whatsoever. It remains soft, zipper has held up, and I would not hesitate to recommend this jacket to anyone! :) One of my favorite Amazon purchases!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice and warm', 'author': 'Philbert', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got this for my sister, 5\'2" 115lbs and got her the Small hoody sweatshirt. She likes the warmth, the arms are just a tad long but she says that\'s fine in the cold, she says the zipper is good, she wishes the bottom waist-hip area was a little bigger but the actual hoody is just way too small and it pulls too tight at the back of the hoody when she pulls it up over her head. I heard that same complaint from other reviews, so I\'m not sure why they don\'t fix it and just make especially the back part of the hoody larger. She was visiting to help me recover from shoulder surgery so she is leaving in three days so will keep the hoody instead of returning it for a medium because the small has perfect shoulders so the medium will be too big. She loves the warmth of it.ii', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars very comfy and warm.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Well made, nice material; lining is so soft and warm. Overall the outfit is not real flattering but it is warm and very comfy. With respect to the manufacturer, it is impossible to make a sleek feminine sweat suit with fleece lining when you want a leotard. Won't happen but it sure is comfy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm and comfy', 'author': 'cinyjo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very warm and soft lining. Love the sweatshirt color also. I like my jackets loose so I went with an XL instead of a Large which I wear in tops. I was kind of afraid to wash it but used cold water and then put in dryer on ‚Äúair dry only‚Äù cycle twice, did not shrink. It was still damp but hung up and was dry within 10 hours or less.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

The jacket is well-sized, and the Medium fits me comfortably without feeling too tight or overly loose.One aspect that could be improved is the thickness of the material. While it's warm enough for most winter days, I wouldn't rely on it for extremely cold weather without additional layers. However, for a stylish and cozy everyday jacket, it serves its purpose well.The overall construction appears to be durable, and the stitching is well done. The jacket has held up nicely through a few washes, and I haven't noticed any significant pilling or wear. It seems like a good investment for a trendy winter piece.In conclusion, the PRETTYGARDEN Women's Fleece Winter Jacket is a stylish and comfortable addition to my winter wardrobe. title: Women's Heavenly Hooded Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Small fits like an XS', 'author': 'Kinipopo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm petite, under 5', 120 lbs and broad shoulders..at least that's what my mom always told me. She made my clothes when I was a child and always had to adjust the shoulder area. I would say my broad shoulders are an athletic build, lol. I initially ordered a small and could barely get my arms into the sleeves and then over my shoulders. Zipping it up was tight and uncomfortable, especially at the armpits. The hood barely fit over my head and stopped short at my crown.I reordered a medium and it feels wonderful. It's light and warm. There's a reflective lining that looks real cool (I think so) and it's soft and not scratchy. Of course, it's more comfortable if you have sleeves. I had a sleeveless top when I tried on the jacket and the seam at the armpit area felt stiff. Really like the thumb cutouts which keep the sleeves down and blocks air/wind from coming up the sleeve. The jacket zips up easily all the up the chin area and is snug. I noticed that the hood on this size fully covers my head. The pockets are deep enough and my hands are completely covered. I have a Note 9 and it sinks in and fits without fear that it's going to fall out. There are no inside pockets for extra stuff. There's no pull cord to tighten the jacket at the bottom but it fits me just fine. It's a keeper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very warm and light weight', 'author': 'prollyaweeb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very warm and light weight. I am still able to zip the coat and it it looks very flattering. Love that it has a hood, but I‚Äôm not sure how well it will stay up in windy conditions. Still very happy with the purchase. Will be great for everyday use', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars PERFECT!! From North Dakota', 'author': 'Nikole Wilson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First off, I live in North Dakota so if you live in a truly cold area read this!I ordered this coat on Black Friday, I‚Äôve gained some weight and my under armour coat was getting too uncomfortable for me to handle and I couldn‚Äôt layer under it without making it far worse so I ordered up to a medium. When this one arrived and I took it out of the box.. I‚Äôll be honest I instantly feared I‚Äôd made a huge mistake, it‚Äôs so incredibly light weight I didn‚Äôt think it would be able to handle 20 degrees. However, I couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong.This coat is 100% sufficient on its own down to 0 and might even be good below that, but I always wear a light hoodie under it for subzero temps to be safe as I have a 20 minute drive to work. It‚Äôs gotten down to -20 so far and I have not had any issues with it. I spend two 30 minute breaks sitting in my car at work without the vehicle on so I‚Äôm not getting heat and I‚Äôve been totally warm every time without fail.One thing I love about this coat that my under armour doesn‚Äôt have is the material over the entire length of the zipper, when it‚Äôs fully zipped the top rests at my lips and in my other coat that bothered me because I had freezing metal touching my face but not with this one. I also like that the hood is lined with faux fur, my under armour only has a shell hood and is not warm at all it only serves to block wind and rain.Another feature I love is the material that covers your hands and has the thumb holes (no idea what these are called) when you put the coat on your hand slides right into it without needing to fight with it or adjust it. It also gives ample room on top of this layer and under the cuffs for any size gloves to fit.The only reason that I‚Äôm giving this 4 out of 5 stars is the pockets, there‚Äôs not enough for me and it‚Äôs missing two interior pockets that my under armour has. There‚Äôs still the two main ones for your hands and one interior chest pocket large enough for any phone or wallet, but I‚Äôm all about pockets and it just doesn‚Äôt have as many as I would like. I refuse to carry a purse so I need as many as I can get lol.Overall, this coat is absolutely wonderful, it‚Äôs perfectly warm for subzero temps but also comfortable to wear during a quick run into a store. I don‚Äôt think it could possibly be more comfortable, it‚Äôs like wearing a soft & warm cloud haha it truly lives up to its name.If you live in an area with harsh winters, this is your coat. I hope this review helps, I tried to write about everything I was looking for to help me decide. You‚Äôll love it!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazingly practical and attractive jacket', 'author': 'Dear_Jane', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm so glad I bought this jacket. It is super comfy, and keeps me super warm in these chilly GA winters. I love the thumb holes, so that my hands stay a lot warmer, and the hood fits nicely without being too loose that it falls off. The jacket isn‚Äôt too puffy, so I don‚Äôt look like marshmallow in it, though it‚Äôs warm enough to feel like you‚Äôre in one of those. :-) Flattering and practical. The best of both. That doesn‚Äôt matter too much since I‚Äôm usually not walking around with the jacket open, since it IS a winter jacket for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Treat yo self!', 'author': 'TheSarah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this coat! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Flattering style - not as soft as i would like, but overall a great buy and cozy for winter!', 'author': 'JadeJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love: the flattering seaming, zip pockets (one big kangaroo pocket) which is GREAT for storing my cell phone and knowing it won't fall out!, colors are nice. When I\'m walking in the wind, I\'m usually holding the hood for dear life. It does have clasps that help hold it in place that cross a bit around my mouth but it\'s still pretty baggy after that. I will wear it out walking in cold weather when I don't really care the way I look.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Coat for a Great Price', 'author': 'Pandora Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recommend this even though I had to return mine because it was too big and I looked like a Yeti!! But what I could tell, this jacket was very well made, comfortable, warm and stylish.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's great! ...but could have better pockets...", 'author': 'AnnaKate Williams', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love the color of this jacket (I got the green/blue one). It's keeping me warm in the windy and chilly New York city winter. I love how flattering it is with the drawstring as well. The only thing I would change is the pockets are top entry, not on the side. It makes it rather awkward to put my hands in them to keep them warm. If I had known there were no side pockets, I probably would have passed on the jacket. Something to keep in mind!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Color is very different than it shows on screen but vibrant', 'author': 'Sourdough Sam', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Color of my blue green Jacket is technically still a blue green, and still nice anyway I just thought it was darker and more toward the green side. It looked like my favorite blue green shade. Still great though! Very warm nit overly noisy when I move, hood not too big (not covering my eyes, and "fur" doesn\'t get in my face). I would have gone with the ice blue if the colors came across on the screen better is all. Also the front pockets are a bit inconvenient for hands, as they aren\'t angled, but very good for keeping a pair of gloves in, very deep, can fit a larger cell phone or a wallet easy as well. So I reccomend buying a pair of gloves to go with this coat. It\'s a nice weight without feeling heavy or burdensome. Husband said I looked hot in it which may have been a pun? Cause that\'s a bit strange. Anyway I attached a photo that better shows the color of the coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women 2023 Fall Winter Fleece Jacket Long Sleeve Casual Button Fuzzy Sherpa Cropped Coats Outerwear with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this jacket', 'author': 'lani glad', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought the black jacket. It is not bulky and keeps you warm. I feel it is super cute. Will buy again in another color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cozy Comfort and Style for Winter Days', 'author': 'David H. Katz', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased the PRETTYGARDEN 2023 Women's Fleece Winter Jacket in Off-white, Size Medium, and I'm overall quite pleased with my purchase. This jacket has become my go-to outerwear for chilly days, and it offers a good balance of comfort and style.The fuzzy sherpa material is incredibly soft and warm, making it perfect for keeping cozy during the colder months. The long sleeves provide extra coverage, and the button-up design allows for versatile styling options. I appreciate the attention to detail in the craftsmanship, and the off-white color is both elegant and easy to pair with various outfits.The addition of pockets is a practical touch that I find very useful. They are deep enough to hold essentials like my phone and keys, which is convenient when I want to step out quickly without carrying a purse. The jacket is well-sized, and the Medium fits me comfortably without feeling too tight or overly loose.One aspect that could be improved is the thickness of the material. While it's warm enough for most winter days, I wouldn't rely on it for extremely cold weather without additional layers. However, for a stylish and cozy everyday jacket, it serves its purpose well.The overall construction appears to be durable, and the stitching is well done. The jacket has held up nicely through a few washes, and I haven't noticed any significant pilling or wear. It seems like a good investment for a trendy winter piece.In conclusion, the PRETTYGARDEN Women's Fleece Winter Jacket is a stylish and comfortable addition to my winter wardrobe. While it may not be suitable for the coldest days, it's perfect for milder winter weather and provides a fashionable touch to casual outfits. If you're looking for a cozy and versatile jacket with a touch of warmth, this is a solid choice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy and well made', 'author': 'Scarlet Piper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm really happy with this coat. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Needed a hoodie for the airplane, came across this and I thought I would give it a try. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5‚Äù @ 110lbs and ordered a small for reference.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great dupe - thick and well made', 'author': 'Honulii', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and the thickness of the hoodie right out of the packaging (it came in a clear bag so the postman could see exactly what was inside). For the most part it could pass as a name brand scuba dupe - minus logo embroidered on the hood and logo zipper pull.The hoodie looks very well made and is pretty thick. Most inexpensive hoodies are really flimsy and thin (which can also be good since I'm in humid weather). Inside is soft like a sweatshirt.Got the heather gray and it's a very light gray. I am short with an athletic build and the small fits great, not overly bulky or oversized where I look stocky. Sleeves were not overly long whereas the Lulu version I had to roll up the cuff because it was just too long. I typically never use thumb holes so not much to comment about that. If you have long arms, this might be short on you. Hood is lined and pretty thick, so when you zip it all the way up and put it over your head, it stays just like the name brand one. Length comes to about my hips, so not cropped but not long where it will cover your butt.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jogger jacket', 'author': 'Donna Ferguson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is so cute.. so soft & warm.. fit is perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Like a lulu scuba but thicker', 'author': 'SJune', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfy and cute. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars If you‚Äôre 5‚Äô7‚Äù or taller get xlarge', 'author': 'Linda D', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought the hot pink coat and it‚Äôs so heavy, warm and perfect in X-Large. Or, you can leave it unbuttoned and just rap the extra cloth to your left, having more warmth in your front. Or, let it hang loose when you‚Äôre shopping in warm stores. This is my very favorite coat and the pink is such a happy color! Someone else with an X-Large said she would move the 2 buttons over. title: Women's Open Front Knit Cardigan Long Sleeve Lapel Casual Solid Classy Sweater Jacket
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy Elegance: ANRABESS Women's Open Front Knit Cardigan Review", 'author': 'Nancy Badillo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently treated myself to the ANRABESS Women's Open Front Knit Cardigan, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This cardigan is the epitome of cozy elegance and has quickly become a staple in my wardrobe.First off, the fabric is incredibly soft and luxurious. The knit material feels gentle against my skin, providing warmth without any itchiness. It's the kind of cardigan you want to wrap yourself in on a chilly day, whether you're heading out or just lounging at home.The open front design adds a touch of sophistication to any outfit. I love how effortlessly it drapes over my shoulders, creating a relaxed yet polished look. The lapel collar gives it that classy vibe, making it versatile enough to dress up for a casual office day or down for a cozy night in.The length of the cardigan is perfect ‚Äì it hits just below the hips, providing a flattering silhouette. I appreciate how it adds a layer of warmth without overwhelming my frame. The long sleeves are a great touch, especially when I want that extra bit of coziness during cooler seasons.What sets this cardigan apart is its versatility. The solid color makes it easy to pair with various outfits, and the casual yet chic style means it transitions seamlessly from day to night. I've thrown it over dresses, paired it with jeans, and even worn it with leggings ‚Äì each time, it effortlessly elevates the overall look.Durability is another standout feature. After multiple wears and washes, the cardigan still looks as good as new. The knit has held up well, and there's been no noticeable shrinkage or loss of shape.As for sizing, I found it to be true to size. The fit is just right ‚Äì not too snug, not too loose. I appreciate that the cardigan has enough room to layer over other pieces comfortably.In conclusion, the ANRABESS Women's Open Front Knit Cardigan is a must-have for anyone looking to add a touch of warmth and style to their wardrobe. It's the kind of piece that effortlessly combines comfort and fashion, making it a go-to choice for various occasions. Treat yourself to this cozy delight; you won't be disappointed!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this!', 'author': 'Wrestler Mom', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is so cute and light weight. First, I bought the black moto, and it was pretty much exactly like the one I had before: it really feels like leather and is a nice medium weight. The arm length is great for me, but I have to kinda "suck in" to zip it up (I have long arms, and am 5\'9"/175 - bought size L), but that\'s ok since I bought it more for fashion than as an actual jacket to keep me warm outside and will probably never zip it up anyway.It was so good, I bought another in the rust red, this one styled like a regular motorcycle jacket, BUT the snaps on the points of the lapels that hold them onto the chest of the jacket were missing, although they are shown in the product image. The corresponding snaps do exist on the body of the jacket, so I exchanged for another one thinking it was just a one-off defect, but the second one was also missing the lapel snaps. As a result, the lapels hang/stick out at a 90 degree angle from the jacket rather than laying flat and that\'s not a great look. I then sent it back and got the same moto style in the dark red and that is great/looks good/fits well as the first black one. That\'s fine, since I think moto jackets suit me better anyway, but be aware that product images may not match what you get exactly. That\'s the only reason this is a 4-star review instead of 5.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I wear size 14 blazers & I ordered XL size', 'author': 'LUCLU', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am 5‚Äô2‚Äù. Depends on how I want it to fit me.My Victoria secret bra size is 38D or 40C.Sport bras are always a size LLeggings always a size LHope that helps with selecting your jacket size!About the jacket:Soft/ cute pleatherIt‚Äôs definitely a fall backed but you can layer it under with a sweater knit to be warmIt‚Äôs aa pictured and super cute for the priceMost leather jackets ( real ones) can be tough and heavy. First of all it is a slim, fitted leather jacket, putting it on, I would say if you as a women have any type of full breast size other than triple A or small B size breast I'd advise against purchasing the XL and try the XXL which is the highest size this jacket comes in. Secondly, it is hard to zip up even with wearing a thin short sleeve shirt, the zipper kept getting caught on my shirt hopefully not leaving little zipper holes. It falls right above the hip, tight zipped up but loose unzipped obviously........ Love the glossy, leather feel that's why I'm thinking of trying out the XXL. Perfect fit for a 13 and up year old or if you're a women whose body resembles than of a teenager than this leather is for you otherwise I should try shopping in the plus sizes or try this same one as an XXL........ but I can't really imagine it being that much bigger since there is no stretch at the waist band.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice quality', 'author': 'MC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was surprised at the quality, look and feel. It definitely doesn't appear it will work for a downpour but if so, that's fine. Reviews said size up 1-2 sizes, so I was afraid this would be too small. It's plenty big. I carry all my weight in my middle and chest and find this very generously cut in the middle. But I guess it's because it's a straight cut jacket. I have narrow hips and can see how the cut might not work as well for a pear shape because it'd be loose in the waist and tight across the hip. For reference, I wear 18-20 in pants and 2x-3x in tops. The arm sleeves are very long on me which I was a little disappointed about. But the wrists can be tightened w. velcro which helps. I love the longer length. Plus sizes in this jacket may be true sizing vs. regular sizes because it appears many fewer plus size people complained this runs small. I love this jacket.
