At the time of this review (June 2019) the jacket is Prime, and it\'s marked waaay down (turns out most people aren\'t buying a denim jacket during summer). So I decided it was time to reunite with the fave jacket of my youth. A jacket I wore into the ground that served me well especially with those lovely inside pockets that hide what teenagers want to hide, but that these days allow a girl to have her phone on her person and not in her back pocket or purse...Side note: Retailers of the world please give us POCKETS! Not every voluptuous woman thinks the solution to society\'s discomfort with our bodies is to remove the pockets!!! Thank you Levi\'s for understanding!!!! [/soap box]The jacket I received is authentic. It has added spandex for a little stretch. The first one I ordered was a 2X. I had read the reviews stating to order up for a few years and I followed orders. The 2X was lovely, but as usual the arms were too long (I\'m 5\'6") and it just felt baggy on me. If I were going to use it for layering in cold weather, I\'d have kept the 2X. But I wanted a spring/autumn jacket to throw over a tee or a THIN hoodie. I\'ll go back for the barn/cargo jacket for cold weather. I don\'t care too much if this one buttons because I won\'t wear it that way. I mean... yes, I CAN button it if I get caught in a wind storm, but that won\'t be the norm.So I cannot say definitively "order up," because it\'s going to depend on how you plan to style it. I will say that I wear a 38DDD, have a belly, and the 1X lays naturally with about 2-3" between the buttons, and I can button if I must. The Lola color is my jam, just dark enough but also just faded enough, but I mean any of them will be nice. I have front pockets which are missing from so many designers lately, and I have that warm nostalgia I am seeking in the name brand. So many memories. So many.I have a collection of jackets from my fave retailer for curvynistas like myself, Torrid, and I would say this jacket is comparable (the 1X Levis fits like a Torrid 1 and a 2X is a Torrid 2). Plus it\'s a slim fit. Think of this jacket as a "Juniors Plus," if that helps. And good luck styling your beautiful self! If you are reading this in the off-season, go for it NOW because the price will creep back up come the first chill :-)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Your basic jean jacket', 'author': 'Your Random Purchases Advisor', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like the color of the wash. Great price!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fits nice, stretchy, dark dark black', 'author': 'JEG', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered three different types of Levi‚Äôs trucker jackets all in size Large (recommended size) for a side by side comparison. Please note that the 3 trucker jackets DO NOT COME WITH A HOODIE. I was simply making sure I could layer a hoodie underneath the denim jackets as this is how I like to wear them. All 3 Large sized jackets passed my hoodie test and Large felt like an accurate size recommendation to the style of each jacket. The sleeve length was long and perfect for me. If you‚Äôre looking for a more ‚Äúform fitting‚Äù jacket, order the original trucker in your normal size (it does have stretch if you‚Äôre between sizes), order the Ex-Boyfriend a size smaller (no stretch.. watch out for arm length though), and skip the Baggy trucker altogether or try ordering it two sizes smaller (no stretch.. watch out for arm length changes ordering small sizes). My measurements: Height 5‚Äô8‚Äù - Weight 155lbs - Shoulder to Shoulder 17" - Bust 38" - Waist 28‚Äù - Hips 40". All of the Levi‚Äôs denim trucker jackets have inside ‚Äúpockets‚Äù which is a feature I have always loved from Levi‚Äôs denim jackets. If you notice from the photos, each jacket is about 2‚Äù longer than the next. The Original trucker jacket being the shortest length and darkest wash; pictured in the first photo, all the way to the left (top & bottom) of the second photo and all the way to the right in the third photo. It is meant to be roomy but more form fitting, while the other two styles are meant to be baggy. I was still able to layer the Original trucker over my hoodie comfortably in my recommended size. While the Original trucker fit nicely and probably would look best over dresses out of the 3, I chose the Ex-Boyfriend because I already own a form fitting denim jacket and wanted something different. I liked the Original trucker the least because it was so dark, had all black buttons, and looked too new and clean. This sounds weird, but all my black jeans are all faded, so I preferred the faded washes on the other two black trucker jackets. The Baggy Trucker and Ex-Boyfriend trucker also have no stretch and have contrasting brownish brass buttons which felt more vintage. Notice the Ex-Boyfriend jacket has buttons on the right ‚Äúmen‚Äôs side‚Äù while both the Original Trucker and Baggy Trucker have buttons on the left ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs side‚Äù. I hope my review helps you decide!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Real Jean Jacket', 'author': 'Mia', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I want to love this jacket, but it is really a jean jacket. It is not soft or strechy. I am not sure if it just needs to be washed a bunch of times, but it is really stiff. I did not return it because it was a gift.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women's Arcadia Ii Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this jacket ..nice deep color blue ..very comfortable and warm', 'author': 'Susanm', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased the same jacket every year because I like it so much. It is comfortable warm and looks nice with jeans. Also great as a rain jacket or when snowing. I buy larger size to put a light jacket underneath and use hiking, shopping, versatile. The only issue I've had with these jackets is sometimes the zipper separates but overall jacket is very nice quality. I still would buy again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I use this everyday', 'author': 'StephB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was one of our better purchases. This is a lightweight jacket/windbreaker, perfect for rainy conditions. Great fit. I use it for light rain and heavy rains. I don‚Äôt get hot in it. It is not lined and that is perfect. I also purchased one for my 22 yr old and she loves it too. I use it hiking in Alaska & at home and out on charter fishings. Perfect jacket. Great quality. True to fit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Fits Well', 'author': 'Barbara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket seems to be just what i wanted, A waterproof but not overly warm or binding jacket. It\'s really a step up from a windbreaker. It fits on the large side which allows you to wear something bulky underneath if you want. I am short (5\'1") so the sleeves are long (as usual) but there is a velcro strap around the wrist to tighten it. I like the color, (very light blue) but there were very few colors available. I had to look at many other colors to find one that was available in a medium size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Size up one size for layering or buy two - one for cold and one for warmer weather!', 'author': 'HWWoman', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered this in 3X because that was the only size available at the time that I first ordered. I received it today.First off the color (lily red) is beautiful. I am not a fan of the Velcro "fasteners" on the front - might as well call them lint collectors and they tend to snag things. The fabric seems very soft and the jacket appears to be well made. There is a tag with a price of $100 on it. I purchased this jacket in red in size 2X and 3X for under $35 - what a deal! The hood is as someone else commented fairly small (it doesn\'t extend out very far), but I guess I\'ll just have to test it out. At least I\'ll be able to see when I am wearing it! There is a cinch elastic at the bottom, but it\'s just on one side and when I cinched the jacket, it just looked awkward. Size-wise, I wear a 2X in jackets and I actually have a 2X on the way so I will be able to compare. The jacket is very generously sized in the arms and shoulders - the hips not so much. It seems to be a fairly straight cut jacket.I will update this once I have the 2X to compare. As far as being versatile, this jacket might just fit the bill. It could be also used as a parka over a fleece jacket for colder weather.Update: I now have the 2X and the 3X. There is a significant difference in the sizing and quite honestly that‚Äôs a good thing. I‚Äôve decided to keep both because the jackets will serve different purposes. The 3X is fairly long (27.75 inches in front measuring from collarbone - the 2X is one inch shorter) and there‚Äôs plenty of room for me to wear layers underneath. I just returned from a breezy walk on the beach in high 30‚Äôs/low 40‚Äôs temperatures and it was absolutely perfect paired with wind pants and fleece underneath. It definitely kept out the cold wind! You could probably use this as a ski parka with the right layers underneath. The size 3X jacket weighs 447 grams - just under a pound. It doesn‚Äôt appear to be ‚Äúself-packable‚Äù, but fits nicely in a plastic one gallon Ziplock bag.The 2X will be better as a rain jacket and for warmer weather. It‚Äôs shorter in length and looks more tailored because it is more form-fitting. It‚Äôs a tad snug in the hips and I consider this a minor design flaw because otherwise the jacket is true to size in all respects. There are mesh-lined zippered pockets (6 in zipper) on each side of the jacket. I realized that they were mesh when the sand from the shells that I‚Äôd collected fell from the pocket. I‚Äôm not as excited about mesh pockets. I worry that they could get torn or catch on things over time - same with the mesh lining of the jacket.So far, the jacket has offered excellent wind protection. I‚Äôll have to see how it does in rainy weather. Don‚Äôt expect this jacket to have a stylish, fashionable fit and you should be happy overall with your purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile lightweight waterproof jacket', 'author': 'Carolyn S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was traveling and wore this jacket in rainy, 50s and 60s degree weather. It kept my dry and warm without making me feel as if I were being roasted. I like the color choices (mine was a light blue). I particularly liked the large pockets that had zipper closures. They were large enough to fit a glove and a small camera or something of similar size comfortably in each pocket and with the zipper closed, there was no chance of the camera falling out and it was protected from getting wet. In addition to the full length front zipper, there are several velcro patches along the front opening that were easier than buttons to open/close quickly. That makes it excellent for travel, and also to throw in your backpack or tote in case of rain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Rain jacket', 'author': 'MARY N.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm going to Ireland this year and a rain coat is suggested. Morgan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Perfect for those days when a regular hoodie is too hot but you still need something. It is lightweight, washes nicely, fits well and folds up small for a backpack. It is one of those clothing items you didn't know you needed - until you get and realize what you have been missing!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice', 'author': 'Pauline', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Not to thick, but gets the job done on a fall day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fabric is the perfect "in between" weight', 'author': 'Maureen Lynn', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When I first got these, I was a bit disappointed about the weight of the fabric, it's very lightweight, almost like a T-shirt material. When that order arrived, I really didn't think I'd get much use out of them. I was wrong. It was still winter, and I put them in a closet and almost forgot about them. Then on a cooler summer day, I was cold, but it wasn't warm enough for my normal fleece sweatshirts. Then I remembered these buried in my closet and pulled one out. It was perfect! I was warm, but not overheated.I started to wear them when we went out to eat. I'm always cold in diners and restaurants, but my fleece sweatshirts are usually too much; I'm too warm with them on and too cool with them off, so I wind up draping them over my shoulders, and I'm constantly having to reposition them because they slip down. These lightweight sweatshirts are just perfect in a cold restaurant.I had originally purchased only 2 of these, but after using them all summer long, I bought 4 more. Now with the cooler weather moving in, I'm wearing these around the house, and when I go outside, I put one of my fleece sweatshirts on over them. I have a lot of fleece sweatshirts and wear only a couple of them because my skin is very sensitive and I can't wear any scratchy material against my skin. After numerous washings, the once soft lining of my heavy fleece sweatshirts gets stiff and scratchy, and for me, very uncomfortable. So basically out of about 4 dozen fleece sweatshirts, I only wear a few of the newest ones that are still kind of soft. I've found that I can wear one of these lightweight sweatshirts under my heavy fleece ones, and I'm comfortable because these sweatshirts are just so soft. With using these as liners, I can now go back to using my entire collection of sweatshirts comfortably.As for fit, I always buy any kind of outerwear in a larger size than I actually wear. I do this so I can layer different articles of clothing, depending on how cold I am. I wear an XL, but buy sweatshirts and jackets in either 2X or 3X. The lightweight sweatshirts I purchased are 3X, but I feel they fit more like a 2X, so I would recommend sizing up a bit.All in all I really love these hoodies! If you are like me and are cold most of the time, these will give you the little bit of warmth that you need for those in-between conditions where you're cold, but a fleece sweatshirt is too warm. These are just right.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs small', 'author': 'Linda', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Runs small love it but kinda small. Light weight cute. Took a while to ship I ordered 2', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The color is awesome it fit better then I thought it would and the price was really reasonable', 'author': 'Tracey Ochman', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I liked the color and the price was really reasonable. I needed something to wear when I go to the doctors and I'm only outside for a few minutes at a time so I really didn't want something really heavy this was just right .", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Hanes sizing', 'author': 'Tamara', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Ordered JMS but label is Hanes. title: Women's Oversized Denim Jacket Casual Long Boyfriend Distresse Jean Jacket Autumn Spring
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy Comfort and Effortless Style - My New Go-To Jacket', 'author': 'Shira', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Obsessed doesn't even begin to describe it! This oversized denim jacket has become my instant fave. It's like wearing a hug from your best friend, but with major fashion cred. The boyfriend cut drapes perfectly, giving me that chic, borrowed-from-the-boys vibe, and the distressed detailing adds a touch of edgy attitude.This jacket is my ride-or-die for all things casual. Coffee runs? Check. Weekend strolls? Double-check. Even throwing it on over a sundress for a breezy night out feels effortlessly put-together. Plus, the quality is top-notch - the denim is soft but sturdy, and the buttons seem like they could handle a toddler-induced tug-of-war (don't ask!).Seriously, if you're looking for a versatile jacket that's equal parts comfy and stylish, look no further. This one's a total keeper!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gorgeous!!!', 'author': 'Roll Tide!', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like this shacket. I love the color, and it does look and feel like real denim. I like the length of it as it fully covers the booty. Now what I don't like is that it has a drop shoulder, and it feels really big and loose. I read a lot of reviews saying to size up if you want a boyfriend-jacket type feel and size down if you want it to be a little more snug or form-fitting. I just went with my regular size (2XL) as I didn‚Äôt want either of those things. I just wanted it to fit like a regular jacket would. But it still seems to be really huge on me and the with the drop shoulder, it can look like I‚Äôm swimming in it. I had to roll up the sleeves by a lot so that the sleeve isn‚Äôt hanging off my hands.BUT - it really is a cute jacket and goes with just about everything, so I‚Äôm keeping it. I can wear an XL or 2XL but generally wear a 2XL.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great style!', 'author': "Lil' E", 'rating': 5, 'content': "I didn't have the highest hopes for this jacket, but I was PLEASANTLY surprised upon its arrival! The sleeves aren't too long or big, and the sides have a subtle tapered-in effect to give you a nice hourglass figure. If you are wide-hipped like me, this jacket doesn't flare out and make you look wider than you are, but instead, it fits nicely to your body. The length is long enough to cover the rear and act as a nice accent piece to your overall outfit. I bought the darker jean color and it is really stylish! I'm excited to wear it this fall / right now. It isn't very thick, so it won't work well by itself in the winter, you'd need a shirt underneath. I would size up if you intend on wearing a thicker shirt underneath - the large fits me like a glove, so no room for anything but a thin long sleeve shirt or tank top under it. title: Women's Crawford Bomber Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket - Runs a bit big for the size chart', 'author': 'MM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve been debating buying this for at least a year and am glad I finally did.This is a cute bomber style jacket. It\'s not super baggy, nor does it feel too tight and constrictive. I don\'t like an oversized look, so this is the perfect middle ground that\'s fitted on my figure, but also has enough room to layer under it.I\'m always worried about sizing when buying from a new brand, so I\'m glad I read reviews and picked on the smaller side of their fit chart. For reference I\'m 5\'4" with curvy/athletic build and broad shoulders/big arms from lifting. My chest measures 43", waist 31" and hips 44". I\'m normally need a L or XL in woven tops to fit my chest and shoulders. I ordered a large and it\'s perfect.As others mentioned, it\'s not overly warm. I plan to wear it in warmer weather when there\'s a slight chill, or indoors in cold offices. It could definitely be dressed up which I plan to do with it.My ONLY complaint, is you can\'t push or roll up the sleeves. I have short arms, so I habitually push up my sleeves, but this doesn\'t have enough room or stretch to do that. It\'s an inconvenience, but won\'t prevent me from keeping the jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this jacket. Yea Carhartt!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars ABSOLUTELY LOVE', 'author': 'Ashley McDonald', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been wanting a thick Carhartt for a while. I saw this while looking and loved the style. I got the turquoise color. Ordered a medium. I am 5,7, 153 lbs. fits very nice. I think it‚Äôs also worth it to note that I have a long torso and I have no issues with the length. Some people complain about the material being stiff, well yea, it‚Äôs canvas, but honestly I have no issues with it. I mean, it‚Äôs not fleece but it definitely is easy to move around in. Has room to layer underneath. I think it could be work in colder and slightly warmer weather. So happy with the price and the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I was expecting more..', 'author': 'Rachel Zamora', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the price point I was thinking there would be maybe just a little bit of padding. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits true to size, beautiful color, soft and lightweight.', 'author': 'Scott Warmack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits true to size, beautiful color, soft and lightweight. I‚Äôm not wide; I‚Äôm slender. There is no female shaping to it at all. It‚Äôs a straight line down from under the armpits. I have sewing skills and can sew in the sides a bit to make it more flattering. I like the length on my 5‚Äô7‚Äù frame. The arms are a perfect length on me.-Material: The label says it‚Äôs 95% cotton and 5% spandex. Made in China. It‚Äôs thin, but not see-through. It‚Äôs soft and super stretchy in all directions. I could have sized down; however, then the hoodie would have been too tight across my shoulders and under my arms.-Pockets: Great for hands, but because the opening is large and low, any items you put in might fall out.-Washing: I machine-washed mine in cold water and let them hang to dry because I don‚Äôt want them to shrink (because clothing tends to shrink in length but not in width where I‚Äôd actually like it to shrink).-Lint: Big problem for the black hoodie. It seems to attract every piece of lint that comes near it. The lint sticks to the material and has to be individually picked off (or use a roller or tape). I find that annoying. Best not to wash it with anything that might release lint, like socks or towels. Lint is not a problem with the denim blue hoodie.The price ($15.99) is good. I like that it‚Äôs mostly cotton and it washes well. title: Womens Oversized Leather Faux Y2k Jackets Motorcycle Plus Size Moto Biker Coat Fall Outfits Fashion Clothes
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Run don‚Äôt walk!', 'author': 'The F. S. Family', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is AMAZING!The faux leather is good quality and not ‚Äòshiny‚Äô and plastic looking like some faux leather jackets tends to be.I‚Äôm usually a size 10-12 and the L fits me like a glove, it‚Äôs the perfect amount of fitted but still a little oversized looking.It arrived slightly wrinkled but it was nicely wrapped and packaged, and I‚Äôm confident the wrinkles willCome out pretty easy.I‚Äôm going to switch the buttons on the jacket with some nice gold vintage ones to elevate the lookOf it further.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing', 'author': 'Denise Mastrangelo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "For a price this is a MUST! Mine wasn't wrinkled like other reviews said. It came perfectly, no weird smell or folds. It looks AMAZING and goes with everything. A great transitional jacket or jacket for going out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice lightweight blazer-style coat. Takes some work to get the wrinkles out.', 'author': 'circusdaze', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I almost love this jacket, though a couple of things get in the way of true bliss.It arrived carefully folded and protected by tissue paper, but being faux leather, it still wrinkled badly. Some wrinkles were so deep I was afraid the fabric was permanently damaged. After doing some online research, I cautiously approached it with a steamer. It took me about 25 minutes and half a gallon of water to make the coat look presentable, heating it with steam and then pressing wrinkles out with my fingers as the fabric cooled. Some fold marks remain, but they aren\'t too noticeable. The jacket went from looking like cheap plastic to something resembling leather. It\'s a good fake, not too shiny, but thin.The jacket is described as a "moto jacket," but it\'s more of a blazer-style coat. It\'s boxy and oversized, and despite the princess seams, it drapes rather than skimming the body. Usually, I consider this a good thing because I have some curves to hide around the waist, but I don\'t like how the thin fabric drapes over my chest, creating several folds. There are also more folds in the sleeves than I like.The fit is as expected. I ordered my normal size ‚Äì large ‚Äì and it was oversized, as advertised. It was a bit snug in the arms but good everywhere else over a bulky sweater, and nicely oversized when worn over a tee. I can button it over a sweater, but I prefer it open. The sleeves are a little too long for me, but that\'s a consistent problem for me with coats.The construction is very good. The topstitching is straight and consistent, and the buttonholes are perfect. There\'s an extra button included, but the ones on the coat are firmly anchored, so I don\'t think I\'ll need it. The jacket is fully lined, and there\'s a gusset in the upper back of the lining. The large front pockets have flaps that can be tucked in cleanly.There was only the faintest whiff of a chemical smell when I opened the package. I imagine all the steam I used probably helped get rid of any residual odors. It\'s nice to know that if the coat ever needs washing, it can be hand-laundered in cold water.I think I\'ll get some good use out of this jacket in spring and fall, and maybe even in some light rain showers.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks Just As Advertised', 'author': 'barbara prestia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Exactly As Advertised!!!Love It! True to Size', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jacket', 'author': 'Melissa G. Kellogg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looks very nice and perfect fit', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really love this', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good looking', 'author': 'Adela', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I wear 2x/3x around my hips, and large/1x on top.This jacket fits like a glove up top. Around my hips I have to leave it open, but it does come around enough so it doesn\'t look like it\'s too small. I usually wear my coats and jackets open with a nice light or chunky scarf hanging down in the opening, depending on the wind.I am impressed with the quality of the pleather, actually looks great.The seems are sewn well. The back looks good.Ample pockets. Standard poly lining.The only con to me is that I have to tack up the sleeves, easy enough... and I have a lot of items I have to do slight tailoring as I am only 5\'1" now.Came well wrapped and just hung it near the wood stove overnight and folding creases came right out.This type of jacket never goes out of style, only the items you wear with it do.Looks great with a white button up, jeans in blue or black, ankle boots and turquoise or pearl jewelry. Also a black leather shoulder bag.At least that\'s how I plan to style it.For the look and the quality, I think the price is good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice but‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Debbie55', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful but too long for me', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Runs true to size', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I liked the style and weight of the jacet', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars slick', 'author': 'Savannah manfreda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'comfy and looks good', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women's Lightweight Long-Sleeve Full-Zip Water-Resistant Packable Hooded Puffer Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Get this jacket! Especially if you are tall!', 'author': 'Erin Samuelsen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really needed something in between a sweatshirt and my heavy winter coat for those milder but still chilly days. I always have a very hard time finding jackets. I am tall and have long arms. Most jackets fit like a belly shirt with 3/4 sleeves. Not this one! The jacket sits right at my hips which is perfect and the sleeves actually come down to my wrists! It‚Äôs relatively warm. I usually wear a hoodie anyways, so with one hoodie and the jacket, I‚Äôm comfortable to about 30 degrees. If I later two sweatshirts, I can stand a smidge colder. But that‚Äôs perfect because that‚Äôs why I bought it. I‚Äôve got my big thick coat for when it‚Äôs really cold. This jacket is also very lightweight and can be stuffed into the little bag that comes with it, so if you are out and need to take it off, you don‚Äôt have to schlep a big bulky coat. It‚Äôs also pretty decent with being water resistant. It‚Äôs NOT a rain coat, so if you wear it in a downpour, you will still get soaked. But for a day when it‚Äôs drizzly, it does a good job keeping me dry. The hood fits really well and actually stays put too. One other thing, I like the material. It‚Äôs not one of those fabrics that list sounds and feels scratchy. It‚Äôs nice and soft and slick, but it‚Äôs not that kind of material that falls apart if you look at it funny either.Overall, a really fantastic lightweight jacket, especially if you are tall or have long arms.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very cute jacket', 'author': 'Susan Regan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The color of the jacket is very bright, which I like. The fit is good and it‚Äôs lightweight but warm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Jacket!!', 'author': 'RAMSJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am really impressed by this jacket. I needed a last minute packable puffer for a trip to Orlando(wasn‚Äôt expecting temps forecasted to be in the 50‚Äôs). I didn‚Äôt want to spend too much and most packable puffers cost $50 or more, were out of stock in stores (a few days before Xmas) or would not arrive in time for my trip. So, I checked Amazon and of course‚Ä¶they had what I needed. A great price and prime delivery. I didn‚Äôt know what to expect from an Amazon product line coat. But let me say, I love this jacket! It does not look cheap, has zipper pockets, an inside pocket, a hood and a packable bag attached to the inside. The best thing about it is the wrist cuffs‚Äîthey are slightly tapered and slightly stretchy. So they stay in place but you can push them up easily to check your watch. It will definitely be warm enough for 50 degree temps. I ordered one size up (I ordered a Large) but would normally wear a Medium jacket. The large fits good with room enough to wear a fleece or sweatshirt underneath. If I wasn‚Äôt planning to wear a fleece under it, the Medium would fit perfectly. I may order another color in a medium. For less than $30 and free delivery in 2 days, you seriously cannot go wrong!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Doesn‚Äôt fit into the bag, but folds down enough to be packable', 'author': 'Melissa', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought this jacket to take on a trip to Switzerland because we planned to be spending a fair amount of time in the mountains. Like other reviewers, I never could get the jacket into the bag that came with it. I think the sizing of the bag is off, so deducted a star for that since it does make the jacket less packable. Other than that, I found it to be very comfortable, warm, and not overly bulky. Plus the pink color is cute! While I wish it fit into the bag, it isn‚Äôt hard to fold down and roll to fit into a suitcase or backpack. With it being quite light, it is definitely a jacket I won‚Äôt mind toting on trips. I typically wear an XL and it seemed true to size, but I opted to keep the XXL just so I had extra room underneath for bulkier clothing like sweaters. If you don‚Äôt plan to wear anything thick underneath, order your normal size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon Essentials puffy jack works well here in Florida in the winter', 'author': 'JBF', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the Amazon essentials puffy jacket with hood thinking "How good can it be for that price?" But it is worth every penny and more as it fits well (some tapering at waist) and keeps me warm here for early morning walks when the temp is near 50o. Probably could get a thin vest under it for really cold places and the hood (which I don\'t use) comes up just high enough to keep my neck warm if the wind is blowing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Puffer jacket', 'author': 'Kathy Burnham', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered a medium. Runs true to size. Comfortable fit. Like that it is packable. Mildly puffy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Runs Very Small', 'author': 'Rene C', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Looks ok, but it runs very small, no way would I be able to wear a sweater under it. Sleeves are not very wide, feels more like Asian sizing than US standard sizing. Will give it to someone who will be able to move in it with something as a base layer.Disappointing!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket for casual use', 'author': 'JMT Cairn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I intend to use this jacket under a waterproof shell as an insulating layer. It needs to be big enough to add layers underneath and small enough to fit under the outer jacket. I am 5‚Äô8, about 140. I have wide shoulders and long arms which usually poses a problem with sizing. I ordered the size Medium. The jacket fits well but it too narrow in the shoulders and the sleeves are too short with arms extended. I understand this jacket is meant for casual use, not mountaineering. Still, I thought I would review some important parts of this jacket to help you make your decision. First, this grey color is a bit silvery but I like it. The jacket looks very nice; not overly puffy and not too flat. The inside of the jacket is lined with similar fabric as the outside - in other words, it does not have a brushed or fabric lining. There are two, deep pockets inside the jacket, along the zipper. They are plenty deep for, phones, keys etc‚Ä¶ probably even a 16oz water bottle! There are two zippered pockets outside which are deep enough to put your hands fully into beyond the wrist. The sleeves have a narrow elastic band at the wrist which seems sufficient. They are not adjustable. The hood is large and is not adjustable. This could be an important point for some. When zipped up all of the way, the zipper came to right below my chin. There is no zipper cover or cloth flap to keep the zipper from rubbing on your chin. There is no flap over or behind the zipper which could allow for wind to blow through or freezing of the zipper if exposed to snow/sleet. I don‚Äôt know if the zipper is water resistant like the fabric. I like most of the Amazon Basics stuff and this jacket did not disappoint. In this case, I will order a large to see how they compare in the shoulders and sleeves. It looks like a nice jacket for casual use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars packable, longer torso, 400 g jacket, 8 g travel bag, 3 g clip', 'author': 'Geode', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Amazon added a feature where you can put in your weight and other details and it will recommend a size for you. It recommended between a medium and a large for me. I wanted a snug fit so I got a medium. It did fit snugly like I want it. My weight varies between 130 and 150 pounds and I am now at the higher end of my weight. I am petite, 53, and big chested. I found the torso to be a tiny bit long, but that isn't a big deal for the price. Also my backside is a bit big and the jacket reaches a tiny bit onto it past my hips because of the longer torso. Rolling up the bottom a tiny bit shortens the torso and keeps the jacket off of my backside where it is too tight. I don't really like the color, but I was trying to spend as little as possible on this jacket so I got the cheapest color, which is probably the least desirable.Lots of people have asked about the weight of this jacket and have not gotten an answer. I put the jacket in a box to make it easier to weigh as it kept on coming unfolded, and then I subtracted the weight of the box from the total weight. I got 400 g for the medium jacket, 8 g for the travel bag, and 3 g for the clip making a total of 411 g for the entire set up. You would think that they would advertise the weight but they don't. You can see the shipping weight, but that is the weight of the entire package instead of the weight of the jacket. I will add a bit to the shipping week to make sure there is enough leeway. I have not been able to get it to fit in a travel bag. If you can get it to fit there I would encourage you not to store it in its travel bag because jackets and sleeping bags should not be stored in a compressed state, especially synthetic ones. I have tried really hard and can't do it. I'm not sure if I really need its travel back. I'm not an expert, but I believe it would be fine to put it in a backpack uncompressed and then use the compression straps as necessary. It is a huge like a sleeping bag where it could be helpful to have a stuff sack.I believe that if you are using this jacket as part of a proper layering system, you could be fine down to 20¬∞. Perhaps if you were wearing thermal underwear you would be fine a bit lower.. I was just thinking of having it with a moisture wicking long sleeve shirt well actively moving when making my 20¬∞ estimate. Without actively moving I would estimate you would need a light weight pullover fleece to get that same 20¬∞ and if you started moving with that set up you could get to 10¬∞ perhaps. Perhaps with thermal underwear, the shirt over it, the fleece pullover, and then this jacket you could make it below 0¬∞. It depends a lot on whether you are moving, what else you are wearing, and how cold you get. A lot of people are asking though so I thought I would try to estimate. With a sleeping bag it is a lot easier to get a temperature rating because someone is just sleeping. For something over 50¬∞ though, I think it might get too hot and it would be better to have a pullover fleece. I don't get cold that easily though. It would be interesting to see what others think of my estimates.I don't really know The purpose of the clip. The instructions also seem to indicate that you can wash it just the way you would wash any other type of clothing, but water resistant jackets normally need to be washed with a special detergent to maintain their waterproofing properties so I'm a bit confused about that. The only other problem I have with the jacket is that I wish it were a bit more breathable, but most jackets of this style have that problem. If your other clothing is breathable I think it would be fine. If I paid $300 for this jacket I would bump the rating down to three stars, but because I paid $30 for this jacket, the rating is four stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Quality warm coat', 'author': 'Do the Thing', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got this coat after being recommended it by a friend. For being so lightweight it is really warm! The pockets are large with zippers to close them, and the hood comes in handy for wind and rain protection. This coat is light enough that I can layer it under my big winter coat if needed and small enough that I can pack it in my backpack.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Don't be fooled by weight/thinness", 'author': 'ekb', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So glad I got this coat. Ordered 3 a few days before heading to NYC last week, from Florida. Two other brands that were medium may have fit alone, but heading to 20s-30s from FL I needed to be able to add multiple layers. This even allowed adding my 32 degree vest underneath on a particularly cold walk. Worn over shirt and sweater on return at 40s in FL it worked well too and didn\'t feel overly big. The medium was perfect size for what I needed. I am 5\'2" and 125 lbs. When I took it out of box I was leary because so thin and light. But other reviews said ok with layers at 20-30 and they were right. If used to cold may need fewer layers. I was even shedding them at times. Was never uncomfortable. Could roll it up in it\'s carry bag and stick in a back pack or large purse in museums/theaters. On me it came about 3 " above knees so helped keep legs warm. No problem sitting at that length. I got the Copen blue which is a nice light navy. The removable hood is also a nice feature, along with the zip pockets. No list gloves. The only down side ( no pun intended) is the feathers. They were coming out inside and getting on my wool pants and sweater, and coming out a lot on outside as well. On a site with a similar coat, similar problem, they suggested pinching fearher on inside and pulling back into coat rather than pulling them out. Easier said than done. As long as enough stay in to wear a few winters I will be happy. Overall great coat, especially for the price. Thicker fabric to contain the feathers better would make it a 5. But then may cost more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A good dupe', 'author': 'Judy Hoffer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This product is light, comfortable and stylish. It‚Äôs the perfect jacket for California.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 3/4 length light-weight down coat', 'author': 'Retired', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This coat is exactly what I was hoping for and better than I expected for the price. It projects a slimming silhouette.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Light weight down coat', 'author': 'Lu Ann', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I liked the knee length, great in cool weather.The zipper was a struggle. Love them!!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Way better than Mountain Hardware Ghost Whisperer II!!', 'author': 'Jessica Jones', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I originally ordered the Mountain Hardware Ghost Whisperer II in ‚ÄúJack Pine‚Äù bc I‚Äôve been hiking more and I wanted a hooded warm packable coat, and I love the green Jack Pine color. Not only for hiking, I also wanted it for travel. Well, long story short, the GWII sucks. The quality is terrible and didn‚Äôt even last one hike. This coat delivered on all that PLUS it‚Äôs water resistant (the GWII is NOT!!) and it covers my butt! With this coat, I only needed a medium and it covers my whole butt, so‚Ä¶.it makes me feel better all around! ü§£', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite coat ever!', 'author': 'Kelley Motzny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don‚Äôt write reviews often, but feel I should on this one. title: Packable Rain Jacket Women Lightweight Waterproof Raincoat with Hood Cycling Bike Jacket Windbreaker
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outdoor Ventures vs 33,000Ft review', 'author': 'ActualUser!', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We purchased one of each of the two top-rated women\'s rain jackets on Amazon, the Outdoor Ventures and 33,000Ft rain jackets. They both have the same rating and about the same number of reviews, so we decided to try one of each and compare.Upon inspection, we can\'t tell a difference between these two jackets. One of them was less expensive than the other, so that would be the only factor I would use to decide between the two.They both make a lot of noise and are more "crinkly" than we would like, but otherwise, they both seem well made. They both fit true to size, but slightly on the smaller side, especially for layering.The jacket is well designed from a functional standpoint, even though its not as fashionable as one might wish. It seems like it will be very serviceable. I\'ll update this if we have any problems when actually using these, but they seem waterproof and even the XL folds easily into its pouch.From our viewpoint, even though these are labeled for women, they seem unisex and aren\'t more slimcut so they should be able to fit men, women, or children as long as you order up or down from standard women\'s sizing as needed for men or children.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ideal jacket for travel', 'author': 'Caroline', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I liked this jacket so much I bought it in a second color. I LOVE it for traveling - it's flattering, waterproof, lightweight but warm, perfect for layering, has underarm zippers so it's good for running without undue sweating, and it's comfy. I may end up buying more!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish, Well Made Rain Jacket', 'author': 'Dana Crowell', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Pros: Love the vibrant color. It's very well-made, not cheap and flimsy like so many products bought online. Several pockets for keys, phone, hands, etc. Mesh inside to help with airflow. Hood is deep to keep hair and face dry. Love that it rolls up into a small pouch for packing. Price was great for such a well-made jacket.Cons: I would like it to be longer in the back to keep my rear end dry should I need to sit somewhere that's wet. I bought it for a cruise and it's very likely I'll end up having to sit somewhere that's wet from rain. I wish the cuffs on the sleeves were elastic rather than velcro. I'm not a fan of velcro because it sticks to certain kinds of fabric and leaves pills, plus it's just not as comfortable a fit when velcro is used instead of elastic.All in all, the pros well outweigh the cons, so for the price, I'll likely keep it and use it. Even if I end up purchasing another one that's longer in the back, this one will be great to wear.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fashionable and effective raincoat', 'author': 'Narcoossee gal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This raincoat is well designed with waterproof fabric and seams. The cut is feminine with slight shaping at the waist and wider hips. I like the slightly longer tail so that my back is not exposed when I lean forward. The hood provides ample coverage, and it is easy to cinch tighter. One caveat: This coat runs SMALL so order the next size larger than your usual size. I found the shoulder width and the upper back width just right in the next larger size. I appreciate the zippered underarm vents. As well this coat has zippered inside and outside pockets on the upper left plus zippered pockets at each hip. The interior mesh lining provides air movement. I like this coat and I hope it lasts for years to come.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality and proper fit!', 'author': 'M. Garcia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It‚Äôs rare that I order a clothing item from here and find that it‚Äôs well made and fits properly according to the description. I ordered an XXL and for reference I am 224lb with a 42in waist and 46in bust. It‚Äôs pretty warm for a light raincoat. Has zippers under the armpits for ventilation and does repel water. I‚Äôm very pleased with it especially for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful raincoat!', 'author': 'bob zierden', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this coat! The size is perfect, love the burgundy color, pockets are fantastic, the hood cinches closed. I walked out in the rain for quite some time and was completely dry and warm with a sweater under it. Wonderful purchase! I bought one for my daughter. Very lightweight but very durable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Everything you‚Äôd want in a quality raincoat!', 'author': 'Sam Richard', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This easily compares to LL Bean‚Äôs raincoat (unfortunately including the price; EXCEPT it can be tried on and size-exchanged free! And it DOES go on sale!)It has lots of nice pockets in useful places, underarm vents, a covered zipper, a slightly longer back (to keep dripping rain off your bum), and a hood that has a brim AND isn‚Äôt so deep that it drops down in front of my face!Plus, it comes in lots of colors to choose from.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Waterproof protection', 'author': 'Linda Petro', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is truly waterproof. Its roomy and comfortable, and I absolutely love the midnight blue color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality, Gorgeous Color', 'author': 'Emily Jones', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered this rain jacket and also the puffer from the same brand and love them both!I needed a packable rain jacket for an upcoming trip to Scotland. I originally wanted a ‚Äútri climate‚Äù version from a very expensive brand but decided to try Outdoor Ventures first and I‚Äôm so glad I saved my money! No, they don‚Äôt zip together but that doesn‚Äôt bother me.It‚Äôs well made, waterproof (only worn a few times in rain, will update after my trip!) and isn‚Äôt too noisy (you know that windbreaker, cheap plastic noise every time you move? This doesn‚Äôt make a lot of noise).Details about sizing: I‚Äôm very petite. 4‚Äô11‚Äù and 115 lbs. I ordered the rain jacket in a small and as you can see from the pictures it‚Äôs quite generously sized. The sleeves are a little long but they can be tightened down. It‚Äôs great for my plan to layer over another, warmer coat but if I had been planning to use it mainly in a warm, rainy climate I would have gone with an XS.My one critique is the zip openings under the arms‚Ä¶ I wish it didn‚Äôt have those as I never use them but it‚Äôs not a deal breaker.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice but big and boxy', 'author': 'Bernie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I didn\'t get to wear this in the rain but returned it after just trying it on. title: Women's Apex Bionic 3 Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect jacket', 'author': 'JMDesign', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great in between jacket. title: Women's Faux Leather Moto Biker Short Coat Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fall weather jacket with alot of style', 'author': 'Linda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was hesitant to purchase this jacket, because I wasn\'t sure what size to buy. I normally wear an x-small or small in outerwear depending on the fabric. But because it was faux leather I was concerned about the cut under the arms. I was thinking an x-small might be too constrictive and it wouldn\'t allow me to raise my arms comfortably and it might pull too much. But because it was lightweight, I took a chance on the x-small and I am glad I did. It fit me perfectly and it was not uncomfortable.I love this style and the fact that it was short. I am only 5\'2" and weigh 95 lbs. I bought this jacket to wear with my flared jeans, and I wanted it to make my legs look longer, which it did. If you are a shorter person, cropped jackets look better because they are not so overwhelming and they make you look taller than what you are.The sleeves were a little long, but I like them that way. It doesn\'t look like you outgrew the jacket.The fabric is soft and pliable and not stiff. I have bought several faux leather jackets in the past, but this style, texture and fit was the best I have ever had.It is perfect for the fall weather. I mostly wear denim jackets, but this gives me a dressy alternative. The x-small was just the right size, style and fit for me, because I don\'t intend to wear heavy sweaters under it. So you will have to decide the kind of clothing you will be wearing underneath it to select the size you need.Even though the zipper is slightly off center, I can wear it open (which will be most of the time) without it looking funny and the lapels lay flat.So if you want a lightweight, fashionable and comfortable faux leather jacket that doesn\'t look or feel cheap, I highly recommend this one. I guarantee you will get alot of compliments.Side note---packaging was good and it was not wrinkled. Yeah!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gorgeous and edgy jacket!', 'author': 'EW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have $1500 leather jackets from Italy and I must admit that I was stunned when I put this red jacket on! Plus the XS fits me like a glove even though the measurements here are much bigger. Really love this jacket and it‚Äôs a steal for the price. Don‚Äôt tell anyone how little you paid for it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent fabric, boxier than photos, buy 1 size up if wearing with sweaters', 'author': 'Aimee Elsey', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'7" 205lb, I usually wear a L or XL and I bought the XXL. The sleeves are snug worn over thicker sweaters, but I run into that a lot so it might not be an issue for most.The ad photo makes it look like it tapers at the waist, but it doesn\'t. This moto style is generally pretty boxy so it\'s quite loose in the waist. I was expecting that so I wasn\'t bothered, but be ye warned! Very supple and not overly shiny. The only give-away to me is that it\'s a little squeaky, and it\'s very very thin, which noone else will notice anyway.Would absolutely buy again.Too soon to speak to durability but overall for an affordable faux leather, I really like it.Customer service was easy and efficient too: I recieved the jacket and the lining had been sewn improperly to the shell in such a way that it caused one shoulder to pucker and invert when I put it on. title: Women's Gondola Insulated Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice', 'author': 'NurseyMe80', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lovely floral print coat. Best part is it fits quite well. Enough room to wear a sweater/ sweatshirt underneath, and still be able to have unrestricted movement of my arms. I already own a pair of ladies Arctix snowpants, this coat is the same quality, and is very warm with lots of pockets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a true to size, super warm ski jacket', 'author': 'fancy kitty', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered the Large at first after reading other reviews. I\'m 5\'8 155lbs, athletic with big boobs. The large was really large everywhere, I don\'t mind the oversized look but it was quite large in the shoulders and the body so I returned it for the medium. The medium fits perfectly with plenty of room for layers. What I like the best about it is that it is super warm and it is long enough to cover my bum in the back. It has a longer back than front.There are tons of pockets including ones on the sleeve for a ski pass. The hood is big enough to fit over my ski helmet which keeps you super warm. My only complaint is that the neck is a little narrow. I can\'t get the hood over my helmet and zip the coat up all the way with a gator on underneath. Without a helmet I can have the hood up and zip the coat closed but it still isn\'t wide enough at the neck to come over my chin/mouth. When recently skiing in the Rockies it was around 0 degrees F and I was so warm I had to remove a base layer, a first for me.It\'s pretty basic in its looks, the longer back is the only thing "stylish" about it, but when it comes to being warm in the outdoors I value function over form. Great value for $99.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Do not waste your money', 'author': 'Lola', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The coat runs small and the main reason I give 1 star is because the zipper completely broke and now I can't return it and have a winter coat that doesn't zip. Don't waste your money", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is amazing. It has lots of pockets and tight sleeve thingy at ends of arms to keep wrists from getting snow in. Good buy. As for sizing, I am 5\'3" and weigh 190lbs (not chesty) and it fits perfect. I can wear a long john shirt under it and its not to big or I can wear a sweatshirt and it still feels good. I ordered XL.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful wind proof, water proof coat', 'author': 'CJtravels', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So, so happy I took a chance and bought on "other options" seller (or something like that). Paid less and it still has the tags on it. Because of many reviews of bad quality control, I checked the coat thoroughly. The stitching is very good. The zippers and snaps are good quality. This ski jacket is a good replacement for my long time winter coat. This year has been significantly colder, rainier, and snowing at lower elevations. A friend told me that ski jackets, while insulated, were lightweight and not bulky. It is a little heavy but when I put it on and zipped it up, I could raise my arms over my head without any restrictions/stiffness. I am confident this coat will keep out the wind because of the many zippers and snaps, and also the inner sleeve that covers my wrist and has a thumb hole.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Lacks Quality Control', 'author': 'NorCal Girl', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I really wanted to like this jacket. I\'m exchanging it in hopes that the replacement will be better (I don\'t have high hopes). For reference, I\'m 5\'5", 125 lbs. The medium fits me in most respects, but the sleeves are a bit snug. I doubt I\'ll be able to get more than 1 layer of long-sleeves shirts into the arms before it becomes too uncomfortable. However, it does seem thick and warm enough that maybe I won\'t have to double-up layers underneath.Pros:The Plum color is very attractive.The cut and styling are flattering.Cons (see photos):The stitching is horrendous! Straight lines are wavy, extra fabric is caught in edging, ends are messy with multiple thread colors jumbled in big knots at key visible locations (other reviewers have mentioned this also), loose threads hang out everywhere, thread tension is loose (those of you that sew know what I\'m talking about!).Tailor\'s chalk marks are visible in several locations.All zipper pulls are light-weight and flimsy. I expect they\'ll snap pretty quick. Also, the front zipper, which is two-way (can be opened from either the top or bottom) has already snagged twice requiring extra effort to take the jacket off.And so much more. I\'ll update this review after receiving the exchanged item.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hood is very large and coat small for me', 'author': 'CRT', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I was hoping to really like this jacket as the price was awesome. I liked the material and style though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Broken zipper', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just got it for Christmas and zipper broke already after snagging.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm and comfy', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This may not be totally waterproof, I'm only using on nice days, but it is warm and comfy, with great pockets and a two way zipper and nice storm cuffs at wrist. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Quality and Super Warm ‚Ä¢ 10/10', 'author': 'Julia Keville', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I absolutely love this coat! ‚Ä¢It doesn‚Äôt have a strange smell nor does it come in bad packaging, it is amazing and comes in a great zippered pouch that is reusable for anything! I ordered a large and x-large, and tried both on with a variety of clothing. I found the large fit as close to perfect as I was hoping for. It provided enough room when wearing more bulky layers; however, it was a bit tight, not uncomfortably so, in the upper arm area and I had to unzip the sides to sit comfortably. It was especially comfortable wearing lighter layers (which is all I ended up needing). The x-large felt too big all over. The other concern was the jacket\'s quality, as many pictures showed tears at the seams. I haven\'t owned/warn the jacket long enough to comment on this concern, but will update my review if that changes. I found the jacket (with one or two light layers underneath) kept me plenty warm in temperatures of 30 degrees F, and I was literally sweating when indoors. Interesting side note, while in Canada, I came across five other women wearing the same jacket. Lastly, I bought the jacket during a sale for $95. In my opinion, a great price for the jacket\'s quality. Overall, I\'m very happy with the purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it', 'author': 'Rachel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jackets awesome. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs waterproof but it‚Äôs resistant.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm and Stylish!', 'author': 'Angela', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I purchased the Orolay Women‚Äôs Thickened Down Jacket in anticipation for winter (plus it was on sale!), and it will become my go-to coat for the cold weather. The jacket arrived on time and was well-packaged in its own dust cover bag. Initially, I was impressed with the quality of the material and the fabric feels durable yet comfortable.The fit is true to size. The pockets are well-placed and spacious, perfect for my phone, keys, and cold hands. Another feature I love is the adjustable hood, which is large enough to provide excellent protection against wind and rain.The only downside is that the zipper at times can be a bit finicky, requiring a little bit of patience to get it started. However, this is a minor issue compared to the overall functionality and style of the jacket.This is a fantastic value for its price. It combines warmth, comfort, and style without compromising on quality. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable winter coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Toasty warm and stylish', 'author': 'Knitwit14', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had been debating over this coat for years and finally broke down and bought in during a Black Friday deal. And the coat was even better than I'd expected (and getting the nicer version with the faux fur was worth it). All of the materials are very sturdy and the coat is unbelievably warm. It also looks really nice on! It even fits on the bottom without having to utilize the side zippers, which I'd worried about as I am quite curvy there. But the zippers do add more give when you need it--like sitting for a long period. The only negative to this coat so far is the side pocket openings are really small for some reason and a little awkwardly placed; they hold a decent amount, it's just hard to get things in or out while you're wearing the coat. Will be using the front-facing pockets much more.I got a 2x--my normal size and what the measurements recommended--and was fine ... a 3x probably would be good for more room over heavy sweaters, but I think it wouldn't have fit in the shoulders as well based on how the 2x fits. So if you don't mind a little bagginess and/or plan to layer a bit, or want it loose around the bottom, you may want to size up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This coat is AMAZING and truly keeps the extreme cold out', 'author': 'Jjfreshbread', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This coat is big, cozy, and warm. It‚Äôs like wearing a hug. The many features added to adjust for size and fit differences make this coat truly stand out. They made the difference of this coat fitting me when at first i thought it too small. Using the side zips for additional space (or making the coat more snug) and unsnapping the bilateral snaps by the front closure zipper made it work for me. And in colder weather, I re-snap the ones by the front closure zipper that adds a little more toast to its ‚Äútoastyness‚Äù. The numerous pockets are essential for true winter coats. Who wants to carry a bag when it‚Äôs super cold outside? Not me, therefore, the pockets become priceless. The added zipper pulls make it very easy to open/close the pockets when one is wearing beefy hand coverings. The pockets for your hands are lined and very warm. The hood is large and beefy and makes it so one can forego a scarf, and sometimes even a hat. I live in Wisconsin and it‚Äôs currently 30 degrees below zero with the windchill. This coat is so warm, i would never guess the temp is this low. I‚Äôve worn Lands‚Äô End coats religiously my whole life, that is until i found this coat. It‚Äôs a true rival.With all of this praise, i do have some suggestions: add a double-zipper to the open/close front zipper. This is a crucial feature in cold weather environments and almost kept me from buying the coat. One needs the added comfort for sitting in the car, as well as being able to reach your pants pockets without having to unzip the coat completely. Then there‚Äôs the great hood, which some of the features that make it great also make it functionally difficult to wear. First, it‚Äôs so large and cumbersome that it interferes with your visibility while driving. You either have to take the coat off to drive (which is very cold until the car heats up) or deal with compromised visibility. Therefore, this hood should be removable. One can keep the interior edges and fringe of the hood much cleaner when it‚Äôs removable too, which means you can make the coat last longer. Also, since it is so big that you can forego a scarf, with a few added snaps and/or straps, then you could keep the hood from blowing off on windy days. Having to use one less article of clothing is a major plus, and this would be an easy additional feature to add. Actually, all of these suggestions are simple but very crucial to those of us who wear the coat day-in and day-out. A casual wearer might not be bothered as much by these features.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very warm and cozy', 'author': 'nicole vizzini', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was skeptical after reading all of the varied reviews but I am so glad I trusted my gut and bought this jacket. I haven't gone snow skiing with this coat but I can only imagine that it will enhace the experience by keeping me toasty warm! Sizing was perfect. It's roomy enough for a sweater or sweatshirt underneath and I have gotten quite a few compliments about this coat. I love the faux fur lining around hood and that hood is seriously no joke. Great price on Amazon!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth The Hype', 'author': 'Mico', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket was a true life saver- once you get the correct sizing from the company. I needed a warm jacket for 20-30 degree weather and wanted to give this a try based on all of the amazing reviews. I ordered an XS (5‚Äô4, 108lbs) and the company sent me a complete different jacket. Amazon made it very easy to replace the jacket for the correct one and it arrived the following day. This time I was sent a medium! Had to return this one again!! and amazon had the replacement sent to me two days later. When the xs small finally came I kept it and reordered the coat in an XXS. I read people were going up a size for layering but this jacket is very wide. As others have mentioned, the zippers along the side allow for a lot of extra room if unzipped and help when sitting and layering. I ended up returning the XS and keeping the XXS because it was still large enough to comfortably layer with long John‚Äôs, sweaters, tights and jeans. It‚Äôs very comfortable and kept me warm walking all around NYC in snow, wind and damp weather. The hood stayed up and the lining was very warm. Though it is an oversized fit it still managed to look nice and pulled together. Almost 30k 5 star reviews are not wrong! At this price point it‚Äôs a no brainer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Southerners living in colder climates need to make this a staple of your winter wardrobe. SERIOUSLY.', 'author': 'Phillips T.H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I purchased my sunny yellow Orolay Thickened Down Jacket in July, anticipating a heavy mid-Atlantic weather. As a Southerner, my previous coats from other companies left me freezing each year and I wanted to treat myself to a better coat.\xa0I have been really happy with my coat so far, despite teasing from locals that I was ridiculous for wearing it in 40-degree late fall and I could be seen from space in such a bright color. But the joke was on them when it suddenly dropped into the 20s and I was still cozily in my coat outside! Plus, the yellow shade is so sunny as days get shorter, I get compliments every time I wear it because it cheers people up to see it. Additionally, I feel safer wearing it while out with my students or my kids because I am so easily located.Unfortunately, fast forward to January and while out with my kids in the snow, I bent down to brush snow off my child and the main center zipper ripped away from the\xa0fabric of the coat at the bottom. I was bummed, because I'd been sledding and had no issues with it and I've worn it while being tackle-hugged by various ages of kids at work--all without any incident or showing of wear or tear.\xa0I am hoping I can securely repair the zipper this time, but if other\xa0rips appear from predictable wearing of the coat (bending down, etc.), I am really hoping they only happen where I can easily repair it. This coat is SO warm, and it's a parent's dream coat because of the secure and deep pockets. The hood is nice and deep for windy days and I like that the elastic cuffs help keep gloves in place or let me tuck my hands in to warm up even faster when I forget my gloves.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Womens Winter Long Sleeve Button Sherpa Jacket Coat Pockets Warm Fleece
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love these fleeces', 'author': 'Tia Karen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "ANOTHER UPDATE: I LOVE these fleece jackets. I have bought a number of them and just bought three more. These are fleece lined and then sherpa faced on the outside --hence a double thickness of warmth. The snaps work well. The small fit me perfectly, at 5'3 and 120lbs. The colors are pretty much as shown. The snaps are substantial, the webbed hem and cuffs are really perfect and somewhat stretchy (I even fit the sleeve over my cast), and the neck buttons up nice and high for really fiercely cold day. I do have a little trouble getting some of my coats and jackets over these as they are of substantial thickness.THESE JACKETS/FLEECES ARE A LIFESAVER AS THEY HAVE ALLOWED ME TO SUBSTANTIALLY TO LOWER MY HEAT, EVEN ON REALLY COLD DAYS, TO ABOUT 62F. ONLY MY FEET GET COLD. BUT WE HAVE AN OIL FURNACE SO HAVE HAD A SUBSTANTIAL SAVINGS WITH OIL PRICES SO HIGH. IT IS NOT IN MY NATURE TO GIVE RAVE REVIEWS, BUT IN MY OPINION THIS PRODUCT DESERVES 5 STARS+++++.MY ORIGINAL REVIEW: I first bought two for myself to see about the fit and quality. The small fit me perfectly, with the little bit of looseness I like for a turtleneck or tee underneath. I'm 5'3 & 117 lbs. The length is good and the small size hits at my low hip, & the arms are just the right length. (My arms are longer than you'd predict from my size.) Thus, you can expect these to be true to size, & they certainly look MUCH better than they appear on the model. Why did they use those awful photos?The fleece is very thick, does not shed, and is a bit stretchy. I cannot believe how warm, -- oh so warm -- they are. The pockets are substantial; I can carry my big cell phone around in them. Be sure to keep them tucked as intended (from near the side seam & then toward the zipper) or they can make you look a bit thick around the girth -- not a big issue, though, as you simply need to adjust them when first putting the fleece on.The quality is very good. The snaps are substantial and go all the way up & down, allowing ANOTHER fleece to be worn in various styles, such as open, partly open, mostly closed, or turtle neck style. The ribbed front placket, pocket openings, & the cuffs are very nice: thick, well-sewn, & somewhat stretchy. The colors on my phone screen compared to the colors that arrived are very similar.I did not expect these to be as thick & lush as they are, so I do have some trouble fitting them under a few winter coats & jackets. This, however, would not stop me from buying more!I did not expect these to be such a good buy, BUT THEY ARE, so I bought quite a few others in different colors. The quality control & sizing remained the same. No worries about some being too big & others too small.I highly recommend these, especially if you live in cold climes or just like to lounge around in cooler weather in something really comfortable. A big thumbs up on these.UPDATE: I washed a few of these. They wash nicely on a permanent press cycle, and they dried without leaving lots of fluff in the dryer or on other clothing. Now I highly, highly recommend them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So cute!', 'author': 'Deb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Jacket is very soft and true to size. Warm and light weight. I am very satisfied with this purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Arms are a touch short', 'author': 'mariel chandler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù and ordered a medium. This is a great quality, warm, soft alternative to a winter jacket (think fall/ spring) but it‚Äôs not one I would wear to a football game or active outing. The arms are just a bit short and it‚Äôs not going to protect your waist if you need to bend over. I would‚Äôve gotten a large to be a little more wearable over sweaters and such. Still happy with the purchase and wear it frequently for quick trips/ warmth.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality, Comfort and Style!', 'author': 'Shaun P. Ortiz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this lightweight jacket on my Wishlist for awhile and it finally came up on a Lightening Sale so I grabbed one. My cream colored jacket is as beautiful as advertised! Once I shook it out and fluffed it up in my dryer on low heat it was ready to wear. The Sherpa style is as seen, the interior is smooth without rough seams and it‚Äôs nice and warm. A lighter weight jacket for sure but I was warm and cozy in 50 degree weather. I really like that the sleeves are proportional, it seems that a lot of what I buy lately have really long, bulky sleeves. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô2‚Äù and 127 pounds and this jacket fits perfectly! I‚Äôm delighted with this purchase and I‚Äôm thinking of buying another one, there are lots of nice colors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice!!', 'author': 'amactwo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fit perfectly, very warm and comfortable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice', 'author': 'Amazon Shopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Highly recommend.
