I am 5‚Äô7‚Äù with sort of long arms and the length of the arms on this is very good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars 2023Update!ChampionC9 Women's(Stretchy)CardioJacket(Yoga) and Pant Coordinate OurGrade A Solid C+", 'author': 'jj/thewhiteAdrianaLima/ThewhiteWaif', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Our (2023Updated)Review In Short Of TheC9 Champion Women's Full Zip Cardio Jacket, Ebonyblk- and matching slackfit/coordinateC9 Champion Women's Curvy Fit (Stretchy) Yoga Pant, Ebonyblk -LongLength -Like most naturally lean female body types ZerotoTwodress or ZerotoFourdress, standard tall-- taller than 5ft6, (myself being 5ft7) I prefer a slack fit in the stretchy yoga sets, and have found that unlike the old xersion bootcutpant and jacket sets in which you could get away with going only one size up (Medium) in both, for a relaxed fit that will take you to lunch or running errands dresscode wise, in the ChampionC9 you will need to go up one size in the jacket(toMedium) but as much as two or more in the pants(toLarge-toeXtraLarge) to get a proper relaxed slack fit. And even having been on bed rest for an injury I can still fit my oversized yogalates outfits while getting back in shape. SO there is something to say about going for the relaxed slack fit in your fitness attire.Special Notes:Prior to 2010, For a more relaxed exercise YogaLates outfit -fit you can go one size up in the Exersion brandTops and Bottoms from the standard small to a medium.Prior to 2010, For a more relaxed exercise YogaLates outfit -fit you can go one size up in the Gaiam brand Tops and Bottoms from the standard small to a medium.After 2010 In the Champion and C9, you can still get a relaxed fit by going one size up in the tops/jacket from a small to a medium but in the pants for best results you should go two or more sizes up from small to Large and if you are standard tall or taller in the pants for a more relaxed slack yogalates fit that will take you from the gym to lunch-you will need to go to LargeTall or XLargeTall in the pants and medium in the tops/jacket.After 2010 In the GearTek or TekGear, you can get a relaxed fit by going one size up in the tops/jacket from a small to a medium but in the pants for best results you should go two or more sizes up from small to Large and if you are standard tall or taller in the pants for a more relaxed slack yogalates fit that will take you from the gym to lunch-you will need to go to LargeTall or XLargeTall in the pants and medium in the tops/jacket.When Amazon took over the branding permissions from target, I was a bit skeptical as the Target-Instore and Targetdotcom returns policy is very easy and the additional off with the sale offerings really g a long way when maintaining a budget, and Amazon coupons are infrequent at best and also Amazon has no boutique, so you can‚Äôt actually try things on before you buy to get an idea of the cut/fit of the style of garment. But, that being said, if you buy the black or midnightNavy, the overall look should be fine and if it‚Äôs a bit looser than expected you can still work out and maintain a manicured fitness-garment appearance that you can do other things in. I like a longer line, so I ordered the long. In the jacket it‚Äôs fine to go one size up to maintain the relaxed fit.Overall Not a bad item, although the prices could be more competitive.Our grade A Solid C+ or 3.5125Stars", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Womens Winter Long Sleeve Button Sherpa Jacket Coat Pockets Warm Fleece
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love these fleeces', 'author': 'Tia Karen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "ANOTHER UPDATE: I LOVE these fleece jackets. I have bought a number of them and just bought three more. These are fleece lined and then sherpa faced on the outside --hence a double thickness of warmth. The snaps work well. The small fit me perfectly, at 5'3 and 120lbs. The colors are pretty much as shown. The snaps are substantial, the webbed hem and cuffs are really perfect and somewhat stretchy (I even fit the sleeve over my cast), and the neck buttons up nice and high for really fiercely cold day. I do have a little trouble getting some of my coats and jackets over these as they are of substantial thickness.THESE JACKETS/FLEECES ARE A LIFESAVER AS THEY HAVE ALLOWED ME TO SUBSTANTIALLY TO LOWER MY HEAT, EVEN ON REALLY COLD DAYS, TO ABOUT 62F. ONLY MY FEET GET COLD. BUT WE HAVE AN OIL FURNACE SO HAVE HAD A SUBSTANTIAL SAVINGS WITH OIL PRICES SO HIGH. IT IS NOT IN MY NATURE TO GIVE RAVE REVIEWS, BUT IN MY OPINION THIS PRODUCT DESERVES 5 STARS+++++.MY ORIGINAL REVIEW: I first bought two for myself to see about the fit and quality. The small fit me perfectly, with the little bit of looseness I like for a turtleneck or tee underneath. I'm 5'3 & 117 lbs. The length is good and the small size hits at my low hip, & the arms are just the right length. (My arms are longer than you'd predict from my size.) Thus, you can expect these to be true to size, & they certainly look MUCH better than they appear on the model. Why did they use those awful photos?The fleece is very thick, does not shed, and is a bit stretchy. I cannot believe how warm, -- oh so warm -- they are. The pockets are substantial; I can carry my big cell phone around in them. Be sure to keep them tucked as intended (from near the side seam & then toward the zipper) or they can make you look a bit thick around the girth -- not a big issue, though, as you simply need to adjust them when first putting the fleece on.The quality is very good. The snaps are substantial and go all the way up & down, allowing ANOTHER fleece to be worn in various styles, such as open, partly open, mostly closed, or turtle neck style. The ribbed front placket, pocket openings, & the cuffs are very nice: thick, well-sewn, & somewhat stretchy. The colors on my phone screen compared to the colors that arrived are very similar.I did not expect these to be as thick & lush as they are, so I do have some trouble fitting them under a few winter coats & jackets. This, however, would not stop me from buying more!I did not expect these to be such a good buy, BUT THEY ARE, so I bought quite a few others in different colors. The quality control & sizing remained the same. No worries about some being too big & others too small.I highly recommend these, especially if you live in cold climes or just like to lounge around in cooler weather in something really comfortable. A big thumbs up on these.UPDATE: I washed a few of these. They wash nicely on a permanent press cycle, and they dried without leaving lots of fluff in the dryer or on other clothing. Now I highly, highly recommend them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So cute!', 'author': 'Deb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Jacket is very soft and true to size. Warm and light weight. I am very satisfied with this purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Arms are a touch short', 'author': 'mariel chandler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù and ordered a medium. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5‚Äù @ 110lbs and ordered a small for reference.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great dupe - thick and well made', 'author': 'Honulii', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and the thickness of the hoodie right out of the packaging (it came in a clear bag so the postman could see exactly what was inside). Most inexpensive hoodies are really flimsy and thin (which can also be good since I'm in humid weather). Inside is soft like a sweatshirt.Got the heather gray and it's a very light gray. I am short with an athletic build and the small fits great, not overly bulky or oversized where I look stocky. Sleeves were not overly long whereas the Lulu version I had to roll up the cuff because it was just too long. I typically never use thumb holes so not much to comment about that. If you have long arms, this might be short on you. Hood is lined and pretty thick, so when you zip it all the way up and put it over your head, it stays just like the name brand one. Length comes to about my hips, so not cropped but not long where it will cover your butt.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jogger jacket', 'author': 'Donna Ferguson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is so cute.. so soft & warm.. fit is perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Like a lulu scuba but thicker', 'author': 'SJune', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfy and cute. title: Women's Gondola Insulated Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice', 'author': 'NurseyMe80', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lovely floral print coat. Best part is it fits quite well. Enough room to wear a sweater/ sweatshirt underneath, and still be able to have unrestricted movement of my arms. I already own a pair of ladies Arctix snowpants, this coat is the same quality, and is very warm with lots of pockets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a true to size, super warm ski jacket', 'author': 'fancy kitty', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered the Large at first after reading other reviews. I\'m 5\'8 155lbs, athletic with big boobs. The large was really large everywhere, I don\'t mind the oversized look but it was quite large in the shoulders and the body so I returned it for the medium. The medium fits perfectly with plenty of room for layers. What I like the best about it is that it is super warm and it is long enough to cover my bum in the back. It has a longer back than front.There are tons of pockets including ones on the sleeve for a ski pass. The hood is big enough to fit over my ski helmet which keeps you super warm. My only complaint is that the neck is a little narrow. I can\'t get the hood over my helmet and zip the coat up all the way with a gator on underneath. Without a helmet I can have the hood up and zip the coat closed but it still isn\'t wide enough at the neck to come over my chin/mouth. When recently skiing in the Rockies it was around 0 degrees F and I was so warm I had to remove a base layer, a first for me.It\'s pretty basic in its looks, the longer back is the only thing "stylish" about it, but when it comes to being warm in the outdoors I value function over form. Great value for $99.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Do not waste your money', 'author': 'Lola', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The coat runs small and the main reason I give 1 star is because the zipper completely broke and now I can't return it and have a winter coat that doesn't zip. I wore it for 2 weeks before the zipper started getting stuck. Then it would randomly unzip and at last the zipper completely broke off. As my title states... Don't waste your money", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is amazing. It has lots of pockets and tight sleeve thingy at ends of arms to keep wrists from getting snow in. Good buy. As for sizing, I am 5\'3" and weigh 190lbs (not chesty) and it fits perfect. I can wear a long john shirt under it and its not to big or I can wear a sweatshirt and it still feels good. I ordered XL.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful wind proof, water proof coat', 'author': 'CJtravels', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So, so happy I took a chance and bought on "other options" seller (or something like that). Paid less and it still has the tags on it. Because of many reviews of bad quality control, I checked the coat thoroughly. The stitching is very good. The zippers and snaps are good quality. This ski jacket is a good replacement for my long time winter coat. This year has been significantly colder, rainier, and snowing at lower elevations. A friend told me that ski jackets, while insulated, were lightweight and not bulky. It is a little heavy but when I put it on and zipped it up, I could raise my arms over my head without any restrictions/stiffness. I am confident this coat will keep out the wind because of the many zippers and snaps, and also the inner sleeve that covers my wrist and has a thumb hole.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Lacks Quality Control', 'author': 'NorCal Girl', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I really wanted to like this jacket. I\'m exchanging it in hopes that the replacement will be better (I don\'t have high hopes). For reference, I\'m 5\'5", 125 lbs. The medium fits me in most respects, but the sleeves are a bit snug. I doubt I\'ll be able to get more than 1 layer of long-sleeves shirts into the arms before it becomes too uncomfortable. However, it does seem thick and warm enough that maybe I won\'t have to double-up layers underneath.Pros:The Plum color is very attractive.The cut and styling are flattering.Cons (see photos):The stitching is horrendous! Straight lines are wavy, extra fabric is caught in edging, ends are messy with multiple thread colors jumbled in big knots at key visible locations (other reviewers have mentioned this also), loose threads hang out everywhere, thread tension is loose (those of you that sew know what I\'m talking about!).Tailor\'s chalk marks are visible in several locations.All zipper pulls are light-weight and flimsy. I expect they\'ll snap pretty quick. Also, the front zipper, which is two-way (can be opened from either the top or bottom) has already snagged twice requiring extra effort to take the jacket off.And so much more. I\'ll update this review after receiving the exchanged item.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hood is very large and coat small for me', 'author': 'CRT', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I was hoping to really like this jacket as the price was awesome. I'm 5'3 and 175 lbs and ordered a large which normally fits. Unfortunately, it was a bit too tight as I'm chesty. I would have reordered a xl however the hood was way way too big, even with the adjustments. I liked the material and style though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Broken zipper', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just got it for Christmas and zipper broke already after snagging.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm and comfy', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This may not be totally waterproof, I'm only using on nice days, but it is warm and comfy, with great pockets and a two way zipper and nice storm cuffs at wrist. There is no waist storm cuff.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket for the Northwest', 'author': 'AM', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I gave 4 stars because after zipping the bottom it‚Äôs a bit of a pain to get it to flow as I‚Äôm bending down. title: Women's Daybreak Insulated Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally Figured Out Arctix Sizing', 'author': 'Debbie Lee Wesselmann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I normally wear a medium top and jacket, but of course it depends a little on the manufacturer. Sometimes I need a large. With Arctix, I never seemed to get it right -- until now. I have a Daybreak jacket in large, but I swim in it. I have a Blizzard jacket in medium, and it\'s tight around the hips. I finally decided to try this Daybreak in a medium -- and it fits perfectly. The key is looking at how Arctix describes the fit. This Daybreak is "relaxed fit" while the almost-too-small Blizzard is "classic fit." If you are curvy, either size up in a classic or get your usual size in a relaxed fit.I love the muted color of the Steel Melange. The jacket is quilted in the inside for good insulation, while the outer shell is water- and wind-resistant. Although the hood cannot be detached, I hardly notice it. I love that I can snap the top to protect my neck. The zipper flap also closes with snaps. Even though I cannot imagine that it will really keep me warm in below zero temperatures without tons of layers underneath, it is certainly warm enough in the 20s and 30s.I really like that this jacket is not bulky because I can take it on trips without worrying too much about the space it takes.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute jacket!', 'author': 'Lindsey Uher', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the color, kept me nice and warm in 15 degrees and has lots of pockets and good features to hold all of your goodies! I normally wear a medium and this was a little hit but fits great with layers underneath. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5 and 145lbs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Doesn‚Äôt have snow skirt and poor quality control', 'author': 'Brittany j.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For the price, it‚Äôs a good jacket. It‚Äôll do the job and keep me warm and it‚Äôs a nice color however it doesn‚Äôt have a snow skirt which is disappointing. The fit is a little big but that‚Äôs ok because I want room for clothes underneath anyway. The quality control however is poor - I did ‚Äútry before you buy‚Äù and the differences between the large and XL were crazy. The XL was missing buttons and pockets that the large had. Made no sense. Also, the Large has a fake pocket on the top which is kind of annoying because I wanted space for my things‚Ä¶', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the color and the lining', 'author': 'A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was exactly what I was looking for. I found one at Bass Pro but they didn't have my size. Found it here and it was less than at BP ($49 when I bought it).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Poorly made!', 'author': 'Lucylou', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I have ordered this item twice and both have very defective sewing! The hood on the last coat wasn't even lined up on the neck. One the first coat the lining was half sewn in. Cute coat just too bad it's made so poorly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket that keeps you warm with lots of pockets', 'author': 'LisaB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got a great deal on this jacket and I love it. I‚Äôm short 4‚Äô 11‚Äù and purchase the Small in color Amethyst. It falls a few inches below my butt and is not too snug. It has 6 external pockets and 2 on the inside. If you love pockets in your jackets you‚Äôll love this. You have places to put your stuff and you can still keep your hands warm in one of the sets of pockets. It has elastic at the cuffs with velcro to tighten. This works great and actually fits around my wrists well. Haven‚Äôt been able to test it in the rain to see how water resistant it is but does well on those cold windy days. The zip can be a little stiff sometimes but the jacket feels well made and with quality material.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Pro: warm, con: poor quality', 'author': 'Lit Rox', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Purchased for actic winter activities in snow and freezing temperatures. This is good for a typical winter in eastern U.S. and midwest if using layer system.Pro: Looks stylish and fits well. Warm coat, multiple pockets, good top layer in 3 layer system, great main zipper up the front of the coat (secure and water resistant), elastic and velcro on wrists help secure gloves in place. Water and wind resistant. Two interior pockets are great and besides the front flap pockets on the hips, there are also pockets beneath them to slip your hands in from the side.Con: lightweight, small pockets that also don't allow much bulge, poor quality control, one zipper pocket misaligned and many loose threads tangled into stitching. Water resistant and may get heavy once waterlogged. There is only one breast pocket, the right one is just a flap for design, it's not a pocket.Nuetral: hood is lightweight so it will fit over warm headgear and prevent your head from getting soaked by rain, but it doesn't tighten up with a drawstring. It's thin, not bulky. This may be perfect depending on if you're wearing a beanie or helmet but won't be good for keeping your head warm.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit, light weight, and warm!', 'author': 'Jacqueline Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Product arrived early. This coat is true to size, light weight and very warm. I think I found my new favorite winter coat!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very beautiful vibrant colors', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got a purple one in large I could easily go with a medium and still have room for layers. Order one size up for better fit.', 'author': 'Becky C.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I\'m a standard medium when it comes to jackets. I am 5\'9 with a short torso and long arms. I ordered a large based on reviews and it fit perfectly. When I first pulled this jacket out of the box, I was pretty impressed with it for the price. It has a lot of style and I loved the stitching details and look of the black pleather. It looks more expensive than it is. I wasn\'t as impressed when I put the jacket on. Size wise, it fit just fine in length and arms but was definitely made with for someone with a bigger chest size than me (I\'m 34B). It was very wide in that area and left extra material around my armpits that just looked wrong. I couldn\'t have sized down any more though - would have been too tight to zip. Same goes for the bottom of the jacket. It flared out more than I wanted it to, especially in the back, yet the front of the jacket fit well. There were also some stitching mistakes that resulted in bulges along some of the jacket seams, though I doubt anyone would notice it with a casual glance. The main concern I had and what ultimately forced me to return it was the lining of the jacket. It was so loose and uneven inside that it showed behind the zipper when left unzipped. I tried to capture this in the photos below. I thought ironing it might help to eliminate the problem, but there just ended up being too much lining to the jacket that forced it to shift and show, which was unsightly and cheapened the look of the jacket. Perhaps this was just a mistake in this one jacket...not really sure. There is a tag sewn on the outside of the bottom of the jacket on the lower left hand side that says "Made by Johnny." I didn\'t like that either - seemed weird for a leather-like jacket. title: Women's Casual Detachable Hoodie Denim Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Weight & Sizing', 'author': 'PC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The tag says this is made in China, and I am happy that I took the time to properly review the sizing chart. I weigh around 180lbs and am 5‚Äô7‚Äù. I wanted to be able to wear a medium weight hoodie underneath it if the hood that came with it was an issue; I have plenty of room in the arms with an XXL size! The hood it came with is nice quality and thicker than I expected! The strings are a bit long on the hood, but that can be easily customized. This is a lovely little jacket, and I am pleased to have it in my daily rotation of clothing now! I appreciate that the material isn‚Äôt stretchy because I feel that it adds to the weight and feel in colder weather. (Just personal preferences there) It feels more premium with the added weight. I have thicker arms due to weightlifting, and it‚Äôs still a good fit that allows me to move about without pinching together at the back and making me uncomfortable. It isn‚Äôt a long jacket, but it‚Äôs not cropped in such a way that makes it feel silly and overly short. Just right! It isn‚Äôt overly distressed, but there are plenty of fun ways to make it more tattered if that is something you‚Äôd like. For me, this is exactly the type of jacket I was searching for; I hope it lasts quite a while. Thanks for a great product! I‚Äôll get plenty of use with this one! Five stars!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality!', 'author': 'N. But it‚Äôs not a bad jacket.I‚Äôll wear it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket', 'author': 'Alicia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I liked this jacket and After reading the reviews I sized up to an Xl. Medium might even work but trying Large next', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Boxier than the image on Amazon :(', 'author': 'TiredMommy', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Have been searching everywhere for a less boxy jean jacket and the image on this product showed a great shaped jacket. Unfortunately this is extremely boxy. I have a short torso and boxy jackets are not a great look on me. Otherwise I loved the jean fabric color and feel (very soft). As others reported all the buttons jingle really loudly. You will need to buy clear hairties and wrap around the base of the buttons to stop the jungle. I‚Äôm going to keep the jacket but I don‚Äôt love the shape :( I actually wonder if I bought another and compared the length if the second would be the same - could be a manufacturing glitch maybe.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soooo good', 'author': 'akmegs', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket has become my favorite I‚Äôve had it 5 days and worn it every day since. It‚Äôs my new personality. It‚Äôs oversized I can wear a hooded sweatshirt with it I got an xl. The cut is so slimming in the back. Really high quality for the price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This is a RIPPED jacket', 'author': 'Kalayna Harrison', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The product is not clear with the fact that this jacket has purposeful cuts on the front and back of the jacket.The listing's title makes no mention of it being a distressed jacket and the only mention is one line buried in a block of text which really is just a description keyword dump for SEO or algorithm purposes.In the photos, the cuts are the white vertical lines. 1 above each breast pocket, 2 on each pocket, 1 along the seams towards the bottom on the right and left sides, 1 beneath each shoulder blade, and 2 on either side on the back seam towards the bottom on both the right and left sides. This makes 12 CUTS in total.And there is no fabric backing to any of them to prevent air flow, these cuts just go straight through the whole jacket.It doesn't even look like a normal distressed jacket, with these single and separated cuts. It looks more like it got cut up by some factory machine malfunction. I'm really disappointed in the jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Such a cute fall jacket!', 'author': 'Natalie O‚ÄôHara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is super comfortable! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm', 'author': 'Jacqueline Pagan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this coat to wear in Iceland and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. I am 5‚Äô8‚Äù, 125 lbs. I ordered a size medium so I would have a little extra room to layer clothes. It fits perfectly in torso and sleeve length. I can extend my arms out in front of me and the sleeves hit right at the wrist. I like that it has two pieces that you can detach and wear separately.Dislikes ‚Äì I really wish there were cuter color options! I went with the pink, but I wish it had dark gray accents (kind of like the lake blue option to break up the color). I also really don‚Äôt like the yellow accent color for the logo and cords on zippers. It‚Äôs just a strange color and I think it should be black or gray. My last issue is the pocket on the breast is awesome to put your cell phone in, but they put it on the right side instead of the left (like most ski jackets I‚Äôve looked at) and the left would be easier to access given that most people are right handed. It‚Äôs also further complicated because there is a flap of fabric over it that you have to maneuver around.Overall, the dislikes are not enough for me to return the jacket. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I live this jacket', 'author': 'Michelle Dias', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great faux leather jacket. Wonderful quality and is very comfortable. I love this jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars LOVE! Nice quality. Size up, though.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the "Rust Red" version, and oh my ... it\'s gorgeous. It\'s definitely a rust color and I love that, because I don\'t tend to wear bright colors, but I get so tired of back. This color is perfect and very classy.As for the size, I would suggest sizing up one. I originally bought this in Large (I\'m 5\'4" and 140 lbs.), which should have fit me according to the size chart. However, when it came in, it was too trim fitting. If all I was going to wear under it was a camisole and never zip it up, it would be fine. But I know I wanted some more room, so I reordered it in Extra Large. When I hold them together, the bigger one is an inch or two wider, but the sleeves are still pretty much the same length. I feel comfortable in the XL, and it still has a trim fit (I would not wear a thick sweater underneath, but a thin sweater or regular shirt/blouse is fine!). I will have to under-cuff the sleeves because they are kind of long. There are zippers at the sleeves, but I am still able to under-cuff them.I absolutely love the style of the "Rust Red," because it has lapels that you can snap to keep them laying correctly. The snaps are good and sturdy. I don\'t care for the zipped-up look, but there is that option as well, for those who want it. I feel like I look like a million bucks wearing this.Finally, what you probably came to the comments to read about: the smell. I\'ve ordered faux leather on Amazon before, and yeah ... a good half has arrived with a strong fishy odor. I am very pleased to report that BOTH packages (sent within days of each other) of this jacket arrived well-wrapped with tissue paper covering all the zippers plus a long piece of tissue paper in the middle (to prevent the zippers from marring the fabric), and neither one had a fish odor at ALL. It may be this style/color, but there is NO unpleasant odor whatsoever, and I was able to put it in my closet right away.Overall, I am super pleased with this jacket. Although it\'s faux leather, it does not look like it. This cut, style, and color looks like very good quality. 4-and-a-half stars from me!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Tan faux leather motorcycle jacket', 'author': 'Jules59', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this jacket! title: Women's Full Zip Cardio Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Full Zip Jacket', 'author': 'mesh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had the black jacket for over a year & purchased the gray this summer. They are my favorite go to jackets. I don‚Äôt wear them for working out. I wear them for casual outings. The jacket can be worn with pretty much anything & with 88% polyester, 12% spandex it can be worn for the 3 seasons in NY. It‚Äôs extremely comfortable to wear. It‚Äôs very flattering. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô6‚Äù, 36C, was 155lbs when purchased the black I‚Äôm now 165lbs & both colors fit me perfectly in a large. Most of my weight is below my waist. I didn‚Äôt want a loose fit but it‚Äôs not so tight where I can‚Äôt wear something underneath it. This is a good quality jacket, one that is rare to find at this price. The material is soft & has never snagged. The zipper zips with no hesitation. I love the fit period. It falls at my hips as I hope you can see in my pictures. I love the finger holes at the end of the sleeve. The collar has stayed up perfectly after multiple washes on both. I wash separately on the hand wash cycle, cold water & hang to dry. There is some stretch to it which accommodates it not being too tight on me. They sewing & stitching of both jackets was top notch with not one loose thread. Genuine quality by Champion. Based on my measurements if you want a looser fit I‚Äôd suggest a XL. A gem to find & I definitely recommend this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good fit', 'author': 'WithCatlikeTread', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits well, warm, but not too warm, great for autumn/spring. Waldschmidt', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Great jacket - well fitted and a great cut that is longer in the back and not cropped (seriously, not everyone likes a cropped jacket - we sixty-year-olds actually DO go to the gym, lift, and run, but it doesn't mean we like everything skin-tight and cropped), but size up if you don't want the skin-tight fit. Since they have no more in my size, I will keep it and wash it, but I'm not happy about it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket', 'author': 'cara', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pretty nice yoga/ exercise jacket. I am 5‚Äô7‚Äù with sort of long arms and the length of the arms on this is very good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars 2023Update!ChampionC9 Women's(Stretchy)CardioJacket(Yoga) and Pant Coordinate OurGrade A Solid C+", 'author': 'jj/thewhiteAdrianaLima/ThewhiteWaif', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Our (2023Updated)Review In Short Of TheC9 Champion Women's Full Zip Cardio Jacket, Ebonyblk- and matching slackfit/coordinateC9 Champion Women's Curvy Fit (Stretchy) Yoga Pant, Ebonyblk -LongLength -Like most naturally lean female body types ZerotoTwodress or ZerotoFourdress, standard tall-- taller than 5ft6, (myself being 5ft7) I prefer a slack fit in the stretchy yoga sets, and have found that unlike the old xersion bootcutpant and jacket sets in which you could get away with going only one size up (Medium) in both, for a relaxed fit that will take you to lunch or running errands dresscode wise, in the ChampionC9 you will need to go up one size in the jacket(toMedium) but as much as two or more in the pants(toLarge-toeXtraLarge) to get a proper relaxed slack fit. And even having been on bed rest for an injury I can still fit my oversized yogalates outfits while getting back in shape. SO there is something to say about going for the relaxed slack fit in your fitness attire.Special Notes:Prior to 2010, For a more relaxed exercise YogaLates outfit -fit you can go one size up in the Exersion brandTops and Bottoms from the standard small to a medium.Prior to 2010, For a more relaxed exercise YogaLates outfit -fit you can go one size up in the Gaiam brand Tops and Bottoms from the standard small to a medium.After 2010 In the Champion and C9, you can still get a relaxed fit by going one size up in the tops/jacket from a small to a medium but in the pants for best results you should go two or more sizes up from small to Large and if you are standard tall or taller in the pants for a more relaxed slack yogalates fit that will take you from the gym to lunch-you will need to go to LargeTall or XLargeTall in the pants and medium in the tops/jacket.After 2010 In the GearTek or TekGear, you can get a relaxed fit by going one size up in the tops/jacket from a small to a medium but in the pants for best results you should go two or more sizes up from small to Large and if you are standard tall or taller in the pants for a more relaxed slack yogalates fit that will take you from the gym to lunch-you will need to go to LargeTall or XLargeTall in the pants and medium in the tops/jacket.When Amazon took over the branding permissions from target, I was a bit skeptical as the Target-Instore and Targetdotcom returns policy is very easy and the additional off with the sale offerings really g a long way when maintaining a budget, and Amazon coupons are infrequent at best and also Amazon has no boutique, so you can‚Äôt actually try things on before you buy to get an idea of the cut/fit of the style of garment. But, that being said, if you buy the black or midnightNavy, the overall look should be fine and if it‚Äôs a bit looser than expected you can still work out and maintain a manicured fitness-garment appearance that you can do other things in. I like a longer line, so I ordered the long. In the jacket it‚Äôs fine to go one size up to maintain the relaxed fit.Overall Not a bad item, although the prices could be more competitive.Our grade A Solid C+ or 3.5125Stars", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Sport Women's Performance Fleece Full Zip Hoodie
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect running and leisure jacket!', 'author': 'MamaKnowsBest', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô6, 155lbs and originally ordered a medium. title: Women's Packable Rainfoil Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It fits well', 'author': 'lgrin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I tried no less than 7 raincoats until I found this one. I am 5\'4" and about 160 lbs. I ordered this jacket in a size L. It has a nice shape to it, flattering lines and the sleeves are not way to long like most I have tried. I am not so fond of Velcro, but that seems to be standard for cuff closures these days. I also found it not quite as noisy as many of the other coats I tried. It has a nice weight to it, not to thin or thick. The pockets are nice size, with 1 inside chest pocket that is nice for a phone. The hood is ample to cover your head with a bit of an overhang for rain. I like that the hood can be folded into the collar when not in use too. I only wore it once in the rain so far, and it did a great job keeping me dry. This coat is a winner for me!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value', 'author': 'Kathy P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this jacket on sale for $50 expecting a light weight average durability rain jacket. The only downside is the jacket is thicker then expected so it is too warm to wear during a spring or early fall rain. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful shade of blue and flattering fit', 'author': 'goodsoutherngirl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this in blue and it\'s a gorgeous shade. title: Women's 2024 Winter Fashion Clothes Oversized Shearling Fleece Long Coats Jackets
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars If you're looking for the most fabulous coat...", 'author': 'Jersey Mama', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you're looking for the most fabulous coat...THIS IS NOT YOUR COAT!! It's actually a wonderful coat, but if you want to LOOK like a million bucks, look elsewhere.First the pros: it's warm, it's cozy, it's a very nice color (I purchased the grey/blue color and i really like it). This is the perfect coat for running out quickly to drop the kids to school or to running the dog out in the cold. I have only worn it in mid/upper 40's weather, but I was only wearing a thin t-shirt underneath and I was completely warm. I can't say what it would be like in the elements, but I imagine it wouldn't be your first choice for a snowstorm or heavy rain.Now the cons: the sleeves are a tad on the short side, but I have short arms, so it doesn't bother me, but it would definitely be a problem if you have really long arms. As far as fit, it's not the least bit flattering. Like the opposite of flattering. No shape to it and I'm already not a skinny gal, so it does me no favors in that department, but I don't really care about that with this coat because I love how cozy and comfy it is. If I'm being honest (which I am) it's kind of like a very unsexy bathrobe that you can wear in public. The sleeves are open and don't gather at the wrist, so it could let air in and could let the cold in up thru the arms.It's a really decent price and I am glad I bought it, for both the good and the bad!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm, Comfy, Very Nice', 'author': 'Marci', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Better than expected. True to size. Comfy. Not heavy. Blocks cold wind (my temp exp was in the 30's). Looks like the picture. Would buy again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sleeves a bit short', 'author': 'Rachel M MacBlane', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice jacket! Feels like a nice robe. Warm and comfortable. Not too bulky. Only complaint is the sleeves are a bit shorter than I would like.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Midweight run-around town coat', 'author': 'Steve F', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The pros: it‚Äôs great to wear when it‚Äôs damp/lightly rainy or mildly cold outside. Love the hood. Perfect for going to the store as you won‚Äôt overheat when wearing it inside shopping. I love the Sherpa lining ‚Äî so super soft.The cons: many of the quilted construction seams do not line up or match making the coat look cheaply constructed. Also, the sleeve length is too short and I‚Äôm petite (5‚Äô4‚Äù). There‚Äôs no banding on the bottom of the sleeves to keep the cold air out and no tie strings to cinch up the hood. The patch pockets in front aren‚Äôt lined so your hands get cold unless you wear gloves; they are annoying to use as regular pockets but a great place to put your phone or keys.Overall, I enjoy the simple versatility of this light coat and wear it often in temperatures above 25 F. I will reach for a heavier coat for colder weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm and cozy', 'author': 'Sydney Lozada', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wore this in Iceland when temperatures were around 25-30 degrees. I would wear this coat with either a long sleeve or sweater and I was warm! You could probably wear this coat alone with a short sleeve if the temperature is higher than 40.This coat is NOT waterproof or water resistant. It does dry quickly if it does get wet. Sleeves are also a little short, but I am short so they fit me just fine.When you are wearing the coat zipped up, do not expect to look like a model or fashionista. It‚Äôs almost like wearing a sleeping bag. It looks cute unzipped, but I seldom wore it like that because I was trying to stay warm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As advertised', 'author': 'ORiley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I waited till I had worn this for a weekend so I could give a 'performance' review.This coat is as advertised. Although the fleece isn't quite as thick as it looks in the pic BUT you're not going to get a thick fleece for this price. So I'm not unhappy with it and it kept me warm with just a short sleeved top underneath in temps down to 32F.The only way to close the jacket is to do up the zip from the bottom to the top, there's no way to close just the top of the jacket, but that's fine for me as I prefer to wear coats open with a scarf.The pockets are generous and there's one inside too. Personally I would prefer the pockets to be angled and on the side to allow for more comfortable access when the coat is closed but as I wear it open it doesn't really present a problem.Size seems true, not undersized.Quality of stitching is good.Durability of fabric, I've only worn it one weekend so far, but at this price, I would like it to last a couple of years But for now, on all levels, given the rice, I give this coat 5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Had to return', 'author': 'Tracey Husak', 'rating': 2, 'content': "The coat was very warm and soft. What I didn't like about the coat was it was difficult to get your arm in the sleeve due to the material. It was perfect if you wore a short sleeve but anything with a sleeve was difficult", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Where do you live?', 'author': 'K.L.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is not a severe weather coat. If you live in Chicago don‚Äôt buy it. But for moderate to mild winter climates it‚Äôs perfect. Yes, it is less thick and the sherpa less fluffy then what‚Äôs pictured online. But not so much so that it‚Äôs a cheap looking coat. It‚Äôs a nice looking coat.My sleeves were fine and I have long arms. I‚Äôm usually a 2x in coats, 18 in clothes. 5‚Äô6‚Äù, xxxl bust. Very surprised the xxl was too large for me, had to size down. I love that it‚Äôs not a bulky coat bc I‚Äôm a little bulky already. I look good in this coat and it makes me feel all snuggly and bundled. Like I‚Äôm wearing my comforter but it‚Äôs not going to fall off.It‚Äôs about 35 degrees out and I‚Äôm happy in my coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sizing', 'author': 'T', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This jacket is warm and soft on the inside. However it doesn‚Äôt have a zippered pocket on the inside as pictured, but rather a slip pocket of lining material that looks cheap if you were to use this jacket in the reverse form.The sizing is really big, I would order a size down.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sherpa coat size S', 'author': 'Bonnie Williams', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The Pretty garden Sherpa coat size S has a material defect. Small stain on it. Would like to exchange it for another same size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Can't wait to wear it in the rain!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't size up", 'author': 'JJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is such a pretty rain coat. I originally sized up, thinking that I would need/want to be able to wear something warm underneath when needed. I sent the XL back and ordered a L. The large has plenty of room for a warm sweater underneath.The length of this coat is lovely...so nice to have it be longer than a jacket but not down to my knees. I ordered this coat in black and also in blue...sent the blue back...it's dark, almost navy...not what I want. The black is more to my liking. So although it took me a couple of tries to get it right, I'm finally happy with black in Large.I've not tried the coat out in the rain yet, and since that is the purpose of my purchase, the verdict is still out. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Runs small, will shrink, size up for a great purchase', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this for myself, but after washing, the sleeves shrank in length and I knew I couldn't wear it comfortably. title: Women's Military Anorak Safari Hoodie Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Lightweight Comfortable Jacket', 'author': 'BookWoman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Based on other reviews, I ordered a 3X, one or two sizes up from my usual size range. The fit is roomy, but that‚Äôs fine as I can put a sweatshirt or sweater underneath if needed in colder weather. I like the overall length, and that the adjustable cords at the waist actually do sit AT my waistline, not above or below it. The only criticism is the sleeves are WAY too long, and there is only one snap at the wrist, not tight enough to use it to adjust so the sleeves don‚Äôt cover my hands. Other thing I wish is that it was machine washable and dryable. It says hand wash cold, line dry‚Ä¶not very practical. But overall I love the fabric, the cotton is smooth and the lining is lighter weight, just as I‚Äôd hoped. I like the color, too. I may wash it and then see about getting the sleeves shortened by a tailor, to make it perfect,', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for petite women -- EXACTLY what I was looking for!', 'author': 'Pepper Black', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve been looking everywhere for an anorak jacket like this one, something lightweight that could be layered and easily stuffed into a backpack for hiking with lots of pockets. I am 5\'1" and weigh 95lbs, so I tried about 5 different jackets off Amazon and all of them were just way too big in the shoulders and waist for me. I finally decided to try this one, even though the reviews were pretty mixed in terms of size and quality. I was so thrilled with what I received! It is so soft and comfortable and fits perfectly everywhere! The drawstring waist helps cinch it in for a more fitted look and the fishtail bottom is so cute. Tons of pockets. Hits me slightly higher than mid thigh, was hoping for something that would cover my butt and I got it. Could not be happier with this purchase. Yes, it is a thin jacket, it is cotton with a satiny lining. I live in Boston and this is the perfect thickness for early fall/late spring/cooler summer evenings. There\'s plenty of room to layer underneath for chillier days, and I can also layer my Columbia rain jacket over this for rainy days. Bought it specifically for a hiking trip in Acadia (Maine) where the weather can be unpredictable, and it rolls up small enough to fit in my hiking pack. Give this jacket a shot, you will be pleasantly surprised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is the perfect light-ish weight jacket for the PNW', 'author': 'L. Carry', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I live in the Pacific Northwest where LAYERING is how we get through our days that can go from very cold to warm in a few short hours. In addition at any moment it could drizzle. This is just the right weight for most of our fall, winter and spring days. My only caveat is that it feels a little tight around the upper arms, but I'm busty so that may just be me. I had hoped it would be a little softer overall but it is by no means stiff. I'm hoping with wearing and washing it will loosen up a bit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute Fashion Jacket', 'author': 'Susan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I should of ordered a small instead of a medium. Overall the jacket is good for fall, it doesn't like keep you warm so maybe have a long undershirt under it. Super cute jacket!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice buy', 'author': 'T', 'rating': 5, 'content': "To start I have ordered 2 of these previously in the green color.Pros it looks amazing. The fit is the same as the 2x. There is a waist string you can tighten. This is a spring or early fall jacket. I live in the UP of Michigan. This is not built for cold. I have broad shoulders and this fits nice. I have room to move and it looks fantastic.Cons thin material. This is my third time purchasing these. I go through one a year because they always RIP by the pockets. The material is thin. It cannot be repaired once it rips. I've used iron on and sewing. For reference I'm 5'8 size 14 with broad shoulders.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Fits true to size, but product photo misleading', 'author': 'Donna', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I'm sort of annoyed with other reviewers who said the jacket they received was two sizes too small. I sized up twice as a precaution because of this and each time the jacket was true to size and therefore way too big for me. I do think that the seller is using a very misleading product photo, though. The color is much different and the sleeves are annoyingly baggy rather than snug as they look in the photo. Thankfully Amazon returns are a breeze.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this jacket!', 'author': 'Pamela F', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the 4th parka I\'ve ordered and finally found the perfect jacket! I\'m wearing the small and I understand why it might be too small for the average person. But, if you are petite like me it will be perfect. Also, the pockets are from the side which I wanted and the string in the back is not too long. Some of the others I ordered had strings that hung down to the back of my knees. I wore it today and already received compliments. It closes with a zipper which makes it super easy. Fantastic price too. I am so happy with this jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Made for slight-built women', 'author': 'Christine C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Unfortunately, this jacket did not fit me, but it seemed to be made with quality. It\'s slightly tighter on my midsection, but I have a boxy shape, usually a size 14 or 16 USA, with 41" bust, 39" waist, and 42" hips. It\'s a more casual fit, allowing a sweater underneath if it isn\'t very bulky, but the lines of the jacket are slimming. I am 5\'2" so the arms are a little long, as expected, but the slight elastic at the wrist helps keep them from flopping around or looking bad. The jacket goes to around the middle of my rear.... I wish it was long enough to cover my behind completely but it looks fine.This fleece jacket is really well made! I\'m honestly surprised since it wasn\'t expensive like most good quality fleece jackets. It is sewn very well, zippers seem good with zipper guard flaps, has deep inside open pockets on each side, the main zippered pockets are a nice size, and it is very thick but smooth fleece. It currently feels a bit stiff, but I know that will likely soften after a few washes and wearing. My only negative is that the dark purple shade I ordered is far darker than I expected. The picture looks like a nice brighter royal purple, but mine is a darker "dusky" eggplant. It\'s still very nice, just not what I originally wanted. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made, classy and travels GREAT', 'author': 'Elsie Pie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I easily steamed packing wrinkles out with steam iron on low . I bought the off white color which is beautiful, a true cream , not yellowish or tan at all.Was concerned it might attract dirt- it does not . I wore it back and forth on four cross country flights , crammed into airplane seats, folded into dingy plastic bins through security, and as soon as it was unfolded or I stood up- looked great ! No wrinkles , no spots . Fabric is soft and thick , not see through , has some stretch but does not stretch out . Perfect weight , like a light jacket, ideal for cool days or cold indoor AC but it isn‚Äôt a coat and I would not wear it over anything very thick . Superb polished look with leggings or yoga pants for travel or whatever .Has two pockets , deep enough for my iPhone but I wouldn‚Äôt put anything much bigger in there to avoid deforming the pockets .Great addition to a classic capsule wardrobe .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful fit, Business Casual,', 'author': 'A Horseshow Mom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have bought about 5 of these in different colors - ivory, white, navy, burgundy, teal. title: Women's Shoreline Jacket (Regular and Plus Sizes)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'Nellie-- a blind shopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I absolutely love this cute coat!! I found it in our local farm supply store for $150, and wanted to buy it sooooooo bad, but bought my son a birthday present instead... darn kids! LOL! I came home and looked on Amazon and found it! New it was $129, and I happened to see there was a used one for $89 so I jumped on it! It came perfectly packaged, still had tags on it and was in perfect condition! I have no idea what was used about it, but I sure am happy with this purchase!! As for the coat--it is excellent quality that you would expect from Carhartt! Very nice heavier quality and I know will last forever. I bought the XL, and I am 5:6 and 170lbs, and it fits perfect! Maybe just a titch too big, but otherwise perfect! I wanted it to come down far enough to cover my stomach, which it does, but just barely, that is the only thing I wish was just a few inches longer. It comes down to the bottom of my zipper on my jeans, the back is a bit longer. I love the end of the sleeves, they have a stretchy material with a thumb hole that will prevent cold air from going up the sleeve. This coat has pockets all over! If you need more pockets than this coat has, you either have too much junk, or need to get a huge purse! :) I got the dark wine color, and it is a beautiful plum/dark brownish color, not a bright obnoxiously loud color, but a very pretty earthy plum color. I was torn btw the olive green and the wine, but got the wine and love it! Wish I could afford both! :) I could not be happier with this coat and I highly recommend it! It is replacing my winter coat, and I live in northern Wisconsin so temps get way way way below 0, and this will keep me warm, and keep out the wind! The hood is perfect too!! Love it!! :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 10/10 amazing! A workhorse of a rain coat!', 'author': 'Paul Goodyear', 'rating': 5, 'content': "(written by Paul's wife) I bought this to take on our honeymoon to Ireland/Scotland and it was amazing! So comfortable, perfectly waterproof and I loved all the pockets! We're photographers, so having lots of pockets for extra rolls of film, lens caps, film backs, extra lenses etc. is super important. We did several hikes through southern Ireland and the Isle of Skye in Scotland and this coat kept me warm and dry! It is extremely durable and stood up to wind, rain, mud with no issues. It is not just a liner/shell so it is not extremely light weight. I did not find it heavy or bulky, but compared to my husband's thinner shell style raincoat it definitely took up more packing space. I also LOVED the thumbholes on the wrist part of the sleeve, great for keeping hands/wrists warm in cold climates. As it is not a shell style, it is a warm jacket, but I never felt stuffy or overheated like I have in other rain coats. Somehow it is completely waterproof while still being breathable. 100% recommend and I will definitely be using it regularly during the rainy/winter season where we live.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Deep maroon color. Perfect fit, but‚Ä¶', 'author': 'DDV', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was concerned about the color being too light (because I wanted an actual maroon shade). This fit the bill‚Ä¶definitely a deep maroon. As for the fit, I got a large in the deep wine shade and it‚Äôs perfect. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô 6‚Äù, 150 lb, 42-36-43. I have a wide back and shoulders and was able to bring my arms totally forward with a long sleeve t-shirt underneath. While I haven‚Äôt tried it with anything thicker than that, I‚Äôm leery that might be too confining for me personally. Someone with a narrower back and shoulders might be fine with a sweater or sweatshirt under it. My arms are average size in circumference and I didn‚Äôt feel the sleeves were too tight at all. The sleeves were also plenty long enough which is unusual, because my arms are long. It was not fitted at the waist, which is fine because I need room to be able to fill up all of the pockets (of which there are plenty of deep ones). The 2 upper exterior chest zippered pockets might not provide room for anything but thin or flat objects for a 42‚Äù or similar chest, but all others are great. I especially liked the large inside Velcro pocket for enclosing a phone and the double exterior hip pockets. Each side had not only large flap pockets, but behind those were zippered angle pockets just right for putting your hands in while walking without involving the flap covered ones. My torso length is average and the length of the coat was enough to cover my behind for sitting. While the bottom is comfortable for hips up to 43-44 inches, it likely won‚Äôt accommodate anything larger. I was able to sit in it completely zipped without it being too tight. The lining of the body is a thin polyester perforated mesh, but the lining of the hood and sleeves are a solid thin polyester‚Äînot a fleece at all. While the exterior cloth may provide some protection from significant cold (I have not tested either that or rain yet.), I would likely reserve this coat for a milder temperature outside‚Äîno colder than 45 degrees‚Ä¶but clearly individual preference may differ. That said, it is neither too bulky nor too warm for sitting inside an arena with tight seating, which was a key requirement. The only thing I would have preferred to be different is a metal zipper, instead of the plastic one provided. I feel like this coat will last a long time and would prefer the zipper to last as long as the coat. It does, however, have snaps that cover the zipper, so if the zipper should fail, the coat is still usable. All in all, I am extremely pleased with my purchase and would recommend it highly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dream Jacket!', 'author': 'I Talk to Trees', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered XXL (I normally wear XL) in black. While I could have gone down to the XL, I‚Äôm glad I got the XXL so I can wear sweatshirts & heavy fleece under it. Also, I prefer things a little loose anyway.Get this coat! It‚Äôs worth every penny. The way it‚Äôs constructed, I should get many years out of it.What I love:1.) Arms are just right both in width & length.2.) Fits great across my shoulders & chest. I don‚Äôt feel restricted.3.) It‚Äôs longer in the back so covers my bum.4.) It zips and buttons!5.) The material feels substantial. It‚Äôs some sort of canvas, yet it‚Äôs not stiff.6,) The hood isn‚Äôt just for looks.. it actually works.. and it‚Äôs detachable. Though I don‚Äôt see the need to detach it since it lays flat.7.) Pockets! Pockets everywhere!8.) It‚Äôs dressy enough that I can wear it to the office, yet rugged enough to also wear on the field.9.) It does have thumb hole sleeves, but they aren‚Äôt stiff and can easily be pushed back into the sleeves when you don‚Äôt want to use them & they‚Äôre not in the way.10.) It‚Äôs a raincoat. A very cool looking & functional rain coat. But also a winter coat, I think. I will wear a fleece under it during the winter.What I don‚Äôt like about it:1.) Nothing. I don‚Äôt have a bad thing to say about this coat!Thank you, Carhartt, for making clothes for us ladies!UPDATE: Three years later..I'm still in love with this coat and wear it near daily during the fall, winter and spring months here in Texas. While it is not a winter coat per se, you can layer fleece under it and still use it as a winter coat. Why? Because the outside does a fantastic job blocking not only rain, but wind, too! Surprisingly, Texas gets more wind than anyplace else I've been and it cuts through you. However, wearing this coat? Not a problem! You stay warm and toasty.I've also washed it several times (hung to dry - no dryer) and it's held up just like new.Thinking about buying another color. Really want the green one, but it's out of stock. Please restock and I'll buy it! :)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A perfect jacket', 'author': 'Denise H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This jacket is perfect in every way. It fits like a dream, looks great, and performs beautifully. It just feels good on. It makes all my other rain jackets seem pitiful in comparison. Its light but substantial enough to wear as an everyday jacket in the fall and spring. I love the quality of Carhartt and this jacket does not disappoint. I also love that I can always order a size large no matter what piece of Carhartt clothing I am buying and it always fits perfect. For reference, I am 5'4 and 130 lbs. I like clothes loose but not baggy. In this brand, a large always fits exactly as I like.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent jacket but for one tiny detail...', 'author': 'Married and happy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love this rain jacket. I've had it since 2019. It's comfortable to wear except for one tiny detail...it is NOT breathable. At least it's not if you're doing anything physical. If you're just wearing it to do your daily stuff, it's fine. But I brought it to Europe this summer as my rain jacket, and I sweated like crazy in it. Central Europe is like the east coast--humid as well as hot. Perhaps, to be fair, the black color absorbed the heat. Everything else on this jacket is great! I prefer it to other brands because of the metal double zipper (that won't come apart when you bend over) and the multiple pockets. There's one inner pocket that has a hook&loop closure that's annoying, because you no sooner have it open to put something in there and it closes again. I also like and use the nylon cuffs that extend and hook over your thumbs on cooler days keeping the drafts out. So, IMHO this rain jacket is not for summer heat.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket, but still Carhartt!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a high-quality, extremely well made and designed all-around jacket but I\'m still considering returning it. Why? Because I fell in love with a previous version of this one that a friend has, and that earlier version was made out of Gore-Tex and had an amazing luxe sheen without sacrificing functionality. You can take it from the slopes to the fishing boat to the theatre. (We\'re Alaska girls, these things sometimes happen all on the same day.) This fabric is decidedly more "flat" and is more in line with expected rougher Carhartt fabrics.This design is great, though, and the construction is impeccable. I ordered a large and it says size 14-16 and I think this is accurate. It is roomy enough for layers without being too bulky. The storm cuffs, numerous roomy pockets, detachable hood, long "tail" to cover butt, and a complete lack of velcro (i HATE velcro) make this a winner. It does NOT have any vents, so it won\'t breathe well if you\'re planning to be extremely athletic in it, but it does have a great liner and it\'s a perfect weight‚Äînot too heavy, not too light. DIY insulating layers for warmth, which is how I prefer it.I just miss the sheen of the Gore-Tex and though I\'m sure this fabric performs great, it just doesn\'t have the same luxe-feel. The exposed snaps at the top and bottom are also covered in some kind of plastic polymer stuff, which I\'m sure is practical but again...not pretty.Overall very good value. I might still keep it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Jennifer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Who doesn't love Carhartt?This was on sale and I am so glad I got it working as a mail carrier for cold days in Colorado. Its good as far as comfort the zipper is double. Not very stretchy but I got an xl and it fits great.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality', 'author': 'Verna Deshnod', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I gifted this jacket to my mother and she loved it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome jacket!', 'author': 'Melanie Marinelli', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I LOVE this jacket.. title: Packable Rain Jacket Women Lightweight Waterproof Raincoat with Hood Cycling Bike Jacket Windbreaker
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outdoor Ventures vs 33,000Ft review', 'author': 'ActualUser!', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We purchased one of each of the two top-rated women\'s rain jackets on Amazon, the Outdoor Ventures and 33,000Ft rain jackets. They both have the same rating and about the same number of reviews, so we decided to try one of each and compare.Upon inspection, we can\'t tell a difference between these two jackets. One of them was less expensive than the other, so that would be the only factor I would use to decide between the two.They both make a lot of noise and are more "crinkly" than we would like, but otherwise, they both seem well made. They both fit true to size, but slightly on the smaller side, especially for layering.The jacket is well designed from a functional standpoint, even though its not as fashionable as one might wish. It seems like it will be very serviceable. I\'ll update this if we have any problems when actually using these, but they seem waterproof and even the XL folds easily into its pouch.From our viewpoint, even though these are labeled for women, they seem unisex and aren\'t more slimcut so they should be able to fit men, women, or children as long as you order up or down from standard women\'s sizing as needed for men or children.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ideal jacket for travel', 'author': 'Caroline', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I liked this jacket so much I bought it in a second color. I LOVE it for traveling - it's flattering, waterproof, lightweight but warm, perfect for layering, has underarm zippers so it's good for running without undue sweating, and it's comfy. I may end up buying more!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish, Well Made Rain Jacket', 'author': 'Dana Crowell', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Pros: Love the vibrant color. It's very well-made, not cheap and flimsy like so many products bought online. Several pockets for keys, phone, hands, etc. Mesh inside to help with airflow. Hood is deep to keep hair and face dry. Love that it rolls up into a small pouch for packing. Price was great for such a well-made jacket.Cons: I would like it to be longer in the back to keep my rear end dry should I need to sit somewhere that's wet. I bought it for a cruise and it's very likely I'll end up having to sit somewhere that's wet from rain. I wish the cuffs on the sleeves were elastic rather than velcro. I'm not a fan of velcro because it sticks to certain kinds of fabric and leaves pills, plus it's just not as comfortable a fit when velcro is used instead of elastic.All in all, the pros well outweigh the cons, so for the price, I'll likely keep it and use it. Even if I end up purchasing another one that's longer in the back, this one will be great to wear.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fashionable and effective raincoat', 'author': 'Narcoossee gal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This raincoat is well designed with waterproof fabric and seams. The cut is feminine with slight shaping at the waist and wider hips. I like the slightly longer tail so that my back is not exposed when I lean forward. The hood provides ample coverage, and it is easy to cinch tighter. One caveat: This coat runs SMALL so order the next size larger than your usual size. I found the shoulder width and the upper back width just right in the next larger size. I appreciate the zippered underarm vents. As well this coat has zippered inside and outside pockets on the upper left plus zippered pockets at each hip. The interior mesh lining provides air movement. I like this coat and I hope it lasts for years to come.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality and proper fit!', 'author': 'M. Garcia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It‚Äôs rare that I order a clothing item from here and find that it‚Äôs well made and fits properly according to the description. I ordered an XXL and for reference I am 224lb with a 42in waist and 46in bust. It‚Äôs pretty warm for a light raincoat. Has zippers under the armpits for ventilation and does repel water. I‚Äôm very pleased with it especially for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful raincoat!', 'author': 'bob zierden', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this coat! The size is perfect, love the burgundy color, pockets are fantastic, the hood cinches closed. I walked out in the rain for quite some time and was completely dry and warm with a sweater under it. Wonderful purchase! I bought one for my daughter. Very lightweight but very durable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Everything you‚Äôd want in a quality raincoat!', 'author': 'Sam Richard', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This easily compares to LL Bean‚Äôs raincoat (unfortunately including the price; EXCEPT it can be tried on and size-exchanged free! And it DOES go on sale!)It has lots of nice pockets in useful places, underarm vents, a covered zipper, a slightly longer back (to keep dripping rain off your bum), and a hood that has a brim AND isn‚Äôt so deep that it drops down in front of my face!Plus, it comes in lots of colors to choose from.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Waterproof protection', 'author': 'Linda Petro', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is truly waterproof. Its roomy and comfortable, and I absolutely love the midnight blue color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality, Gorgeous Color', 'author': 'Emily Jones', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered this rain jacket and also the puffer from the same brand and love them both!I needed a packable rain jacket for an upcoming trip to Scotland. I originally wanted a ‚Äútri climate‚Äù version from a very expensive brand but decided to try Outdoor Ventures first and I‚Äôm so glad I saved my money! I bought the puffer in my normal size and this rain jacket in one size up so I could layer them and I think it‚Äôs going to work great. No, they don‚Äôt zip together but that doesn‚Äôt bother me.It‚Äôs well made, waterproof (only worn a few times in rain, will update after my trip!) and isn‚Äôt too noisy (you know that windbreaker, cheap plastic noise every time you move? This doesn‚Äôt make a lot of noise).Details about sizing: I‚Äôm very petite. 4‚Äô11‚Äù and 115 lbs. I ordered the rain jacket in a small and as you can see from the pictures it‚Äôs quite generously sized. The sleeves are a little long but they can be tightened down. It‚Äôs great for my plan to layer over another, warmer coat but if I had been planning to use it mainly in a warm, rainy climate I would have gone with an XS.My one critique is the zip openings under the arms‚Ä¶ I wish it didn‚Äôt have those as I never use them but it‚Äôs not a deal breaker.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice but big and boxy', 'author': 'Bernie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I didn\'t get to wear this in the rain but returned it after just trying it on. It\'s a well made jacket with some thoughtful features. Based on all the review comments, I purchased a large because I wanted to be able to wear layers underneath and comments said it ran small. It was huge (I am 5\'10" and 130lbs). It was also a bit heavier than I was looking for. That\'s not a bad thing, it just wasn\'t right for my needs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]
