title: Women's Quilted Winter Coat Warm Puffer Jacket Thicken Parka with Removable Hood
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality. Always get compliments.', 'author': 'Better than Victoria secret bombshell!', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I moved from Las Vegas to up north in Washington. I was in for a shock when winter came around and this jacket was amazing. Keeps me very warm and dry in the constant rain. The hood is a little short but I did take off the fur zipper. Many pockets and there is a drawstring at the waist to amplify your figure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth it', 'author': 'stephanie asselin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Went to Canada in February and had -17 celcius weather the entire week.We did alot of outside sport like skiing and snow mobile and not even once did I feel cold. The jacket was very hot and waterproof. It stood against all Canada winter element.TBH this jacket was way better than I expected and worth every $.Definitely a good purchase.Size - Size up... I'm a large and took x-large so if needed I can layer upFit - perfect. Not to tight and not to loose.Style - definitely a pretty looking jacket and fits with today morden style. Keep in mind to brush the head piece to make it look more fluffy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Is outstanding in a city with heavy snowfall and winds', 'author': 'Katie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This coat is phenomenal! It fits perfectly, and it\'s incredibly warm. It\'s very sturdy, with no buttons, snaps, or lining coming off. The pockets are big, which is always a plus as a girl. The colour is exactly as pictured as well. It is the warmest jacket I have ever owned. I live in a place with intense lake-effect snow and very high winds with wind chills that freeze cars into blocks of ice, and this coat actually leaves me over-heating slightly at times while out braving the elements.The only downside is how big and baggy the hood is. I know this is because it\'s space for a winter hat, but for when you\'re not wearing one, the hood just flaps and falls all over the place. It doesn\'t have drawstrings, unfortunately. When I\'m walking in the wind, I\'m usually holding the hood for dear life. It does have clasps that help hold it in place that cross a bit around my mouth but it\'s still pretty baggy after that. I know the answer is "well, wear a hat" but that\'s not always doable.Regardless of the hood, I have recommended this to so many people. I am always getting compliments on it and I am rarely cold (in the areas it covers, anyways). I keep it in my vehicle for easy access if I encounter unexpected rain. It is nice and compact.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality for a crush and pack rain cover', 'author': 'Southwest Consumer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I LOVE the polka dots. We have a Polka-Dot-Wednesday-thing going on at work and in the winter it is hard to find outwear that fits our theme. This is great! And it comes in a zipper pouch that is matching fabric. I like the snap wings, instead if sleeves less, but it works exceptionally well for a light raining day, which is what we get in the high desert. I am short and round and this fits just fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 50/50 Shot!', 'author': 'Ivarilla', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I ordered two of these for a trip to Disney World. The day we went to Animal Kingdom, there was a tornado warning and 100% chance of rain...one of the ponchos I ordered unfolded with ease and protected as expected, just as the torrential downpour threatened! The other poncho was horribly stuck together and took several minutes to unpeel/unstick from itself. Although I did finally get it unstuck, as the rain started in earnest I noticed that my skin (underneath the poncho) was wet anywhere the poncho touched it, and sticky, to boot...I assume maybe there was a defect with the waterproofing? I initially put it down to Florida humidity...until we headed inside for lunch and I took my poncho off. The inside was soaking wet and did not dry (the outside drained off and dried in no time!). The inside was also slick with a sticky layer (similar to when you put hand sanitizer on still-damp hands and it gets goopy). I decided I'd rather take my chances with the rain for the rest of the day.In terms of fit, I do want to note that these are great! They are long and loose, with plenty of room to keep a backpack underneath, and the front zipper + pocket (at least on the poncho that worked) was very useful for keeping humidity down and maximizing airflow in between downpours! The storage bag with a carabiner was also useful for clipping to a backpack and keeping other items dry if put away while still wet.The style and function of these are great...as long as you don't get a defective one!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for heavy rain', 'author': 'Tamara M. Brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This poncho is great in a heavy rain. It would work for trying to bring in groceries, taking a hike, keeping dry on vacation when outside. It has a draw hood to pull up close to your face. That said, I would not use this as a rain jacket to dress up in for church or a night out, as it is not made to be "attractive" in. It is made really big, like wearing a tent over your clothes and pulling it over your head will just mess up your hair if you are dressed up. I purchased this, however, as something to wear when I am going to be out in the rain for a long period of time and want to stay dry. It is perfect for that and very comfortable! It comes with a pouch to put it in and take with you for vacation or camping. It is a great buy for any outdoor people who want to stay dry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works exactly as intended.', 'author': 'DLeon86', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Had a chance to finally test this one out on a SUPER rainy commute to work, and I'm happy to report that unlike times prior to buying this cloak, I arrived to work 100% dry. Before I bought this, I would always arrive drenched from head to toe. This thing is a lifesaver. Fits comfortably over myself, a small backpack and even my JBL Charge 4 which I have hoisted across my shoulder underneath. So literally nothing got wet with this thing draped over it. To dry, just shake it and then let it air-dry the rest of the way. Super easy, and folds right up to fit in the carrying pouch that accompanies it. I usually just clamp it to a hook on my backpack when not in use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The Burgundy is a Dull Red Weird Riding Hood Color', 'author': 'vintagebarrio', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This was exactly what I expected in terms of function with perfectly adequate performance for the price. Not very lightweight but you want it to be sturdy enough to not rip, so I'll forgive that. The sleeves were also a tad short when you hold your arms out. But the big deal for me was that the color burgundy I thought I was getting was so far off from the photo as to not count as any screen discrepancy. It was a dull red. Makes me look like a very baggy slightly faded Red Riding Hood. The sophisticated and subtle dark burgundy photo misled me into thinking I would be the one moderately elegant human in a poncho. Nope. But, it does work. If you're thinking this packs down like an emergency poncho, it's more like a very fat clutch purse. Note the weight and dimensions if you're hoping to use for a trip and squeeze into a pack--it takes up a fair amount of space. Still, it's way better to have this than nothing and the color isn't hideous, just weird, and it fits over a backpack and the hood is very substantial with a little helpful brim. My husband ordered the deep sea blue and of course it looks quite fashionable and dapper on him. Oh well. If I get lost on the mountain, they'll know where to find me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

Whether you're out for a hike or running errands, this jacket is a must-have for staying warm and dry.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light and warm, not sweaty', 'author': 'Sally J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the best raincoat I have ever had. The interior lining is soft and just the right amount of warmth. Love the double zipper. It comes in handy while driving. The form fit of the coat is ideal. Used while it was pouring rain with great protection without umbrella. Durable. Expect it to last years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars QUALITY CONSTRUCTION!', 'author': 'James', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This jacket is such high quality construction!Pros:-PRICE!!! $$$-OUTSTANDING CONSTRUCTION!!!-Beautiful fabrication!-2-WAY ZIPPER! YES!!! Every coat should have a 2-way zipper! High quality snap placket to hide zipper! High quality zipper!-Hood-not too big or too small (hood cannot be removed, if that is important to you)-Deep pockets!-Warmth without weight! Perfect transition coat! (depending on where you live, this coat may suit you year round. The FLEECE lining (not an easy thing to find) is so comfortable and just the right weight/warmth. Personally, a Sherpa lining is too hot for me.-Repels water-Cinched, adjustable waist-Flattering fit-Perfect length. I am 5‚Äô11‚Äù tall and weigh 235 lbs. I have long arms and a long torso. This coat covers my bottom completely and hits about 8‚Äù above my knees. I ordered the 3X and it fits perfectly. I normally wear a size 18, but find Amazon clothing runs at least 2 sizes smaller than U.S. sizes.-Love the notch at center back hem to add style-Sleeves are generous in fit and also in length. Sleeves that are too restrictive in the upper arms are always an issue for me. Not with this coat.-Not at all restrictive in shoulders-No unattractive ‚Äúlogo‚Äù embroidered on the coatCONS:-Fleece lining in sleeves. Why? Wish sleeves were polyester/tricot lined. It is hard to get your arm in the sleeves when wearing long sleeved tops.-Sizing is inconsistent. Navy is more generous than the black (ordered navy and black). Tags sewn into neckline are even different on the navy and the black. Why??? They should be identical.-Velcro on sleeve hem is annoying. For some reason, the black coat does not have Velcro on the sleeve hem, which I am happy about. I removed the Velcro on the navy coat. It serves no purpose and attracts lint and when you don‚Äôt use it, the Velcro shows and it is scratchy and unattractive.I would give this 5 stars if it weren‚Äôt for the fleece lining in the sleeves, the Velcro on the sleeve hem and inconsistent sizing. I have been searching for a coat like this for years! The pros far outweigh the cons. Wish there was a dark, chocolate brown option.I hope this review will help others who are debating whether or not to order this coat.I don‚Äôt think you will be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Chest size was tight.', 'author': 'Joan Becker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this jacket in XL. I am 191# and 5‚Äô6 1/2. The XL was very tight across my chest and I am not well endowed. I had to return it and order a XXL. That size works well, though a little large in the shoulders. I‚Äôll still keep it because I like the length as well as the built in fleece lining. It‚Äôs warm and yet lightweight. I love the blue/gray color. I‚Äôll be taking this jacket on our cruise to Alaska. The weight of the jacket will be perfect for glacier viewing!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect in every way!', 'author': 'HappyHappyCamper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a lightweight but warm enough coat for a fall trip to the mountains. Having it water resistant a plus for those dewy morning hikes. This coat delivered in spades. Not only lightweight enough to roll into a backpack, it provided plenty of warmth with the soft lining (also used as a pillow to sleep on the flight home). It has velcro tabs to tighten down the sleeves and waist adjustments on both sides on the inside to cinch the waist closer to your body. The zipper is solid and there is a snap flap over for added protection from the elements. Wonderful pockets, even deep ones on the inside, to carry everything. The length is perfect and I bought the smoky blue, which is beautiful. I really love this coat and at such as great price, highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars this may be my favorite coat ever', 'author': 'befree', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was fully prepared to return this coat if it looked silly on my 4\'11" frame - the length might have been too extreme, or the sleeves drooping over my hands. I bought a medium to leave plenty of room for bulky sweater underneath To my surprise, the sleeves are just fine! They have elastic at the wrists inside, and an adjustable velcro strip on the outside. The length is longer than a car coat, comes to a few inches above my knees, but the length appears sleek and natural. There\'s an internal drawstring at the waist that I haven\'t quite figured out yet, but the coat is actually flattering even without a defined waist. The label says it has "4 way stretch," which may be only a little bit because I don\'t really feel a lot of stretch, but I guess it\'s just enough for a flattering fit. I can choose to zip, or just use the snaps. The hood is attached, and I was pleasantly surprised that it covered my head without drooping over to obscure my vision. And it has 2 huge internal pockets, big enough for a wallet, cell phone, and pair of gloves. It was drizzling outside this morning, so I put on the coat and stood outside - yes, it\'s waterproof! Lined with fleece, I think it will be perfect for a trip to cold, rainy Europe this winter, and sophisticated enough for museums and restaurants. The hood and fleece lining do not detach. I am VERY happy with this coat!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Don't wear in the rain!", 'author': 'K Perez-T', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This jacket is really nice, light weight, lined and warm. Love the interior pockets, and the exterior zippered pockets. BUT... says water resistant and water proof.... NOT! This jacket is a sponge, and you will end up walking around with 10 extra pounds of soaked up water in this jacket. Only get this if you want a windbreaker type jacket that is nice looking and lined and it's NOT raining.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit', 'author': 'JandAM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve ordered so many variations of rain jackets for my multi day hike and this one is a keeper. It fits beautifully. It‚Äôs not too long but long enough to cover my bottom, which I wanted especially if it rains. It zips from both directions. It is lightly lined so it keeps me warm but is t too hot to walk in. I plan to carry a waterproof poncho if there is a downpour but this will be my travel jacket from now on. I‚Äôve bought so many that were just too short and too tight everywhere except the arms making me look like a line backer. This fits great and is sporty enough to wear on a hike but sleek enough to wear out for dinner. I‚Äôm buying another in another color. Finally, I found my match.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Waterproof but not very warm.', 'author': 'NEWONENOW', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I wish there was more of a lining for warmth in this coat. I live in the Northeast and there are days that the cold wind goes right through you. I would say that it's completely waterproof. No complaints there. I don't like to dress in heavy clothing like sweaters or sweatshirts because then I get too hot when I'm indoors. Guess I'll have to dress in layers all winter. Hot flashes are not fun. Overall, I liked the coat and kept it. I'll probably look for another with more of a warm lining that's also waterproof for next season. I'll be able to donate this one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women's Mid-Length Puffer Hooded Down Jacket with Drawstring Packing Bag
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Kept me stylin‚Äô through the Icelandic winter', 'author': 'AA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hands down one of the best purchases I have ever made on Amazon. This jacket kept me warm in weather with a -15 degree windchill, and it is super cute and flattering. Whenever I got extra cold, popping the hood on seemed to solve everything and pairing it with a neck gator proved to be the wombo combo needed to explore Iceland in the winter. The fact that this jacket can be packed into a little pouch about 5‚Äù x 8‚Äù is just the cherry on top, and also super convenient not having to wear it throughout the airport. Also, I have huge shoulders from taking my stresses out at the gym instead of proper therapy. This jacket was roomy enough to not only encompass those bad boys, but the multiple layers of long sleeves and sweaters underneath. Its length is very cute, not to mention practical, and I will absolutely keep using this jacket for Boston winters too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great coat!', 'author': 'Pumpkinlover', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am so glad I purchased this coat. I purchased it for a overseas trip during the winter. It's been the ideal traveling coat, because I can fit it in a small bag and store it in a backpack if needed. I was concerned about the arm length, as I have long arms and frequently things are too short. However, I purchased a medium (which is my typical size) and I am very pleased that the sleeves are long enough. It ended up being the perfect size, I can wear several layers under it, but it doesn't look too big alone either. I have worn this coat in weather as cold as 20 degrees Fahrenheit and found it sufficient with moderate activity (walking quickly). I do wear several layers when it's that cold, but would do that regardless of the coat I was wearing. It goes to my mid thigh, and this adds to the warmth of the coat. I found the first feather from this coat the other day, it does not shed them frequently. I'm also pleased that this coat has a hood. I purchased this coat in black. It can be easily dressed up or down if needed. This is not the first down coat that I have purchased, but it is the first one that I have kept. I highly recommend purchasing this coat. I am very pleased.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super Light, Warm and Packable', 'author': 'GinBean', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered this product for an upcoming vacation to areas with varying climates. We have to pack light, so I needed a light but warm jacket with a hood. This was to replace an old LLBean lightweight down coat I\'ve had for 10 years that now has a dysfunctional zipper. The coat fits perfectly (true to size). The "Eiffel" color is great; a neutral steel gray, not too dark or dull looking. What\'s most impressive is that this coat is super light, and yet feels very warm. I\'ve yet to test it in colder temperatures but that will happen soon. I also love that on me (5\'4") this coat falls to the thigh area so it will keep my back and hips covered and warm. Other coats I considered were shorter in length. Overall, a well made, stylish coat, perfect for what I need and at an incredibly low price. It\'s 4 stars vs. 5 only because it hasn\'t been weather tested yet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful coat', 'author': 'Alice', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was really nervous to buy this coat online without trying it on since many of the reviews conflicted about the fit but I'm glad I did. Got it for a great price too. I've been trying on coats like this in size medium and purchased a medium and it fits perfect. And looks better than all the coats I tried on. It's a fitted coat and and tapers a bit at the waist. The arms are just a touch tight when I raise my arms but not uncomfortable. It's thin and soft and made of real down. I like that it's not shiny or metallic. It's kept me warm so far but hasn't been that cold yet. I would say it's great for a winter day but maybe not in freezing weather. I'm about 5 ft 7 in and about 150 lbs and got the medium. But I like my clothes more fitted and not loose.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great coat for the $', 'author': 'aaustad', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I originally found this exact coat at tjmaxx for $79, it was exactly what I have been looking for , for a long time. Only issue was that it was a small, they didn't have any xs. I bought it anyway hoping it wouldn't look too big. When I got home I searched amazon and low and behold, here it is and its available in xs! Figured I would order it since they have free returns and if it didn't work out, nothing lost. The xs is what I needed after all. So tjmaxx will get the small back. It was $99 on amazon but still a good deal when shopping around for this style. The coat is extremely warm! Even though I haven't tested it in our MN winter yet. It's the perfect length and love the removable hood. The plum lining is nice but black would have been better. The sleeves are pretty long but can either be altered or cuffed.overall I would highly recommend this coat. Hoping that material is strong and doesn't rip easily. Seems oddly tough considering how light weight it is.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, thin, nice', 'author': 'Anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love it, but this cute jacket doesn't fit for me", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Very light weight and stylish but arrived with a hole', 'author': 'Jen', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The style is very nice and I could imagine it being very packable and warm however as others mentioned the liner fabric is thin. It arrived with a hole in it and down was coming out. I returned no problem but decided to not reorder as I thought the fabric was too delicate and not sure how well it would hold up in the long run.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'DD Keeley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very happy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight', 'author': 'Chx', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Packs nicely in the bag provided. Its really lightweight. I think it can still fit into small pouch so it will be less bulky', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente elecci√≥n', 'author': 'Eliana C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Es como se ve en la referencia, es acolchada y caliente, y efectivamente se puede guardar sin problema en la bolsita que trae. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for year round weather', 'author': 'Jami', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love my new coat! title: Women's Winter Warm Thicken Long Outwear Pockets Coat Parka Jacket XS-XXL
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality coat', 'author': 'T. S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was not expecting to like or keep this but when it arrived it surprised me! The fabric is substantial and it‚Äôs actually heavier than I thought but I think that‚Äôs good. It‚Äôs a very warm coat and the sleeves have cuffs. The zipper is substantial and works smoothly. The pockets are a nice size and close with a magnet. I was replacing a coat I lost. This coat is actually more flattering than the one I had. The length hits in the mid thigh and it fits slim not bulky. It zips without bulging and fits the body without looking like a huge puffer coat. I got the black and I love the black fur so much better than tan/brown I had before. Plus the hood is not oversized like so many coats. I had been looking at Macys and this coat is every bit as nice as coats I saw for over $200. I got a coupon for this one so the price was amazing for the quality. Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars beautiful stylish warm winter down alternative coat - perfect for cold winter temps!', 'author': 'Anja', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered this jacket last minute for a winter trip to Iceland. Did not expect much, but I wanted something longer to keep me warm and a down alternative.This jacket did impress me greatly!It passed the arctic winter test in Iceland, with heavy cold winds and temperatures around minus 10-15 Celsius! I also wore a hooded fleece jacket underneath for extra warmth and it was perfect. It kept the wind and the cold out, just absolutely amazing!!L is perfect for my size and some extra room inside (I am 5 feet 4 inches and weigh about 170 pounds and have a larger bust). I would say it is true to size. It looks good and slimming on. It has magnetic hidden buttons for the pockets which work great, but I would rather have zippers for extra security.The hood is kind of big, so be sure to wear an extra hat or hoodie underneath. And it does not have any additional drawstrings or something to adjust it around the head...Other than that, I just love the jacket so much!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect COAT!', 'author': 'Esther', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I loved the look, color, and the fit. Smooth material just like Lululemon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice, but not a Define dupe', 'author': 'JEK', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Once you own LLL Defines nothing else will due. Sorry. It‚Äôs the truth. If you‚Äôre looking for a Define, then just go for it and you‚Äôll be happier. I have three newer cropped defines and who knows how many regular ones. I wanted white, but hate to drop another $100 on a jacket that is so seasonal and prone to showing wear and dirt. So I tried this CZY brand.Anyhow, this is a NICE jacket but it‚Äôs not LLL. If I never had Defines this would be a keeper, but it lacks the nice tailoring and silhouette of the Define. It‚Äôs lighter weight which could be desirable in warmer climates. To me it is not as high end looking, and for $40 that‚Äôs to be expected. I personally like the polished, sleek look of Defines so much better and for like $50 more I‚Äôd rather have a jacket that I feel lovely in. I don‚Äôt workout in my Defines but I would wear this to workout over a tank or whatever. I didn\'t know how to describe it here so I searched online and this pretty much explains it: "Puckering is a defect in sewing which makes the stitching line look gathered or bunched up in isolated places or irregular intervals"That\'s what was happening on the front facing part of the right shoulder. And that\'s when I knew it had to go back. The jacket looked good on paper but it is obviously cheaply and sloppily made. Obviously, not worth the $57 dollars they charge for it!Today I went to Kohls and bought a Vera Wang blazer which fit me like a glove. title: Women's Lightweight Warm Jacket Running Insulated Water Resistant Fall Jackets Winter Hiking Hybrid Puffer Coat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Must-Have for Fall Outdoor Activities and Travel', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the BALEAF Women's Lightweight Warm Jacket, and I'm thrilled to share my positive experience with this versatile and stylish piece of outerwear. It provides the right amount of warmth without feeling bulky, allowing for ease of movement during various outdoor pursuits. The jacket's insulation is effective in keeping me comfortably warm during cooler temperatures, making it ideal for running, hiking, or any outdoor adventure.One standout feature is the water-resistant material, which has proven to be reliable in light rain and misty conditions. This added element of protection ensures that I stay dry and comfortable, even if the weather takes an unexpected turn. The jacket's water-resistant properties have been particularly handy during my early morning runs when dew is common.The thoughtful design details, such as the adjustable hood and elastic cuffs, contribute to a customizable fit that enhances both comfort and functionality. The jacket's sleek and modern aesthetic also makes it a versatile choice for everyday wear, not just for outdoor activities.Durability is another notable aspect of the BALEAF Women's Lightweight Warm Jacket. The quality of materials and construction suggests that it will withstand regular use and maintain its performance over time. This durability is a crucial factor for those who lead an active lifestyle.In conclusion, if you're in search of a reliable, lightweight, and water-resistant jacket for fall, the BALEAF Women's Lightweight Warm Jacket is a fantastic choice. It has become my go-to outerwear for various activities, providing the perfect balance of warmth, style, and functionality. The cut is super flattering, especially for curvier figures, but would really fit all body types as it's got such great stretch in the whole back/hips and sleeves. This means the jacket moves with you superbly without feeling restrictive at all -- great for all kinds of sports from fall through spring. I will wear this for hiking, walking, cycling as well. title: Women's Rain Jacket Plus Size Long Raincoat Lightweight Hooded Windbreaker Waterproof Jackets with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good rain jacket', 'author': 'Khrys', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The jacket fits very well. I ordered my usual clothing size. The fabric is a bit thin, so I would not use this jacket as an extra layer of warmth. The length is great - it covers my backside and the top of my thighs. I plan to use it in Europe next week and the forecast calls for rain every day, so I‚Äôll update my review if I have any problems.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Travel treat', 'author': 'Orange GMA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I travel quite a bit. The chemical smell of this was overwhelming out of the bagAll that said, there are some nice details - the style is cute, the hood is lined, the ties at the waist make for a flattering fit, there are small metal details on the hood and waist drawstrings, the length is great.I‚Äôm torn on whether I‚Äôll keep or return - got it on sale but could probably get something more functional/substantial.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This runs true to size so order by largest area bust or hip will fit perfect!', 'author': 'Brett A.Thompson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is really nice, looks great and is similar to ones I have seen for 3 x the price. I am a size 18/20 with pear shape and this fits perfect in the size 20 with some room to spare for sweater etc... order by the size of your largest body part, bust, stomach or hip, and it will fit perfectly in your regular dress size or pants size. No need to order 2 sizes larger. It has a nice pull at the waist to keep the jacket figure flattering and secure if you zip it closed, is water repellant. Only complaint is that unlike some of the more expensive thin travel rain coats of this type are that it is hot, wearing in the rain in summer. Would be ok for fall or perfect for hiking into the evening when it gets cool or camping, but it will be extra warm and unbearable in Florida rain or the humidity in the east coast and Midwest summers. Would be better for California west coast summers. That being said, this is a solid travel rain coat light, solid fabric and nice details and is attractive on. For the price it is worth it. However, if you are traveling during the summer in Europe you may want a more expensive thin waterproof breathable fabric rain jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Seam Ripped First Thing Out of Package', 'author': 'Michele', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Ok, I know you get what you pay for but come on. title: Raincoat Women Waterproof Long Hooded Trench Coats Lined Windbreaker Travel Jacket S-XXL
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fashionable rain jacket', 'author': 'F. M. Worth the money. Not worn in a down pour yet but it doesn't say it protects you from pours just light rain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice light jacket', 'author': 'snowgirl41', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really cute, bright apple green raincoat. Bought a medium so I could wear layers underneath for warmth if needed. It feels true to size. It‚Äôs got everything I needed. Pockets, hood, waist tie, and will help keep the wind at a minimum. It‚Äôs soft and below the hips which I wanted. I bought it for walking early in the AM in the cold and wind. It‚Äôs bright and will help cars see me since there are no sidewalks.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Would I buy this again? Maybe‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Rebecca morton', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I bought this jacket for my summer trip to Ireland and Scotland. I am so glad I did because it rained every single day. Some days we had passing sprinkles, others it was basically monsoon season. Im usually a Large, but got an XL so I could layer the jacket with a hoodie. The Large would have worked fine for this, the XL was almost too big. There were lots of pros and cons, here are mine.Pros:- It kept me dry. We were in all kinds of weather and this jacket kept me dry. Obviously this is important as far as rain coats go.- It was nice and long. I have a long torso so I absolutely despise clothing that leaves a gap every time I bend over to tie my shoe or pick up something from the floor. This jacket‚Äôs length was perfect.- The pockets are a good size! I was able to fit my keys, wallet and passport in just one pocket.- The zipper and ties worked without issues. The zipper was easy to attach and detach, the quality was fine, and never jammed on other fabric while using it. The ties had metal ends and the cords was a good quality.- The jacket had a decent weight to it. It wasn‚Äôt so heavy you felt weighed down in it like a winter coat might. But it wasn‚Äôt so light that the wind could blow it up, and it was windy!- The hood was plenty deep! It covered my entire head and was deep enough to shield my face.Cons:- The jacket material is thin enough to see the liner through it. When I opened it, at first glance I wanted to return it. I wasn‚Äôt impressed that the you can see the liner thru the outer layer of the coat. It was disappointing.- The color didn‚Äôt match the photo. The pink is more of a tan-ish pink.- I was gentle with the snaps. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the snaps worked great, but I was gentle unsnapping the coat because I was worried about ripping the fabric. It could have been that, because the fabric was see through I didn‚Äôt feel it was strong enough to just pull the snaps apart all willy-nilly.- The hood didn‚Äôt have a lot of structure. While it was deep enough, the edging/ opening didn‚Äôt have a lot to it so unless it was tied tight around the face, it would just kind of blow in the wind. And if it‚Äôs really windy, the edge would just continually slap against your face, which was annoying.- The ties at my waist worked, but they left a weird flap, which you can see in the video. The stitching should have gone all the way to the zipper. Since it doesn‚Äôt, when you tighten the waist ties, you‚Äôre left with the weird flaps and it makes you feel almost dumpy. I tired pulling the all the extra material to the back, but with normal wear it shifts to a natural position and you end up with the flaps.- The jacket doesn‚Äôt breathe. The lining is 100% polyester, plus the plastic/rubbery outside meant you will sweat. In colder temps that‚Äôs not a huge deal, but we were in and out of buildings so I was constantly zipping and unzipping to regulate my body temp.Overall it‚Äôs not a bad rain jacket for the price. If I bought it again I‚Äôd get a darker color, hopefully the lining wouldn‚Äôt be as obvious, and id fix the weird flaps in front.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great golfing rain jacket.', 'author': 'patricia Belmar', 'rating': 5, 'content': "great quality for the money, great fit. wards off water. light weight. doesn't interfere with play. good deal", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely waterproof...', 'author': 'C. Valdez', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought this coat to wear during a vacation in Alaska this summer. I brought it with me for a bear finding excursion in Hoonah as it was overcast and looking to rain. The coat was super lightweight and I was able to pack it into my camera bag easily and without much extra weight at all.After a long drive into Tongass Nat'l Forest, we finally saw a brown bear. We all got out and watched and photographed it from a safe distance for a while. Then we headed back to the port...on a winding, bumpy, unpaved road and at an unnecessary, slightly high rate of speed. The scopolamine patch I was wearing behind my ear couldn't even slightly lessen the motion sickness that came over me. Despite several minutes of trying to convince myself that I was fine, and despite many silent bargaining attempts with any higher powers that be, I quickly came to realize there was no stopping it. I was going to throw up. Sitting in the second to last row of the van with the knowledge that if I tried to talk I'd probably vomit instead, I knew I had about 30 seconds to find some sort of receptacle. All I had on me was my camera bag, and that was filled with expensive equipment that I was not about to get sick on.Then I remembered - I've got my raincoat! My ridiculously cute, red raincoat that I haven't even gotten to wear yet. With no time to debate any other options, I pulled it out of my bag, folded it up, and quietly threw up into it. Three times. My family had the driver pull over, my daughter took the coat and basically shook it out, folded it up and stuck it in a box in the back of the van. Zero leaks, zero odor in the van on the remaining drive back to port - if not for my family asking to pull over, no one would've even known I got sick.I ended up throwing the coat away in port - I realized it'd probably be cheaper to buy a new one than pay the laundering fee and huge (well deserved) tip to housekeeping for washing it.The coat fit beautifully, was adorable and lightweight, and absolutely waterproof. Highly recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great looking rain coat', 'author': 'BellaLou', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This fits so well and is really nice looking as well as being waterproof. I ordered the blue with a blue and white striped lining, It is not thin as some other reviews for other colors stated. I would highly recommend. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù, 130 lbs and ordered a medium. Fits perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Rainproof, lightweight, and warm enough!', 'author': 'Ebeth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wore this on my two week tour of Ireland and Scotland in July. It was tested quite a bit. It folded up nice and small to fit in my day bag when it wasn't raining and it is pretty lightweight. It kept me dry through the misty/drizzly rains AND the downpour rains. I was worried that if the jacket became soaked, I would get wet too, but I didn't...and it got SOAKED. It also dries pretty fast which is a relief on a fast paced tour! There was a day we found ourselves in a down pour and my pants did get super wet in the knees where the coat was draining as I was walking, but I was so impressed with how dry I was under the coat. I will say, on the downpour day, the pockets got wet if I put my hands in them, so plan ahead for a place to stash your things under the jacket. Otherwise, I was glad for the pockets and used them frequently. It works well as a windbreaker too and helped to keep the chill away, but I was glad to have a wool sweater layer on the chilliest windy days. I ordered a size up and am glad I did as layers were a must. I love that it cinches in the waist to show your figure. My only complaint is that the hood was a little too big at times...even with it tied it blocked my vision. I'm glad it tied for that was absolutely needed in windy places. This is a great rain jacket!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Love the look but zipper broke', 'author': 'Emily', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I used this jacket about 10-15 times and loved the look and lightweight feel! title: Women's Powder Lite Hooded Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dusty Pink is the Powder Lite Jacket, as Advertised', 'author': 'Amanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was a little wary to buy this item after seeing all the reviews mentioning it wasn\'t the powder lite jacket. I noticed that all those reviews were for the wine berry color, and I knew the dusty pink was only offered as part of the powder lite line so I went ahead and ordered it--and I received the correct item.Everything was as shown in the description. It has a shiny omniheat lining, the color is accurate, and is hooded. I bought this so I\'d have a packable jacket for snowshoeing, and this was perfect. It kept me warm and dry in an intense sleet-filled snow storm while I was trekking around. I was also able to easily roll it up tightly and stuff it in an already full backpack when I didn\'t need it.I read reviews saying this runs small, and so I sized up since I wanted to be able to layer underneath it. I\'m 5\'5", 125lbs, and my measurements are 34-27-37. I\'m a small/4 in most brands, but I went with a medium for this jacket. The medium is perfect--it\'s slightly fitted, but roomy enough to fit a thick sweater or multiple thin layers underneath it. For snowshoeing, I had on a bodysuit, thin turtleneck, running hoodie, and hardshell rain jacket all underneath it at one point and I was still very comfortable and not constricted. While a small would probably fit, I don\'t think I\'d be able to get any layers underneath, and a large would have been straight up baggy.I really recommend this jacket. I\'m very happy with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light weight for hikes', 'author': 'RG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this jacket for daughter as a gift. She loved it! She does some Spring mountain hikes and this jacket will be perfect. Runs a little on the small side if planning for a sweatshirt underneath, however ordering a size up worked well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very happy with this purchase', 'author': 'Midna.Shadow.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this coat! Somehow it manages to keep so warm while also be super lightweight so that you don't feel bunchy. I probably could have gotten an XL so that I could fit a sweater or thicker clothing underneath, but a L seems to work just fine. I have yet to need anything more than a long sleeve shirt underneath to feel plenty warm in the winter. It's a little bit tight in the chest, but that's pretty common because I am larger chested. I would maybe recommend considering sizing up if you're built the same", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket, Odd Sizing', 'author': 'Cindylou', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I don't know why I continue to buy women's Columbia jackets. Yet they are well made, keep me warm and the outer shell is more durable than some higher priced competitors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful color and warm jacket', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered a Large based off the reviews I read. title: Women's Plus Size Zip-up Fleece Hoodie, EcoSmart Midweight Hooded Sweatshirt
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy!', 'author': 'Patrica Foster', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Although my feelings were hurt as to how HUGE it looked when I held it up but it fits perfect. I am 5‚Äô7 176 lbs. It isnt thin and flimsy. I always order XL because of a slightly large bust. Just a c cup . It‚Äôs so soft, warm, VERY WELL MADE. The zipper is awesome. Love the pockets. I‚Äôve seen others twice the price with not so great reviews. And it doesn‚Äôt LOOK huge at all. (The hood lays down nice so you don‚Äôt look like a hunchback or a linebacker.)Decided to chance it and try this one. So glad I did. I‚Äôll be ordering another. I got purple this time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Basic hoodie', 'author': 'Shaggy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have tons of hoodies, but I wanted one where it has a zipper and they didn\'t have that. I wanted a basic black hoodie so I can wear at work and it would go with my uniform.This one is overall pretty good. I\'m not 100% pleased with it, maybe about 9.99% (through no fault of the hoodie).....it was "just a smidge" on the small size for me. I was just too lazy to return it, so I kept it. I know it\'s probably difficult to determine how the sizing will be right for you. So if Amazon gives you the recommendation of what size could fit you based on your measurements, I would pick a size larger. That is, if you\'re like me and like to swim in your hoodies. If you want a more snug and tidy fit, then go with the recommendation. Hope that helps...?When I got it, it was a perfect fit for my body. I would\'ve rather have a slightly baggier size, like I said, but it was fine after wearing it a few times. Looks more professional anyway. The wrist area in the sleeves was tight at first, but I broke them in by stretching them some. The waist area is quite roomy.It\'s overall pretty good. No drawstrings for the hood part as per another person has said. But it is soft and it\'s got a decent black color, not faded or off. The zipper is black. I wouldn\'t consider it thick, but it is lightweight and somewhat warm. It\'s definitely kept me warm and snuggly at work. I really like it, it was a decent price. If I could buy it again, I would. I just know next time... I will buy a bigger size :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A bit short', 'author': 'Bree Jager', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love this hoodie. Its a good weight, the inside is really soft, the color is vibrant and beautiful, even the zipper is nice. I, on the other hand, am tall/long. This hoodie is not. It fit around me perfectly... but when zipped, it does ride up to show off my belly. I wear layers so no one actually sees anything, but I feel like I am constantly pulling it down.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy Hoodie', 'author': 'Mary A. Wilson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love the purple color but even more, I love how soft it is. It's great for a light weight jacket in cooler weather and a great cuddle jacket for indoors in the depth of winter.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 5 stars! Plus size with normal size arms!! Perfect zip up sweatshirt!!', 'author': 'John and Amber', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Five stars ALL DAY. Here‚Äôs the thing about plus size clothes‚Ä¶ Sometimes (oftentimes), especially when ordering a sweatshirt, we like to order up a size or two so that the sweatshirt, or whatever cozy item we order, is extra cozy, loosefitting, oversized, etc. The problem that plus size women run into is when ordering up, everything else tends to be a lot bigger including the shoulders, the arms, the wrists, the length of the pants or arms of shirt or whatever it is that you‚Äôre ordering. This is a huge problem I run into when ordering a size up or just when ordering plus size clothes in general.Manufacturers tend to think that plus size women have gigantic or super long arms and extremely long legs. The truth is, a lot of us plus size women are shorties and you can absolutely be petite and plus size!The GREAT thing about this zip up hoodie is that it has normal size arms and wrists! It‚Äôs a normal length. The length of the arms is normal. I‚Äôm thrilled. I‚Äôm so pleased, in fact, that I am ordering another one literally right now. I have the blue one in my cart. This ‚Äújust my size‚Äù brand is great. They really understand the fact that just because you‚Äôre heavier in the chest and waist and butt/thigh area, does not mean that you have super gigantic arms and wrists, and it does not mean that you have super long arms or super long legs. I really appreciate a plus size company that understands this. I will specifically look for this brand more often and purchase from this brand more often because of this fact.Now onto this specific sweatshirt- I got the white one despite the fact that I have a toddler because I love white sweatshirts. It came crisp and clean. The inside is super super super cozy. Like the softest fleece kind of feeling ever. More importantly for me, it‚Äôs very light weight. I get overheated very easily. So I absolutely love when I can find something long sleeve or a sweatshirt that is lightweight and doesn‚Äôt make me feel like I‚Äôm dying of heat stroke. Plus I don‚Äôt like bulky sweatshirts and this is not bulky whatsoever.I did size up one size! I like my sweatshirts baggy, not fitted. Sizing up one size was perfect for me. If I had gotten my regular size, it would‚Äôve fit just fine but I like it baggy in the stomach area and hips and butt area. That‚Äôs exactly what I got with this sweatshirt. But guess what, despite the fact that I ordered up a size, the arms and wrists and lengths are still perfect and petite and normal. And because of that, the sweatshirt gets five stars. I would give it more if I could and I will definitely be buying more. Now I‚Äôm gonna go look for sweatpants. In sweatpants, I typically get my usual size so here‚Äôs hoping that the length is great on their brand sweatpants. I have no doubt it will be because the length was great on their sweatshirt arms.Thank you ‚Äújust my size‚Äú for understanding women‚Äôs plus size bodies and the fact that a lot of us have normal size legs and arms.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars No quality control for sizing', 'author': 'Quiltygal', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'A nice, basic sweatshirt made from soft material. title: Women's Lightweight Long-Sleeve Full-Zip Water-Resistant Packable Hooded Puffer Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Get this jacket! Especially if you are tall!', 'author': 'Erin Samuelsen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really needed something in between a sweatshirt and my heavy winter coat for those milder but still chilly days. I always have a very hard time finding jackets. I am tall and have long arms. Most jackets fit like a belly shirt with 3/4 sleeves. Not this one! The jacket sits right at my hips which is perfect and the sleeves actually come down to my wrists! It‚Äôs relatively warm. I usually wear a hoodie anyways, so with one hoodie and the jacket, I‚Äôm comfortable to about 30 degrees. If I later two sweatshirts, I can stand a smidge colder. But that‚Äôs perfect because that‚Äôs why I bought it. I‚Äôve got my big thick coat for when it‚Äôs really cold. This jacket is also very lightweight and can be stuffed into the little bag that comes with it, so if you are out and need to take it off, you don‚Äôt have to schlep a big bulky coat. It‚Äôs also pretty decent with being water resistant. It‚Äôs NOT a rain coat, so if you wear it in a downpour, you will still get soaked. But for a day when it‚Äôs drizzly, it does a good job keeping me dry. The hood fits really well and actually stays put too. One other thing, I like the material. It‚Äôs not one of those fabrics that list sounds and feels scratchy. It‚Äôs nice and soft and slick, but it‚Äôs not that kind of material that falls apart if you look at it funny either.Overall, a really fantastic lightweight jacket, especially if you are tall or have long arms.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very cute jacket', 'author': 'Susan Regan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The color of the jacket is very bright, which I like. The fit is good and it‚Äôs lightweight but warm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Jacket!!', 'author': 'RAMSJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am really impressed by this jacket. I needed a last minute packable puffer for a trip to Orlando(wasn‚Äôt expecting temps forecasted to be in the 50‚Äôs). I didn‚Äôt want to spend too much and most packable puffers cost $50 or more, were out of stock in stores (a few days before Xmas) or would not arrive in time for my trip. So, I checked Amazon and of course‚Ä¶they had what I needed. A great price and prime delivery. I didn‚Äôt know what to expect from an Amazon product line coat. But let me say, I love this jacket! It does not look cheap, has zipper pockets, an inside pocket, a hood and a packable bag attached to the inside. The best thing about it is the wrist cuffs‚Äîthey are slightly tapered and slightly stretchy. So they stay in place but you can push them up easily to check your watch. It will definitely be warm enough for 50 degree temps. I ordered one size up (I ordered a Large) but would normally wear a Medium jacket. The large fits good with room enough to wear a fleece or sweatshirt underneath. If I wasn‚Äôt planning to wear a fleece under it, the Medium would fit perfectly. I may order another color in a medium. For less than $30 and free delivery in 2 days, you seriously cannot go wrong!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Doesn‚Äôt fit into the bag, but folds down enough to be packable', 'author': 'Melissa', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought this jacket to take on a trip to Switzerland because we planned to be spending a fair amount of time in the mountains. Like other reviewers, I never could get the jacket into the bag that came with it. I think the sizing of the bag is off, so deducted a star for that since it does make the jacket less packable. Other than that, I found it to be very comfortable, warm, and not overly bulky. Plus the pink color is cute! While I wish it fit into the bag, it isn‚Äôt hard to fold down and roll to fit into a suitcase or backpack. With it being quite light, it is definitely a jacket I won‚Äôt mind toting on trips. I typically wear an XL and it seemed true to size, but I opted to keep the XXL just so I had extra room underneath for bulkier clothing like sweaters. If you don‚Äôt plan to wear anything thick underneath, order your normal size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon Essentials puffy jack works well here in Florida in the winter', 'author': 'JBF', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the Amazon essentials puffy jacket with hood thinking "How good can it be for that price?" But it is worth every penny and more as it fits well (some tapering at waist) and keeps me warm here for early morning walks when the temp is near 50o. Probably could get a thin vest under it for really cold places and the hood (which I don\'t use) comes up just high enough to keep my neck warm if the wind is blowing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Puffer jacket', 'author': 'Kathy Burnham', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered a medium. Runs true to size. Comfortable fit. Like that it is packable. Mildly puffy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Runs Very Small', 'author': 'Rene C', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Looks ok, but it runs very small, no way would I be able to wear a sweater under it. Sleeves are not very wide, feels more like Asian sizing than US standard sizing. Will give it to someone who will be able to move in it with something as a base layer.Disappointing!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket for casual use', 'author': 'JMT Cairn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I intend to use this jacket under a waterproof shell as an insulating layer. It needs to be big enough to add layers underneath and small enough to fit under the outer jacket. I am 5‚Äô8, about 140. I have wide shoulders and long arms which usually poses a problem with sizing. I ordered the size Medium. The jacket fits well but it too narrow in the shoulders and the sleeves are too short with arms extended. I understand this jacket is meant for casual use, not mountaineering. Still, I thought I would review some important parts of this jacket to help you make your decision. First, this grey color is a bit silvery but I like it. The jacket looks very nice; not overly puffy and not too flat. The inside of the jacket is lined with similar fabric as the outside - in other words, it does not have a brushed or fabric lining. There are two, deep pockets inside the jacket, along the zipper. They are plenty deep for, phones, keys etc‚Ä¶ probably even a 16oz water bottle! There are two zippered pockets outside which are deep enough to put your hands fully into beyond the wrist. The sleeves have a narrow elastic band at the wrist which seems sufficient. They are not adjustable. The hood is large and is not adjustable. This could be an important point for some. When zipped up all of the way, the zipper came to right below my chin. There is no zipper cover or cloth flap to keep the zipper from rubbing on your chin. There is no flap over or behind the zipper which could allow for wind to blow through or freezing of the zipper if exposed to snow/sleet. I don‚Äôt know if the zipper is water resistant like the fabric. I like most of the Amazon Basics stuff and this jacket did not disappoint. In this case, I will order a large to see how they compare in the shoulders and sleeves. It looks like a nice jacket for casual use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars packable, longer torso, 400 g jacket, 8 g travel bag, 3 g clip', 'author': 'Geode', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Amazon added a feature where you can put in your weight and other details and it will recommend a size for you. It recommended between a medium and a large for me. I wanted a snug fit so I got a medium. It did fit snugly like I want it. My weight varies between 130 and 150 pounds and I am now at the higher end of my weight. I am petite, 53, and big chested. I found the torso to be a tiny bit long, but that isn't a big deal for the price. Also my backside is a bit big and the jacket reaches a tiny bit onto it past my hips because of the longer torso. Rolling up the bottom a tiny bit shortens the torso and keeps the jacket off of my backside where it is too tight. I don't really like the color, but I was trying to spend as little as possible on this jacket so I got the cheapest color, which is probably the least desirable.Lots of people have asked about the weight of this jacket and have not gotten an answer. I put the jacket in a box to make it easier to weigh as it kept on coming unfolded, and then I subtracted the weight of the box from the total weight. I got 400 g for the medium jacket, 8 g for the travel bag, and 3 g for the clip making a total of 411 g for the entire set up. You would think that they would advertise the weight but they don't. You can see the shipping weight, but that is the weight of the entire package instead of the weight of the jacket. I will add a bit to the shipping week to make sure there is enough leeway. I have not been able to get it to fit in a travel bag. If you can get it to fit there I would encourage you not to store it in its travel bag because jackets and sleeping bags should not be stored in a compressed state, especially synthetic ones. I have tried really hard and can't do it. I'm not sure if I really need its travel back. I'm not an expert, but I believe it would be fine to put it in a backpack uncompressed and then use the compression straps as necessary. It is a huge like a sleeping bag where it could be helpful to have a stuff sack.I believe that if you are using this jacket as part of a proper layering system, you could be fine down to 20¬∞. Perhaps if you were wearing thermal underwear you would be fine a bit lower.. I was just thinking of having it with a moisture wicking long sleeve shirt well actively moving when making my 20¬∞ estimate. Without actively moving I would estimate you would need a light weight pullover fleece to get that same 20¬∞ and if you started moving with that set up you could get to 10¬∞ perhaps. Perhaps with thermal underwear, the shirt over it, the fleece pullover, and then this jacket you could make it below 0¬∞. It depends a lot on whether you are moving, what else you are wearing, and how cold you get. A lot of people are asking though so I thought I would try to estimate. With a sleeping bag it is a lot easier to get a temperature rating because someone is just sleeping. For something over 50¬∞ though, I think it might get too hot and it would be better to have a pullover fleece. I don't get cold that easily though. It would be interesting to see what others think of my estimates.I don't really know The purpose of the clip. The instructions also seem to indicate that you can wash it just the way you would wash any other type of clothing, but water resistant jackets normally need to be washed with a special detergent to maintain their waterproofing properties so I'm a bit confused about that. The only other problem I have with the jacket is that I wish it were a bit more breathable, but most jackets of this style have that problem. If your other clothing is breathable I think it would be fine. If I paid $300 for this jacket I would bump the rating down to three stars, but because I paid $30 for this jacket, the rating is four stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Quality warm coat', 'author': 'Do the Thing', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got this coat after being recommended it by a friend. For being so lightweight it is really warm! The pockets are large with zippers to close them, and the hood comes in handy for wind and rain protection. This coat is light enough that I can layer it under my big winter coat if needed and small enough that I can pack it in my backpack.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women‚Äôs Heated Jacket-Full Zip Fleece Jacket with Battery Pack
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm, great quality & perfect fit!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought this heated fleece jacket last winter and it was a perfect fit. I followed the sizing chart listed. The battery pack seemed a bit heavy and bulky at first, but then I got used to it right away and I barely notice it anymore. So cozy and keeps me warm when it's freezing out. I can feel the heat in the back as well as the front. I wish they could make a section in the collar to have heat for my neck. But overall happy with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect jacket - I'm in love! Highly recommend.", 'author': 'JRob', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this because I often feel frozen to my core in wintertime. I did a lot of research and chose this jacket based on the reviews AND on the fact that this jacket is mentioned in several "best heated jackets" articles and even in a few threads on Reddit. I often buy men\'s clothes because I don\'t like the thin, flimsy fabric a lot of women\'s clothes are made of. I ordered the women\'s version of this, half expecting to dislike it, return it, and get myself the men\'s version instead. However, it is PERFECT. It\'s not super heavy/bulky but the fabric has just the right density / substantial-ness to it and feels like it\'s made from quality materials. I ordered one size bigger than I normally would after reading other reviews and it fits me just right. I love that it has multiple heat settings and that the battery can be used for charging other things in a pinch if I need it. I cannot wait to wear this to work and actually be COMFORTABLE!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Toasty Triumph', 'author': 'Dwinkjr', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The DEWBU Heated Jacket is a winter game-changer! It's like wearing a warm hug that you can control. The soft shell exterior is as sleek as it is stylish, making me feel like a secret agent on a winter mission.The 12V battery pack is the unsung hero of this jacket. It's like having a personal fireplace that you can adjust to your liking. I've been out in the frostiest of conditions and this jacket has kept me toasty warm, making me question if I've secretly been transported to a tropical island.The electric heating coat is a marvel. It's like having your own personal sun, minus the harmful UV rays. I've never been so excited to go out in the cold, just to feel the warmth this jacket provides.In short, the DEWBU Heated Jacket for Women is a must-have for any winter wardrobe. It's the perfect blend of style, comfort, and warmth. If you're looking for a way to beat the winter chill, this jacket is your answer. It's a hot item in more ways than one!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks and performs great so far!', 'author': 'M. Reeves', 'rating': 4, 'content': "A wonderful game-changer so far! I regret waiting so many winters before buying a heated jacket, but I'm glad I bought from Ororo once I finally did! It looks nice, is easy to use, and is working well so far to keep my upper body feeling cozy warm when seated in a cold office environment. My mind is no longer distracted by the temperature and the heating elements in the back keep my shoulders relaxed! I am looking forward to also trying this jacket outside at night for a volunteer shift that will involve a lot of standing still in the cold, but no matter how that turns out it is working great as an indoor solution to a cold office! Depending on how durable it turns out to be over time, I might bump this review up to 5 stars.The only thing I'm uncertain about is whether I should have gone a size up or not. The unavoidable dilemma of online shopping! In unisex t-shirts, I normally fit in a Medium tshirt, and my hips/chest fell within the chart measurements for a Large in this women's jacket. The problem is my belly. The size Large of this that I bought fits me nicely when standing and it has the correct sleeve length for me, but it is a little snug around my belly when I'm seated. Since snugness is good for retaining warmth and it still zips closed when seated, I'm going to keep it but I might try the next size up when ordering other products from Ororo in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warrenty battery replacement 1 month in.', 'author': 'Silhyboy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Jacket is comfortable and well liked. The body of the jean jacked fit me perfectly in Size M, but the sleeves were too long to wear unrolled with the cuff buttoned and too tight for arm comfort, much better suited for someone with arms like Olive Oyl. Regrettably, I am returning the jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I liked the fit', 'author': 'Sher', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wasn‚Äôt sure when I bought if it was going to be too long in the sleeves. But it fit perfectly. It fit great in the shoulders. Just the right length. I love the stretch. I might buy another one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stretchy & comfy BUT diff colors have a different fit - check the material blend before ordering', 'author': 'Cyndy_B', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For reference, I\'m 5\'6" and ~135lbs with an athletic build. I got the pink in medium which fit perfectly. I wouldn\'t say this a true denim though, it\'s more like a light and incredibly stretchy cotton. Honestly, I wasn\'t expecting to like it as all the other denim jackets I\'ve tried have felt too restrictive with little stretch (I have broad shoulders) but this one is incredibly stretchy and extremely comfortable, that I was quite surprised. It is a little boxy though (no shaping darts), but I don\'t plan to wear it closed, so it doesn\'t matter. I did find it more comfortable to roll the sleeves since they were a tad long, but it added to the cute style of this jacket . I live in a warmer climates and this is a perfect for my needs (cooler nights or air conditioned offices). I\'ve worn it a few times already and it is starting to show a little wrinkling. I haven\'t washed it yet to know how it\'ll hold up. But I am already thinking about buying another color! Things to remember, it\'s lightweight, and very stretchy (at least the pink is) and treat it more as a layering piece or as an ensemble/accessory piece rather than a true \'coat\' or jacket. If you live somewhere with 4 seasons, it\'ll be best for Spring or early Fall.Update 1-4-23: I loved the pink one so much, I bought the Always Black in the same size. Oddly enough, the Always Black one was too small, scratchy and stiff - no stretch at all. Looking closer at the material for each color I noticed they\'re different. For instance, most are a blend of 71% cotton, 27% polyester and 2% spandex. But the Always Black is 97% cotton and 3% poly, without any spandex. So that made a huge difference. So be warned, depending on color and fabric, it may fit and feel different!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these Jackets', 'author': 'Angelaaa221', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love these jackets. I have three and that's probably enough. I wear large but it was a little tight in the arms so a XL was better. The first time exchange was easy breezy. No regrets. AA", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I'm small/med, went with small", 'author': 'RPandersons', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is an awesome jacket that I initially struggled over ordering b/c I was unsure of sizing and fit.I am writing this review to help someone torn btw getting the SML or MED. For reference, I am 5\'4", 130-135 lbs with a 34DD/E bust, long arms, narrow shoulders and hips. Jean size 27.Reading other people\'s reviews, I was surprised how many people have very similar, to exact, dimensions as me, yet how differently we all may want the jacket to fit depending how we plan to wear it.As a 52-year-old-post-partum-middle-aged-chick, I was looking for a narrow streamlined fit that would not add any bulk whatsoever to my frame. Also, I live in SoCal and did not plan to wear this over anything other than a tshirt, blouse or very thin dress or sweater. Also, I would wear this jacket totally open and unzipped 97% of the time, so I got the SMALL. When it is zipped and buttoned up all the way, the SMALL on me is a tight, but not binding, streamlined, almost a 1960s Mod Squad look. Truly fits like a glove and sleeve length is perfect.Had I ordered the Medium, I would have felt obligated to wear the jacket closed, over layers or a big sweater or hoodie; because totally open and unzipped, the front panels of the Medium would have hung and flapped around my body excessively (if that makes sense) and the shoulders would have drooped/been oversized, rounded, like a slouchy, casual 1990\'s fit. My teen daughter who is 5\'8 and a size 0-2 (so, a human clothes hanger) would probably get this very same jacket in a Medium or even a Large because she likes that oversized look, and can carry it off really well.I hope this review helps someone else with my proportions. I may order one in a MEDIUM in case I ever want room to really bundle-up with lots of other layers or a really thick sweater for much colder weather. But, I think if that happened I would just wear a longer coat to stay warm. Either way, it is a great purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and comfortable', 'author': 'A. Gift For You', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is of high quality and warm and stylish at the same time! I would need an XXL.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best coat ever!', 'author': 'Aliceson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I LOVE this coat! It‚Äôs warm, stylish, and the pockets are perfect!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Find! I absolutely love it!', 'author': 'Morgan Farris', 'rating': 5, 'content': "You never know what kind of quality you'll get on Amazon, and nowadays, it seems clothing quality is declining rapidly on the site. I am pleased to report that this jacket is the exception. It is high quality, well-constructed, comfortable, and most of all attractive. I live in Texas where winter is not arctic, but can certainly get chilly when it's a rainy, overcast day. So I wanted a jacket that would repel water and keep me warm without suffocating me. This is that jacket. It was rainy and 40¬∫ yesterday and this coat kept me perfectly comfortable and dry. I absolutely love it and feel like I found a diamond in the rough. It will transition well to the Spring rains and is versatile enough to be styled casually or more sophisticated. Highly recommend this jacket!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This hacket has stretch in it.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This rain coat is great. The jacket has stretch in it. It has a thin line of fleece on the back part to keep you warm. You will not regret your purchase!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cute jacket with one terrible design flaw.', 'author': 'SurfinVeggie', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This is a very chic raincoat. The color is beautiful and even the inner lining is fancy. It's warm and does not feel cheaply made. I love the little ruffles in the back that spruce it up. But- the hood. The hood is an issue. It does not stay up, and if you cinch it, it covers your whole face. Most rain coats have a way to cinch the hood and still have a bill out to protect your face. If you plan to use this with an umbrella- no problem. But, if this is all you have, either your head is getting wet, or you won't be able to see (or you better hope there's no wind so you can just flop the hood on without cinching it down).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Me gusta', 'author': 'Sencillo pero fuerte y se ve simp√°tico', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Me gusto es linda y un poquito pesada pero no demasiado. Excelente calidad. Talle perfecto', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]
